תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַגָּדוֹל אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר מִיל עַל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר מִיל, כְּנֶגֶד מַחֲנֵה יִשְׂרָאֵל, בַּת קוֹל מַשְׁמִיעַ וְאוֹמֵר: ״וַיָּמׇת מֹשֶׁה סָפְרָא רַבָּה דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל״. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: לֹא מֵת מֹשֶׁה, כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וַיָּמׇת שָׁם״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וַיְהִי שָׁם עִם ה׳״, מָה לְהַלָּן עוֹמֵד וּמְשַׁמֵּשׁ, אַף כָּאן עוֹמֵד וּמְשַׁמֵּשׁ.
״וַיִּקְבֹּר אוֹתוֹ בַגַּיְ בְּאֶרֶץ מוֹאָב מוּל בֵּית פְּעוֹר״. אָמַר רַבִּי בֶּרֶכְיָה: סִימָן בְּתוֹךְ סִימָן, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי: ״וְלֹא יָדַע אִישׁ אֶת קְבֻרָתוֹ״.
וּכְבָר שָׁלְחָה מַלְכוּת הָרְשָׁעָה אֵצֶל
llm_translation: Fulfilled this all that written in this.

If Moses did not engage with it - did the children of Israel not engage with it? And it is written: "And the bones of Joseph, which the children of Israel brought up from Egypt, they buried in Shechem"! And if the children of Israel did not engage with it - did his sons not engage with it? And it is written: "And the sons of Joseph became a possession"?!
They said: Leave it to him, his honor in the majority is greater than in the minority. And some say: Leave it to him, his honor in the great is greater than in the small.
"They buried him in Shechem." What is different about Shechem? Rabbi Hama son of Rabbi Hanina said: From Shechem they stole him, and to Shechem his lost item is returned.
The verses of Ahadad are difficult. It is written: "And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him." And it is written: "And the bones of Joseph, which the children of Israel brought up, etc."
Said Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina: Anyone who does a matter and does not complete it, and another comes and completes it - the Scripture credits him with having done it.
Rabbi Elazar says: Also they bring him down from his greatness, as it is written: "And it came to pass at that time that Judah went down."
Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: Even one who buries his wife and children, as it is written: "And the daughter of Shua, Judah's wife, died," and it is written: "And Er and Onan died."

Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Why was Yosef called "bones" in his lifetime? Because he did not erase the honor of his father, as they say to him, "Your servant our father," and he did not say to them, nor from his hand.
And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, and it was stated by Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina: Why did Joseph die before his brothers? Because he conducted himself with arrogance.
"And Joseph was brought down to Egypt." Rabbi Elazar said: Do not read "brought down" but "made to descend," for he caused Pharaoh's officers to descend from their greatness.

"And he bought him from Potiphar, Pharaoh's eunuch," Rav said: that he bought him for himself. Came (Gabriel) Michael and his minister, came Gabriel and Pharaoh. Initially it is written "Potiphar," and ultimately "Potiphera."

Talmudic text: Who is greater than us like Moses, etc. "And Hashem said to me, you have been great," Rabbi Levi said: With "רַב" (Rav) in straightforwardness, with "רַב" (Rav) in crookedness. With "רַב" (Rav) in straightforwardness - "great to you." With "רַב" (Rav) in crookedness - "great to you."
Another explanation: "Rav Lakh" - you have Rav, and "Manu" - Yehoshua.

Another explanation: "Rav Lach," that they should not say: the master is so difficult, and the student is so sluggish. And why all this? It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: According to the effort is the reward.

"And he said to them, 'I am a hundred and twenty years old today,' as the Talmud does not say 'today': 'Today my days and years have been completed.' To teach you that the Holy One, blessed be He, completes the years of the righteous from day to day and from month to month, as it is written: 'I will fulfill the number of your days.'"

"Cannot anymore to go out and to come in." What is "to go out and to come in"? If you say to go out and to come in literally, but it is written: "Moses was a hundred and twenty years old when he died, his eye was not dim," and it is written: "And Moses went up from the plains of Moab to Mount Nebo," and it was taught: There were twelve steps there, and Moses took them in one stride.
Said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said Rabbi Yonatan: To go out and come in with matters of Torah. Teaches that you have become accustomed to its gates of wisdom.
"And Moses went, and Joshua, and they stood in the Tent of Meeting." It was taught: On that Sabbath eve of the day of Zuggai, authority was removed from this one and given to that one.

Talmudic text: And it was taught, Rabbi Yehuda said: If not for the verse written, it would be impossible to say it. Where did Moses die? In the portion of Reuben, as it is written: "And Moses went up from the plains of Moab to Mount Nebo," and Nebo is in the portion of Reuben, as it is written: "And the sons of Reuben built... and Nebo..."
"Nevo" - where three prophets died: Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.

Talmudic text: And where is Moses buried — in the portion of Gad, as it is written: "And he saw the first for himself, etc." And from the portion of Reuben to the portion of Gad, how much is it — four mil. Who led him those four mil?

The text reads as follows: "Moses was hanging on the wings of the Divine Presence, and the ministering angels would say: 'The righteousness of the Lord He has performed, and His judgments with Israel.' And the Holy One, blessed be He, would say: 'Who will rise up for Me against evildoers? Who will stand up for Me against workers of iniquity?'"

Talmudic text: And Samuel said: "Who is like the wise, and who knows the interpretation of a matter," and Rabbi Yochanan said: "Where can wisdom be found," and Rav Nachman said: "And Moses died there," Symalyon said: "And Moses died there, the great scribe of Israel."

It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: Twelve mil by twelve mil, opposite the camp of Israel, a heavenly voice proclaims and says: "And Moses, the great scribe of Israel, died." And some say: Moses did not die, as it is written here: "And he died there," and it is written there: "And he was there with the Lord." Just as there he stands and serves, so too here he stands and serves.
"And he buried him in the valley in the land of Moab opposite Beth Peor." Rabbi Berachiah said: A sign within a sign, and even so: "And no man knows his burial place."
And as already sent the kingdom of wickedness to...

sentences.text: קִיֵּים זֶה כׇּל מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בָּזֶה.
sentences.human_translation: This fulfilled all that is written in this.
sentences.llm_translation: Fulfilled this all that written in this.

sentences.text: וְאִי לָא עֲסִיק בֵּיהּ מֹשֶׁה — יִשְׂרָאֵל לָא הֲווֹ מִיעַסְקִי בֵּיהּ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְאֶת עַצְמוֹת יוֹסֵף אֲשֶׁר הֶעֱלוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מִמִּצְרַיִם קָבְרוּ בִשְׁכֶם״! וְתוּ: אִי לָא אִיעֲסַקוּ בֵּיהּ יִשְׂרָאֵל — בָּנָיו לָא הֲווֹ מִיעַסְקִי בֵּיהּ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיִּהְיוּ לִבְנֵי יוֹסֵף לְנַחֲלָה״?!
sentences.human_translation: And if Moses had not dealt with would the Jewish people not have dealt with it? But isn’t it written “And the bones of Joseph, which the children of Israel brought up out of Egypt, they buried in Shechem” And furthermore, if the Jewish people had not dealt with would his children not have dealt with it? But isn’t it written “And they became the inheritance of the children of Joseph,”
sentences.llm_translation: If Moses did not engage with it - did the children of Israel not engage with it? And it is written: "And the bones of Joseph, which the children of Israel brought up from Egypt, they buried in Shechem"! And if the children of Israel did not engage with it - did his sons not engage with it? And it is written: "And the sons of Joseph became a possession"?!

sentences.text: אָמְרוּ: הַנִּיחוּ לוֹ, כְּבוֹדוֹ בִּמְרוּבִּים יוֹתֵר מִבְּמוּעָטִין. וְתוּ אָמְרוּ: הַנִּיחוּ לוֹ, כְּבוֹדוֹ בִּגְדוֹלִים יוֹתֵר מִבִּקְטַנִּים.
sentences.human_translation: They said: Leave It is more of an honor for by the many than by the few, And furthermore, they said: Leave It is more of an honor for by the great than by lesser ones
sentences.llm_translation: They said: Leave it to him, his honor in the majority is greater than in the minority. And some say: Leave it to him, his honor in the great is greater than in the small.

sentences.text: ״קָבְרוּ בִּשְׁכֶם״. מַאי שְׁנָא בִּשְׁכֶם? אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִשְּׁכֶם גְּנָבוּהוּ, וְלִשְׁכֶם נַחְזִיר אֲבֵידָתוֹ.
sentences.human_translation: they buried in Shechem, What is different about Shechem Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says kidnapped him from Shechem and to Shechem we should return his lost
sentences.llm_translation: "They buried him in Shechem." What is different about Shechem? Rabbi Hama son of Rabbi Hanina said: From Shechem they stole him, and to Shechem his lost item is returned.

sentences.text: קָשׁוּ קְרָאֵי אַהֲדָדֵי, כְּתִיב: ״וַיִּקַּח מֹשֶׁה אֶת עַצְמוֹת יוֹסֵף עִמּוֹ״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְאֶת עַצְמוֹת יוֹסֵף אֲשֶׁר הֶעֱלוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹ׳״!
sentences.human_translation: The verses contradict each other, it is written: “And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him” and it is written “And the bones of Joseph, which the children of Israel brought up
sentences.llm_translation: The verses of Ahadad are difficult. It is written: "And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him." And it is written: "And the bones of Joseph, which the children of Israel brought up, etc."

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: כָּל הָעוֹשֶׂה דָּבָר וְלֹא גְּמָרוֹ, וּבָא אַחֵר וּגְמָרוֹ — מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב עַל שֶׁגְּמָרוֹ כְּאִילּוּ עֲשָׂאוֹ.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: Anyone who performs a matter but does not complete it, and then another comes and completes it, the verse ascribes credit to the one who completed it as if he had performed
sentences.llm_translation: Said Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina: Anyone who does a matter and does not complete it, and another comes and completes it - the Scripture credits him with having done it.

sentences.text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אַף מוֹרִידִין אוֹתוֹ מִגְּדוּלָּתוֹ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי בָּעֵת הַהִיא וַיֵּרֶד יְהוּדָה״.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says He is also demoted [ moridin ] from his greatness, as it is written: “And it came to pass at that time, that Judah went down [ vayyered ]
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Also they bring him down from his greatness, as it is written: "And it came to pass at that time that Judah went down."

sentences.text: רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: אַף קוֹבֵר אִשְׁתּוֹ וּבָנָיו, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתָּמׇת בַּת שׁוּעַ אֵשֶׁת יְהוּדָה וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּמׇת עֵר וְאוֹנָן״.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says: also bury his wife and children as it is written: “And Shua’s daughter, the wife of Judah, died” and it is written but Er and Onan died
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: Even one who buries his wife and children, as it is written: "And the daughter of Shua, Judah's wife, died," and it is written: "And Er and Onan died."

sentences.text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מִפְּנֵי מָה נִקְרָא יוֹסֵף עֲצָמוֹת בְּחַיָּיו — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלֹּא מִיחָה בִּכְבוֹד אָבִיו, דְּקָאָמְרִי לֵיהּ ״עַבְדְּךָ אָבִינוּ״, וְלָא אֲמַר לְהוּ וְלָא מִידֵּי.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: For what was Joseph called: Bones, during his lifetime, Because he did not protest for the honor of his father, as said to “Your servant our father” and said nothing to them
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Why was Yosef called "bones" in his lifetime? Because he did not erase the honor of his father, as they say to him, "Your servant our father," and he did not say to them, nor from his hand.

sentences.text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִפְּנֵי מָה מֵת יוֹסֵף קוֹדֶם לְאֶחָיו — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִנְהִיג עַצְמוֹ בְּרַבָּנוּת.
sentences.human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says Rav says, and some say Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina: For what did Joseph predecease his brothers, Because acted authoritatively,
sentences.llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, and it was stated by Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina: Why did Joseph die before his brothers? Because he conducted himself with arrogance.

sentences.text: ״וְיוֹסֵף הוּרַד מִצְרָיְמָה״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״הוּרַד״ אֶלָּא ״הוֹרִיד״, שֶׁהוֹרִיד אִיצְטַגְנִינֵי פַּרְעֹה מִגְּדוּלָּתָן.
sentences.human_translation: “And Joseph was brought down [ hurad ] to Egypt” Rabbi Elazar says: Do not read “ hurad ,” but horid , as brought down the astrologers [ itztagninei ] of Pharaoh from their eminence
sentences.llm_translation: "And Joseph was brought down to Egypt." Rabbi Elazar said: Do not read "brought down" but "made to descend," for he caused Pharaoh's officers to descend from their greatness.

sentences.text: ״וַיִּקְנֵהוּ פּוֹטִיפַר סְרִיס פַּרְעֹה״, אָמַר רַב: שֶׁקְּנָאוֹ לְעַצְמוֹ. בָּא (גַּבְרִיאֵל) [מִיכָאֵל] וְסֵירְסוֹ, בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וּפֵירְעוֹ. מֵעִיקָּרָא כְּתִיב ״פּוֹטִיפַר״, וּלְבַסּוֹף ״פּוֹטִיפֶרַע״.
sentences.human_translation: “And Potiphar, an officer [ seris ] of Pharaoh’s, bought him Rav says: He purchased for himself, Gabriel came and castrated [ seireso ]. Gabriel came and mutilated [ fero ] Initially, it is written “Potiphar” and in the end it is written “Potiphera”
sentences.llm_translation: "And he bought him from Potiphar, Pharaoh's eunuch," Rav said: that he bought him for himself. Came (Gabriel) Michael and his minister, came Gabriel and Pharaoh. Initially it is written "Potiphar," and ultimately "Potiphera."

sentences.text: מִי לָנוּ גָּדוֹל מִמֹּשֶׁה וְכוּ׳. ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֵלַי רַב לָךְ״, אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: בְּ״רַב״ בִּישֵּׂר, בְּ״רַב״ בִּישְּׂרוּהוּ. בְּ״רַב״ בִּישֵּׂר — ״רַב לָכֶם״. בְּ״רַב״ בִּישְּׂרוּהוּ — ״רַב לָךְ״.
sentences.human_translation: Who, to us, a greater than Moses, “And the Lord said to me: Let it suffice for you [ rav lakh ]; Rabbi Levi says: proclaimed with “ rav ,” it was proclaimed to him with “ rav ” He proclaimed with “ rav ” “You take too much upon you [ rav lakhem ], it was proclaimed to him with “ rav ,” “Let it suffice for you [ rav lakh ].”
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is greater than us like Moses, etc. "And Hashem said to me, you have been great," Rabbi Levi said: With "רַב" (Rav) in straightforwardness, with "רַב" (Rav) in crookedness. With "רַב" (Rav) in straightforwardness - "great to you." With "רַב" (Rav) in crookedness - "great to you."

sentences.text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״רַב לָךְ״ — רַב יֵשׁ לְךָ, וּמַנּוּ — יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
sentences.human_translation: Alternatively: “ rav lakh ” You have a rav , and who is it? Joshua,
sentences.llm_translation: Another explanation: "Rav Lakh" - you have Rav, and "Manu" - Yehoshua.

sentences.text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״רַב לָךְ״, שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ: הָרַב כַּמָּה קָשֶׁה, וְתַלְמִיד כַּמָּה סָרְבָן. וְכׇל כָּךְ לָמָּה? תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: לְפוּם גַּמְלָא שִׁיחְנָא.
sentences.human_translation: Alternatively: “ rav lakh ” so that should not say: How difficult is the Master and how obstinate is the student. And why so much The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught Based on the camel is the burden.
sentences.llm_translation: Another explanation: "Rav Lach," that they should not say: the master is so difficult, and the student is so sluggish. And why all this? It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: According to the effort is the reward.

sentences.text: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם בֶּן מֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים שָׁנָה אָנֹכִי הַיּוֹם״, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״הַיּוֹם״: הַיּוֹם מָלְאוּ יָמַי וּשְׁנוֹתַי. לְלַמֶּדְךָ שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַשְׁלִים שְׁנוֹתֵיהֶם שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים מִיּוֹם לְיוֹם וּמֵחֹדֶשׁ לְחֹדֶשׁ, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶת מִסְפַּר יָמֶיךָ אֲמַלֵּא״.
sentences.human_translation: “And he said to them: I am a hundred and twenty years old this day; as no the verse to state “this day.” this day, my days and years have been completed to teach you that the Holy One, Blessed be He, completes the years of the righteous from day to day and from month to month, as it is written: “The number of your days I will fill”
sentences.llm_translation: "And he said to them, 'I am a hundred and twenty years old today,' as the Talmud does not say 'today': 'Today my days and years have been completed.' To teach you that the Holy One, blessed be He, completes the years of the righteous from day to day and from month to month, as it is written: 'I will fulfill the number of your days.'"

sentences.text: ״לֹא אוּכַל עוֹד לָצֵאת וְלָבוֹא״. מַאי ״לָצֵאת וְלָבוֹא״? אִילֵימָא לָצֵאת וְלָבֹא מַמָּשׁ, וְהָכְתִיב: ״וּמֹשֶׁה בֶּן מֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים שָׁנָה בְּמוֹתוֹ לֹא נָס לֵחֹה״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַל מֹשֶׁה מֵעַרְבֹת מוֹאָב אֶל הַר נְבוֹ״, וְתַנְיָא: שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה מַעֲלוֹת הָיוּ שָׁם, וּפְסָעָן מֹשֶׁה בִּפְסִיעָה אַחַת.
sentences.human_translation: “I can no longer go out and come in” What “go out and come in”? If we say actually going out and coming in, but isn’t it written: “And Moses was a hundred and twenty years old when he died, nor his natural force abated” And it is written “And Moses went up from the plains of Moab to Mount Nebo” And it is taught There were twelve steps there and Moses stepped over them one step,
sentences.llm_translation: "Cannot anymore to go out and to come in." What is "to go out and to come in"? If you say to go out and to come in literally, but it is written: "Moses was a hundred and twenty years old when he died, his eye was not dim," and it is written: "And Moses went up from the plains of Moab to Mount Nebo," and it was taught: There were twelve steps there, and Moses took them in one stride.

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: לָצֵאת וְלָבוֹא בְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה. מְלַמֵּד שֶׁנִּסְתַּתְּמוּ מִמֶּנּוּ שַׁעֲרֵי חׇכְמָה.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: go out and come in with words of Torah. teaches that the gates of wisdom were closed off to him.
sentences.llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said Rabbi Yonatan: To go out and come in with matters of Torah. Teaches that you have become accustomed to its gates of wisdom.

sentences.text: ״וַיֵּלֶךְ מֹשֶׁה וִיהוֹשֻׁעַ וַיִּתְיַצְּבוּ בְּאֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״. תָּנָא: אוֹתָהּ שַׁבָּת שֶׁל דְּיוֹ זוּגֵי הָיְתָה, נִיטְּלָה רְשׁוּת מִזֶּה, וְנִיתְּנָה לָזֶה.
sentences.human_translation: “And Moses and Joshua went, and presented themselves in the Tent of Meeting” taught: That Sabbath was of two pairs [ deyo zugei ], Authority was taken from one and given to the other.
sentences.llm_translation: "And Moses went, and Joshua, and they stood in the Tent of Meeting." It was taught: On that Sabbath eve of the day of Zuggai, authority was removed from this one and given to that one.

sentences.text: וְתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אִילְמָלֵא מִקְרָא כָּתוּב, אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְאוֹמְרוֹ. הֵיכָן מֹשֶׁה מֵת — בְּחֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל רְאוּבֵן, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַל מֹשֶׁה מֵעַרְבֹת מוֹאָב אֶל הַר נְבוֹ״, וּנְבוֹ בְּחֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל רְאוּבֵן קָיְימָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבְנֵי רְאוּבֵן בָּנוּ וְגוֹ׳ וְאֶת נְבוֹ וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: And it is taught Rabbi Yehuda said: If not for written verse, one could not say Where did Moses die? In the portion of Reuben, as it is written: “And Moses went up from the plains of Moab to Mount Nebo” and Nebo is situated in the portion of Reuben, as it is written: “And the children of Reuben built and Nebo”
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught, Rabbi Yehuda said: If not for the verse written, it would be impossible to say it. Where did Moses die? In the portion of Reuben, as it is written: "And Moses went up from the plains of Moab to Mount Nebo," and Nebo is in the portion of Reuben, as it is written: "And the sons of Reuben built... and Nebo..."

sentences.text: ״נְבוֹ״ — שֶׁשָּׁם מֵתוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה נְבִיאִים: מֹשֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן וּמִרְיָם.
sentences.human_translation: “Nebo [ Nevo ],” for three prophets [ nevi’im ] died there: Moses, and Aaron, and Miriam.
sentences.llm_translation: "Nevo" - where three prophets died: Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.

sentences.text: וְהֵיכָן מֹשֶׁה קָבוּר — בְּחֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל גָּד, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּרְא רֵאשִׁית לוֹ וְגוֹ׳״. וּמֵחֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל רְאוּבֵן עַד חֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל גָּד כַּמָּה הָוֵי — אַרְבָּעָה מִילִין. אוֹתָן אַרְבָּעָה מִילִין מִי הוֹלִיכוֹ?
sentences.human_translation: And where is Moses buried? In the portion of Gad, as it is written “And he chose a first part for himself, And how much is from the portion of Reuben to the portion of Gad? Four mil . those four mil who transported him?
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: And where is Moses buried — in the portion of Gad, as it is written: "And he saw the first for himself, etc." And from the portion of Reuben to the portion of Gad, how much is it — four mil. Who led him those four mil?

sentences.text: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיָה מֹשֶׁה מוּטָּל בְּכַנְפֵי שְׁכִינָה, וּמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת אוֹמְרִים: ״צִדְקַת ה׳ עָשָׂה וּמִשְׁפָּטָיו עִם יִשְׂרָאֵל״, וְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״מִי יָקוּם לִי עִם מְרֵעִים מִי יִתְיַצֵּב לִי עִם פּוֹעֲלֵי אָוֶן״.
sentences.human_translation: teaches that Moses was lying in the wings of the Divine Presence, and the ministering angels were saying: “He executed the righteousness of the Lord, and His ordinances with Israel” And the Holy One, Blessed be He, was saying: “Who will rise up for Me against the evildoers? Who will stand up for Me against the workers of iniquity?”
sentences.llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Moses was hanging on the wings of the Divine Presence, and the ministering angels would say: 'The righteousness of the Lord He has performed, and His judgments with Israel.' And the Holy One, blessed be He, would say: 'Who will rise up for Me against evildoers? Who will stand up for Me against workers of iniquity?'"

sentences.text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: ״מִי כְּהֶחָכָם וּמִי יוֹדֵעַ פֵּשֶׁר דָּבָר״, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: ״הַחׇכְמָה מֵאַיִן תִּמָּצֵא״, וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: ״וַיָּמׇת שָׁם מֹשֶׁה וְגוֹ׳״, סְמַלְיוֹן אָמַר: ״וַיָּמׇת שָׁם מֹשֶׁה סָפְרָא רַבָּה דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל״.
sentences.human_translation: And Shmuel says “Who is as the wise man and who knows the interpretation [ pesher ] of a matter?” And Rabbi Yoḥanan says “Wisdom, where can it be found?” And Rav Naḥman says “And Moses, died there” Semalyon says And Moses, the great scribe of Israel, died there.
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Samuel said: "Who is like the wise, and who knows the interpretation of a matter," and Rabbi Yochanan said: "Where can wisdom be found," and Rav Nachman said: "And Moses died there," Symalyon said: "And Moses died there, the great scribe of Israel."

sentences.text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַגָּדוֹל אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר מִיל עַל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר מִיל, כְּנֶגֶד מַחֲנֵה יִשְׂרָאֵל, בַּת קוֹל מַשְׁמִיעַ וְאוֹמֵר: ״וַיָּמׇת מֹשֶׁה סָפְרָא רַבָּה דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל״. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: לֹא מֵת מֹשֶׁה, כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וַיָּמׇת שָׁם״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וַיְהִי שָׁם עִם ה׳״, מָה לְהַלָּן עוֹמֵד וּמְשַׁמֵּשׁ, אַף כָּאן עוֹמֵד וּמְשַׁמֵּשׁ.
sentences.human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: twelve mil by twelve mil , equivalent to the camp of Israel, a Divine Voice proclaimed and said: And Moses, the great scribe of Israel, died. And some say: Moses did not die, it is written here: “And died there” and it is written there: “And he was there with the Lord Just as there, he was standing and serving so too, here, he was standing and serving
sentences.llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: Twelve mil by twelve mil, opposite the camp of Israel, a heavenly voice proclaims and says: "And Moses, the great scribe of Israel, died." And some say: Moses did not die, as it is written here: "And he died there," and it is written there: "And he was there with the Lord." Just as there he stands and serves, so too here he stands and serves.

sentences.text: ״וַיִּקְבֹּר אוֹתוֹ בַגַּיְ בְּאֶרֶץ מוֹאָב מוּל בֵּית פְּעוֹר״. אָמַר רַבִּי בֶּרֶכְיָה: סִימָן בְּתוֹךְ סִימָן, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי: ״וְלֹא יָדַע אִישׁ אֶת קְבֻרָתוֹ״.
sentences.human_translation: “And He buried him in the valley in the land of Moab over against Beth Peor; Rabbi Berekhya says: a sign within a sign, and even with this “And no man knows of his grave
sentences.llm_translation: "And he buried him in the valley in the land of Moab opposite Beth Peor." Rabbi Berachiah said: A sign within a sign, and even so: "And no man knows his burial place."

sentences.text: וּכְבָר שָׁלְחָה מַלְכוּת הָרְשָׁעָה אֵצֶל
sentences.human_translation: And the evil monarchy already sent to
sentences.llm_translation: And as already sent the kingdom of wickedness to...

text: גַּסְטְרָא שֶׁל בֵּית פְּעוֹר: הַרְאֵנוּ הֵיכָן מֹשֶׁה קָבוּר. עָמְדוּ לְמַעְלָה — נִדְמָה לָהֶם לְמַטָּה, לְמַטָּה — נִדְמָה לָהֶם לְמַעְלָה. נֶחְלְקוּ לִשְׁתֵּי כִיתּוֹת, אוֹתָן שֶׁעוֹמְדִים לְמַעְלָה — נִדְמָה לָהֶן לְמַטָּה, לְמַטָּה — נִדְמָה לָהֶן לְמַעְלָה, לְקַיֵּים מַה שֶּׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וְלֹא יָדַע אִישׁ אֶת קְבֻרָתוֹ״.

רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר: אַף מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ הֵיכָן קָבוּר. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְלֹא יָדַע אִישׁ אֶת קְבֻרָתוֹ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וְזֹאת הַבְּרָכָה אֲשֶׁר בֵּרַךְ מֹשֶׁה אִישׁ הָאֱלֹהִים״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִפְּנֵי מָה נִקְבַּר מֹשֶׁה אֵצֶל בֵּית פְּעוֹר — כְּדֵי לְכַפֵּר עַל מַעֲשֵׂה פְעוֹר.

וְאָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אַחֲרֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם תֵּלֵכוּ״, וְכִי אֶפְשָׁר לוֹ לְאָדָם לְהַלֵּךְ אַחַר שְׁכִינָה? וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״כִּי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ אֵשׁ אוֹכְלָה הוּא״!

אֶלָּא, לְהַלֵּךְ אַחַר מִדּוֹתָיו שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: מָה הוּא מַלְבִּישׁ עֲרוּמִּים, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַשׂ ה׳ אֱלֹהִים לְאָדָם וּלְאִשְׁתּוֹ כׇּתְנוֹת עוֹר וַיַּלְבִּשֵׁם״ — אַף אַתָּה הַלְבֵּשׁ עֲרוּמִּים. הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בִּיקֵּר חוֹלִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּרָא אֵלָיו ה׳ בְּאֵלֹנֵי מַמְרֵא״ — אַף אַתָּה בַּקֵּר חוֹלִים. הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא נִיחֵם אֲבֵלִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי אַחֲרֵי מוֹת אַבְרָהָם וַיְבָרֶךְ אֱלֹהִים אֶת יִצְחָק בְּנוֹ״ — אַף אַתָּה נַחֵם אֲבֵלִים. הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא קָבַר מֵתִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּקְבֹּר אוֹתוֹ בַּגַּי״ — אַף אַתָּה קְבוֹר מֵתִים.
״כׇּתְנוֹת עוֹר״. רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל, חַד אָמַר: דָּבָר הַבָּא מִן הָעוֹר, וְחַד אָמַר: דָּבָר שֶׁהָעוֹר נֶהֱנֶה מִמֶּנּוּ.

דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי שִׂמְלַאי: תּוֹרָה תְּחִלָּתָהּ גְּמִילוּת חֲסָדִים, וְסוֹפָהּ גְּמִילוּת חֲסָדִים. תְּחִילָּתָהּ גְּמִילוּת חֲסָדִים — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַשׂ ה׳ אֱלֹהִים לְאָדָם וּלְאִשְׁתּוֹ כׇּתְנוֹת עוֹר וַיַּלְבִּשֵׁם״, וְסוֹפָהּ גְּמִילוּת חֲסָדִים — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּקְבֹּר אוֹתוֹ בַּגַּי״.

דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי שִׂמְלַאי: מִפְּנֵי מָה נִתְאַוָּה מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ לִיכָּנֵס לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל? וְכִי לֶאֱכוֹל מִפִּרְיָהּ הוּא צָרִיךְ?! אוֹ לִשְׂבּוֹעַ מִטּוּבָהּ הוּא צָרִיךְ?! אֶלָּא כָּךְ אָמַר מֹשֶׁה: הַרְבֵּה מִצְוֹת נִצְטַוּוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְאֵין מִתְקַיְּימִין אֶלָּא בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל. אֶכָּנֵס אֲנִי לָאָרֶץ כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּתְקַיְּימוּ כּוּלָּן עַל יָדִי.

אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: כְּלוּם אַתָּה מְבַקֵּשׁ אֶלָּא לְקַבֵּל שָׂכָר? מַעֲלֶה אֲנִי עָלֶיךָ כְּאִילּוּ עֲשִׂיתָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לָכֵן אֲחַלֶּק לוֹ בָרַבִּים וְאֶת עֲצוּמִים יְחַלֵּק שָׁלָל תַּחַת אֲשֶׁר הֶעֱרָה לַמָּוֶת נַפְשׁוֹ וְאֶת פּוֹשְׁעִים נִמְנָה וְהוּא חֵטְא רַבִּים נָשָׂא וְלַפֹּשְׁעִים יַפְגִּיעַ״.

״לָכֵן אֲחַלֶּק לוֹ בָּרַבִּים״. יָכוֹל כָּאַחֲרוֹנִים וְלֹא כָּרִאשׁוֹנִים, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְאֶת עֲצוּמִים יְחַלֵּק שָׁלָל״, כְּאַבְרָהָם יִצְחָק וְיַעֲקֹב, שֶׁהֵן עֲצוּמִים בַּתּוֹרָה וּבְמִצְוֹת. ״תַּחַת אֲשֶׁר הֶעֱרָה לַמָּוֶת נַפְשׁוֹ״, שֶׁמָּסַר עַצְמוֹ לְמִיתָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִם אַיִן מְחֵנִי נָא וְגוֹ׳״.

״וְאֶת פּוֹשְׁעִים נִמְנָה״ — שֶׁנִּמְנָה עִם מֵתֵי מִדְבָּר. ״וְהוּא חֵטְא רַבִּים נָשָׂא״ — שֶׁכִּיפֵּר עַל מַעֲשֵׂה הָעֵגֶל. ״וְלַפֹּשְׁעִים יַפְגִּיעַ״ — שֶׁבִּיקֵּשׁ רַחֲמִים עַל פּוֹשְׁעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁיַּחְזְרוּ בִּתְשׁוּבָה. וְאֵין פְּגִיעָה אֶלָּא תְּפִלָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתָּה אַל תִּתְפַּלֵּל בְּעַד הָעָם הַזֶּה וְאַל תִּשָּׂא בַעֲדָם רִנָּה וּתְפִלָּה וְאַל תִּפְגַּע בִּי״.
הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַמְקַנֵּא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ
הָיָה מֵבִיא אֶת מִנְחָתָהּ בְּתוֹךְ כְּפִיפָה מִצְרִית וְנוֹתְנָהּ עַל יָדֶיהָ כְּדֵי לְיַגְּעָהּ.
כׇּל הַמְּנָחוֹת תְּחִילָּתָן וְסוֹפָן בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת, וְזוֹ תְּחִלָּתָהּ בִּכְפִיפָה מִצְרִית, וְסוֹפָהּ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת.

כׇּל הַמְּנָחוֹת טְעוּנוֹת שֶׁמֶן וּלְבוֹנָה, וְזוֹ אֵינָהּ טְעוּנָה לֹא שֶׁמֶן וְלֹא לְבוֹנָה. כׇּל הַמְּנָחוֹת בָּאוֹת מִן הַחִטִּין, וְזוֹ בָּאָה מִן הַשְּׂעוֹרִין. מִנְחַת הָעוֹמֶר, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁבָּאָה מִן הַשְּׂעוֹרִין — הִיא הָיְתָה בָּאָה גֶּרֶשׂ, וְזוֹ בָּאָה קֶמַח. רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמַּעֲשֶׂיהָ מַעֲשֵׂה בְּהֵמָה, כָּךְ קׇרְבָּנָהּ מַאֲכַל בְּהֵמָה.

גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, אַבָּא חָנִין אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: [וְכׇל כָּךְ לָמָּה —] כְּדֵי לְיַגְּעָהּ, כְּדֵי שֶׁתַּחֲזוֹר בָּהּ. אִם כָּכָה חָסָה תּוֹרָה עַל עוֹבְרֵי רְצוֹנוֹ, קַל וָחוֹמֶר עַל עוֹשֵׂי רְצוֹנוֹ.
וּמִמַּאי מִשּׁוּם דְּחָסָה הוּא? דִּילְמָא כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלֹא תִּימָּחֵק מְגִילָּה! קָסָבַר
מַשְׁקָהּ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַקְרִיב אֶת מִנְחָתָהּ. דְּאִי מִשּׁוּם מְגִילָּה הָא אִימְּחִיקָא לַהּ.

כׇּל הַמְּנָחוֹת וְכוּ׳. וּרְמִינְהוּ: סֵדֶר מְנָחוֹת, כֵּיצַד? אָדָם מֵבִיא מִנְחָה מִתּוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ בִּקְלָתוֹת שֶׁל כֶּסֶף וְשֶׁל זָהָב, וְנוֹתְנָהּ לְתוֹךְ כְּלִי שָׁרֵת, וּמְקַדְּשָׁהּ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת, וְנוֹתֵן עָלֶיהָ שַׁמְנָהּ וּלְבוֹנָתָהּ, וּמוֹלִיכָהּ אֵצֶל כֹּהֵן. וְכֹהֵן מוֹלִיכָהּ אֵצֶל מִזְבֵּחַ, וּמַגִּישָׁהּ בְּקֶרֶן דְּרוֹמִית מַעֲרָבִית כְּנֶגֶד חוּדָּהּ שֶׁל קֶרֶן, וְדַיּוֹ.

וּמְסַלֵּק אֶת הַלְּבוֹנָה לְצַד אֶחָד, וְקוֹמֵץ מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁנִּתְרַבָּה שַׁמְנָהּ וְנוֹתְנוֹ לְתוֹךְ כְּלִי שָׁרֵת, וּמְקַדְּשׁוֹ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת. וּמְלַקֵּט אֶת לְבוֹנָתָהּ וְנוֹתְנָהּ עַל גַּבָּיו, וּמַעֲלֶה אוֹתוֹ לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ, וּמַעֲלֵהוּ וּמַקְטִירוֹ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת, וּמוֹלְחוֹ, וְנוֹתְנוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי הָאִישִּׁים.
קָרַב הַקּוֹמֶץ שְׁיָרֶיהָ נֶאֱכָלִין, וְרַשָּׁאִין הַכֹּהֲנִים לִיתֵּן לְתוֹכָהּ יַיִן וְשֶׁמֶן וּדְבַשׁ, וְאֵין אֲסוּרִין אֶלָּא מִלְּחַמֵּץ.
קָתָנֵי מִיהָא בִּקְלָתוֹת שֶׁל כֶּסֶף וּבִקְלָתוֹת שֶׁל זָהָב! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אֵימָא בְּכֵלִים הָרְאוּיִין לִכְלֵי שָׁרֵת.

מִכְּלַל דִּכְפִיפָה מִצְרִית לָא חַזְיָא, כְּמַאן — דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּתַנְיָא: כְּלֵי שָׁרֵת שֶׁעֲשָׂאָן שֶׁל עֵץ, רַבִּי פּוֹסֵל וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר.

אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אֵימַר דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּחֲשׁוּבִין, בִּפְחוּתִין מִי אָמַר? לֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה ״הַקְרִיבֵהוּ נָא לְפֶחָתֶךָ״?!
וְנוֹתְנָהּ לִכְלֵי שָׁרֵת, וּמְקַדְּשָׁהּ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת. שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ — כְּלִי שָׁרֵת אֵין מְקַדְּשִׁין אֶלָּא מִדַּעַת? אֵימָא: נוֹתְנָהּ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת לְקַדְּשָׁהּ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת.
וְנוֹתֵן עָלֶיהָ שַׁמְנָהּ וּלְבוֹנָתָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיָצַק עָלֶיהָ שֶׁמֶן וְנָתַן עָלֶיהָ לְבֹנָה״.
וּמוֹלִיכָהּ אֵצֶל כֹּהֵן, דִּכְתִיב: ״וֶהֱבִיאָהּ אֶל בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן וְגוֹ׳״.
וְכֹהֵן מוֹלִיכָהּ אֵצֶל מִזְבֵּחַ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִגִּישָׁהּ אֵצֶל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״.
מַגִּישָׁהּ בְּקֶרֶן דְּרוֹמִית מַעֲרָבִית כְּנֶגֶד חוּדָּהּ שֶׁל קֶרֶן וְדַיּוֹ. מְנָלַן —

דִּכְתִיב: ״וְזֹאת תּוֹרַת הַמִּנְחָה הַקְרֵב אוֹתָהּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֶל פְּנֵי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״, וְתַנְיָא: ״לִפְנֵי ה׳״, יָכוֹל בַּמַּעֲרָב — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֶל פְּנֵי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״. אִי אֶל פְּנֵי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, יָכוֹל בַּדָּרוֹם — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לִפְנֵי ה׳״. הָא כֵּיצַד — מַגִּישָׁהּ בְּקֶרֶן דְּרוֹמִית מַעֲרָבִית כְּנֶגֶד חוּדָּהּ שֶׁל קֶרֶן, וְדַיּוֹ.

רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל יַגִּישֶׁנָּה בְּמַעֲרָבָהּ שֶׁל קֶרֶן אוֹ לִדְרוֹמָהּ שֶׁל קֶרֶן — אָמַרְתָּ: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה מוֹצֵא שְׁנֵי מִקְרָאוֹת, אֶחָד מְקַיֵּים עַצְמוֹ וּמְקַיֵּים דִּבְרֵי חֲבֵירוֹ, וְאֶחָד מְקַיֵּים עַצְמוֹ וּמְבַטֵּל דִּבְרֵי חֲבֵירוֹ — מַנִּיחִין אֶת שֶׁמְּקַיֵּים עַצְמוֹ וּמְבַטֵּל חֲבֵירוֹ, וְתוֹפְסִין אֶת שֶׁמְּקַיֵּים עַצְמוֹ וּמְקַיֵּים חֲבֵירוֹ. כְּשֶׁאַתָּה אוֹמֵר ״לִפְנֵי ה׳״ בַּמַּעֲרָב — בִּטַּלְתָּה ״אֶל פְּנֵי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״ בַּדָּרוֹם, וּכְשֶׁאַתָּה אוֹמֵר ״אֶל פְּנֵי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״ בַּדָּרוֹם, קִיַּימְתָּה ״לִפְנֵי ה׳״ בַּמַּעֲרָב. הָא כֵּיצַד? מַגִּישָׁהּ לִדְרוֹמָהּ שֶׁל קֶרֶן.
וְהֵיכָן קִיַּימְתָּה? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: קָסָבַר הַאי תַּנָּא כּוּלֵּיהּ מִזְבֵּחַ בְּצָפוֹן קָאֵי.

וּמִמַּאי מִשּׁוּם דְּחָסָה הוּא? דִּילְמָא כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלֹא תִּימָּחֵק מְגִילָּה! קָסָבַר
מַשְׁקָהּ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַקְרִיב אֶת מִנְחָתָהּ. דְּאִי מִשּׁוּם מְגִילָּה הָא אִימְּחִיקָא לַהּ.

כׇּל הַמְּנָחוֹת וְכוּ׳. וּרְמִינְהוּ: סֵדֶר מְנָחוֹת, כֵּיצַד? אָדָם מֵבִיא מִנְחָה מִתּוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ בִּקְלָתוֹת שֶׁל כֶּסֶף וְשֶׁל זָהָב, וְנוֹתְנָהּ לְתוֹךְ כְּלִי שָׁרֵת, וּמְקַדְּשָׁהּ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת, וְנוֹתֵן עָלֶיהָ שַׁמְנָהּ וּלְבוֹנָתָהּ, וּמוֹלִיכָהּ אֵצֶל כֹּהֵן. וְכֹהֵן מוֹלִיכָהּ אֵצֶל מִזְבֵּחַ, וּמַגִּישָׁהּ בְּקֶרֶן דְּרוֹמִית מַעֲרָבִית כְּנֶגֶד חוּדָּהּ שֶׁל קֶרֶן, וְדַיּוֹ.

וּמְסַלֵּק אֶת הַלְּבוֹנָה לְצַד אֶחָד, וְקוֹמֵץ מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁנִּתְרַבָּה שַׁמְנָהּ וְנוֹתְנוֹ לְתוֹךְ כְּלִי שָׁרֵת, וּמְקַדְּשׁוֹ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת. וּמְלַקֵּט אֶת לְבוֹנָתָהּ וְנוֹתְנָהּ עַל גַּבָּיו, וּמַעֲלֶה אוֹתוֹ לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ, וּמַעֲלֵהוּ וּמַקְטִירוֹ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת, וּמוֹלְחוֹ, וְנוֹתְנוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי הָאִישִּׁים.
קָרַב הַקּוֹמֶץ שְׁיָרֶיהָ נֶאֱכָלִין, וְרַשָּׁאִין הַכֹּהֲנִים לִיתֵּן לְתוֹכָהּ יַיִן וְשֶׁמֶן וּדְבַשׁ, וְאֵין אֲסוּרִין אֶלָּא מִלְּחַמֵּץ.
קָתָנֵי מִיהָא בִּקְלָתוֹת שֶׁל כֶּסֶף וּבִקְלָתוֹת שֶׁל זָהָב! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אֵימָא בְּכֵלִים הָרְאוּיִין לִכְלֵי שָׁרֵת.

מִכְּלַל דִּכְפִיפָה מִצְרִית לָא חַזְיָא, כְּמַאן — דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּתַנְיָא: כְּלֵי שָׁרֵת שֶׁעֲשָׂאָן שֶׁל עֵץ, רַבִּי פּוֹסֵל וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר.

אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אֵימַר דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּחֲשׁוּבִין, בִּפְחוּתִין מִי אָמַר? לֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה ״הַקְרִיבֵהוּ נָא לְפֶחָתֶךָ״?!
וְנוֹתְנָהּ לִכְלֵי שָׁרֵת, וּמְקַדְּשָׁהּ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת. שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ — כְּלִי שָׁרֵת אֵין מְקַדְּשִׁין אֶלָּא מִדַּעַת? אֵימָא: נוֹתְנָהּ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת לְקַדְּשָׁהּ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת.
וְנוֹתֵן עָלֶיהָ שַׁמְנָהּ וּלְבוֹנָתָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיָצַק עָלֶיהָ שֶׁמֶן וְנָתַן עָלֶיהָ לְבֹנָה״.
וּמוֹלִיכָהּ אֵצֶל כֹּהֵן, דִּכְתִיב: ״וֶהֱבִיאָהּ אֶל בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן וְגוֹ׳״.
וְכֹהֵן מוֹלִיכָהּ אֵצֶל מִזְבֵּחַ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִגִּישָׁהּ אֵצֶל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״.
מַגִּישָׁהּ בְּקֶרֶן דְּרוֹמִית מַעֲרָבִית כְּנֶגֶד חוּדָּהּ שֶׁל קֶרֶן וְדַיּוֹ. מְנָלַן —

דִּכְתִיב: ״וְזֹאת תּוֹרַת הַמִּנְחָה הַקְרֵב אוֹתָהּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֶל פְּנֵי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״, וְתַנְיָא: ״לִפְנֵי ה׳״, יָכוֹל בַּמַּעֲרָב — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֶל פְּנֵי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״. אִי אֶל פְּנֵי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, יָכוֹל בַּדָּרוֹם — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לִפְנֵי ה׳״. הָא כֵּיצַד — מַגִּישָׁהּ בְּקֶרֶן דְּרוֹמִית מַעֲרָבִית כְּנֶגֶד חוּדָּהּ שֶׁל קֶרֶן, וְדַיּוֹ.

רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל יַגִּישֶׁנָּה בְּמַעֲרָבָהּ שֶׁל קֶרֶן אוֹ לִדְרוֹמָהּ שֶׁל קֶרֶן — אָמַרְתָּ: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה מוֹצֵא שְׁנֵי מִקְרָאוֹת, אֶחָד מְקַיֵּים עַצְמוֹ וּמְקַיֵּים דִּבְרֵי חֲבֵירוֹ, וְאֶחָד מְקַיֵּים עַצְמוֹ וּמְבַטֵּל דִּבְרֵי חֲבֵירוֹ — מַנִּיחִין אֶת שֶׁמְּקַיֵּים עַצְמוֹ וּמְבַטֵּל חֲבֵירוֹ, וְתוֹפְסִין אֶת שֶׁמְּקַיֵּים עַצְמוֹ וּמְקַיֵּים חֲבֵירוֹ. כְּשֶׁאַתָּה אוֹמֵר ״לִפְנֵי ה׳״ בַּמַּעֲרָב — בִּטַּלְתָּה ״אֶל פְּנֵי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״ בַּדָּרוֹם, וּכְשֶׁאַתָּה אוֹמֵר ״אֶל פְּנֵי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״ בַּדָּרוֹם, קִיַּימְתָּה ״לִפְנֵי ה׳״ בַּמַּעֲרָב. הָא כֵּיצַד? מַגִּישָׁהּ לִדְרוֹמָהּ שֶׁל קֶרֶן.
וְהֵיכָן קִיַּימְתָּה? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: קָסָבַר הַאי תַּנָּא כּוּלֵּיהּ מִזְבֵּחַ בְּצָפוֹן קָאֵי.
מַאי ״וְדַיּוֹ״? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: תִּיבְּעֵי הַגָּשַׁת מִנְחָה גּוּפַהּ, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
וְאֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהִקְרִיבָהּ אֶל הַכֹּהֵן וְגוֹ׳ וְהִגִּישָׁהּ אֶל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״ — מָה הַקְרָבָה אֵצֶל כֹּהֵן בִּכְלִי, אַף הַגָּשָׁה אֵצֶל מִזְבֵּחַ בִּכְלִי.
וּמְסַלֵּק אֶת לְבוֹנָתָהּ לְצַד אֶחָד. כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא תִּקְּמוֹץ בַּהֲדֵי מִנְחָה, כְּדִתְנַן: קָמַץ וְעָלָה בְּיָדוֹ צְרוֹר אוֹ גַּרְגֵּר מֶלַח אוֹ קוֹרֶט לְבוֹנָה — פָּסוּל.
וְקוֹמֵץ מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁנִּתְרַבָּה שַׁמְנָהּ. מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב ״מִסׇּלְתָּהּ וּמִשַּׁמְנָהּ״, ״מִגִּרְשָׂהּ וּמִשַּׁמְנָהּ״.

וְנוֹתְנוֹ לְתוֹךְ כְּלִי שָׁרֵת וּמְקַדְּשׁוֹ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת. לְמָה לִי? הָא קַדְּשַׁהּ חֲדָא זִימְנָא! מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַדָּם; דָּם, אַף עַל גַּב דְּקַדֵּישְׁתֵּיהּ סַכִּין בְּצַוַּאר בְּהֵמָה, הֲדַר מְקַדֵּישׁ לֵיהּ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת, הָכָא נָמֵי לָא שְׁנָא.
וּמְלַקֵּט אֶת לְבוֹנָתָהּ וְנוֹתְנָהּ עַל גַּבָּיו — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֶת כׇּל הַלְּבוֹנָה אֲשֶׁר עַל הַמִּנְחָה״.
וּמַעֲלֵהוּ
llm_translation: The chamber of the house of Peor: Show us where Moses is buried. If they stood above - it appeared to them as below, if below - it appeared to them as above. They divided into two groups, those standing above - it appeared to them as below, those below - it appeared to them as above, to fulfill what is said, "And no man knows his burial place."

Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: Even Moses our teacher does not know where he is buried. It is written here: "And no man knows his burial place," and it is written there: "And this is the blessing with which Moses, the man of God, blessed." And Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: Why was Moses buried near the house of Peor? In order to atone for the incident of Peor.

And Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said, what is the meaning of what is written: "After the Lord your God shall you walk"? Is it possible for a person to walk after the Divine Presence? Has it not already been stated: "For the Lord your God is a consuming fire"!

Talmudic text: Rather, to walk after the attributes of the Holy One, blessed be He: Just as He clothes the naked, as it is written: "And the Lord God made for Adam and for his wife garments of skin and clothed them" — so too, you should clothe the naked. The Holy One, blessed be He, visited the sick, as it is written: "And the Lord appeared to him by the oaks of Mamre" — so too, you should visit the sick. The Holy One, blessed be He, comforted mourners, as it is written: "And it came to pass after the death of Abraham, that God blessed Isaac his son" — so too, you should comfort mourners. The Holy One, blessed be He, buried the dead, as it is written: "And he buried him in the valley" — so too, you should bury the dead.
"Kotnot Or." Rav and Shmuel, one said: a matter that comes from the skin, and one said: a matter from which the skin benefits.

Rabbi Simlai expounded: The beginning of the Torah is acts of loving-kindness, and its end is acts of loving-kindness. Its beginning is acts of loving-kindness - as it is written: "And the Lord God made for Adam and for his wife garments of skin and clothed them," and its end is acts of loving-kindness - as it is written: "And he buried him in the valley."

Rabbi Shmueli expounded: For what reason did our teacher Moses desire to enter the land of Israel? Was it to eat of its fruit that he needed?! Or to be satiated from its goodness that he needed?! Rather, thus said Moses: Many commandments were commanded to Israel, and they are only fulfilled in the land of Israel. I will enter the land so that they may all be fulfilled through me.

He said to him the Holy One, blessed be He: "Are you seeking anything other than to receive reward? I credit you as if you have done it, as it is said: 'Therefore will I divide him a portion with the great, and he shall divide the spoil with the strong; because he poured out his soul unto death, and he was numbered with the transgressors; and he bore the sin of many, and made intercession for the transgressors.'"

"Therefore I will divide him a portion with the many." Could it be like the latter ones and not like the former ones? The Scripture says: "And he shall divide the spoil with the strong," like Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, who are strong in Torah and commandments. "Because he exposed himself to death," as he delivered himself to death, as it is said: "But if you will not redeem me, then..."

"And for the transgressors he shall be numbered" — that he was counted among the dead of the wilderness. "And he bore the sin of many" — that he atoned for the incident of the calf. "And for the transgressors he shall intercede" — that he sought mercy for the sinners of Israel that they may repent. And intercession is nothing but prayer, as it is stated: "Therefore do not pray for this people, nor lift up a cry or prayer for them, nor make intercession to Me."
The one who is jealous for his wife, we will return to you.
He would bring her meal-offering in an Egyptian basket and place it on her hands in order to wave it.
All the meal offerings, their beginning and end are in a sacred vessel, and this is its beginning in an Egyptian cup, and its end in a sacred vessel.

All the meal offerings require oil and frankincense, except this one which does not require either oil or frankincense. All meal offerings come from wheat, except this one which comes from barley. The Omer meal offering, even though it comes from barley, it was brought as a sheaf, while this one is brought as flour. Rabban Gamliel says: Just as its preparation is similar to the work of an animal, so too its offering is food for an animal.

Talmudic text: "Gemara, tanya, Abba Hanin says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: And why all this? In order to toil in it, in order that it may be retained. If so, the Torah has mercy on those who transgress His will, all the more so on those who do His will."
And from what is it derived that it is due to anger? Perhaps it is in order that the Megillah not be erased! He holds the opinion
Beverage, and afterwards brings her meal offering. For if due to the scroll, this is a contradiction to it.

Talmudic text: "All the meal offerings, etc." And they raised a dilemma: The order of meal offerings, how? A person brings a meal offering from within his house in silver and gold baskets, and places it into a service vessel, and sanctifies it in a service vessel, and puts on it its oil and frankincense, and brings it to the priest. And the priest brings it to the altar, and offers it on the northeastern corner opposite the southwestern corner of the altar, and that suffices.

And removes the frankincense to one side, and gathers from the place where its fat has increased and puts it into a service vessel, and sanctifies it in a service vessel. And collects its frankincense and puts it on its back, and brings it up to the top of the altar, and brings it up and burns it in a service vessel, and salts it, and puts it on the woodpile.
The close parts of the offering are eaten, and the priests are permitted to place wine, oil, and honey inside it, and they are only forbidden from leaven.
It was taught in one place regarding silver vessels and regarding gold vessels! Rav Papa said: Say with vessels fit for service.

From the principle of an Egyptian basket, it is not seen. Like who? — Like one who is not like Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught: Vessels of service made of wood, Rabbi Posa'el and Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda deem them unfit and fit.

Even if you say it is Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, should we say that Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, said regarding the important ones, who did he say it regarding the less important ones? Does Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, not have "Bring him near to your less important one"?!

And she shall place it in the vessels of the service, and sanctify it in the vessels of the service. You heard from it - vessels of the service only sanctify with intent? Say: She places it in the vessels of the service to sanctify it in the vessels of the service.
And he shall place upon it its oil and its frankincense, as it is stated: "And he shall pour upon it oil and place upon it frankincense."
And he shall bring her to the kohen, as it is written: "And he shall bring her to the sons of Aharon, etc."
The Kohen shall bring it near the altar, as it is written: "And he shall bring it near the altar."
He presents it with the horn of the southern-western corner opposite the chamber of the horn and enough. Whence do we derive this?

Talmudic text: As it is written: "And this is the law of the meal offering: the sons of Aaron shall offer it before the Lord, in front of the altar." And it was taught: "Before the Lord," one might think to the west — the teaching is necessary to say: "in front of the altar." If not in front of the altar, one might think to the south — the teaching is necessary to say: "before the Lord." How so? One brings it in the southwestern corner opposite the corner of the altar, and it suffices.

Rabbi Elazar says: One might have thought to bring it near to the western side of the altar horn or to its southern side of the horn - you say: In any place where you find two verses, one establishing itself and establishing the words of its fellow, and one establishing itself and nullifying the words of its fellow - we leave the one that establishes itself and nullifies its fellow, and we take the one that establishes itself and establishes its fellow. When you say "before the Lord" in the west - you nullified "to the front of the altar" in the south, and when you say "to the front of the altar" in the south, you established "before the Lord" in the west. How so? Bring it near to the southern side of the horn.
And where was it established? Rav Ashi said: He holds that this Tanna maintains that the entire altar is situated in the north.
What is "vedayo"? Rav Ashei said: It was necessary, for had your mind not said, I would have said: It requires the offering of its own meal offering, which teaches us.

And why not say it like this? The verse says: "And he shall bring it to the kohen, etc., and he shall bring it near to the altar" — just as bringing near to the kohen is with a vessel, so too bringing near to the altar is with a vessel.

And removes its frankincense to one side. For so that it should not become crumbled in the hands of the offering, as we learned: If one crumbled and offered in his hand a handful or a lump of salt or a piece of frankincense - it is invalid.
"And a handful from where its fat increased. From where do we derive this? As it is written, 'from its fine flour and from its fat,' 'from its threshing floor and from its fat.'"

And he shall place it within a service vessel and sanctify it in a service vessel. Why do I need it? This sanctification is only temporary! For as long as a person is alive; its blood, even though he sanctified the knife on the neck of an animal, he can sanctify it in a service vessel, here too it is no different.
"And gathering its frankincense and placing it upon its handful" - as it is written: "And all the frankincense that is upon the meal-offering."
And he brings it up.

sentences.text: גַּסְטְרָא שֶׁל בֵּית פְּעוֹר: הַרְאֵנוּ הֵיכָן מֹשֶׁה קָבוּר. עָמְדוּ לְמַעְלָה — נִדְמָה לָהֶם לְמַטָּה, לְמַטָּה — נִדְמָה לָהֶם לְמַעְלָה. נֶחְלְקוּ לִשְׁתֵּי כִיתּוֹת, אוֹתָן שֶׁעוֹמְדִים לְמַעְלָה — נִדְמָה לָהֶן לְמַטָּה, לְמַטָּה — נִדְמָה לָהֶן לְמַעְלָה, לְקַיֵּים מַה שֶּׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וְלֹא יָדַע אִישׁ אֶת קְבֻרָתוֹ״.
sentences.human_translation: the garrison [ gastera ] of Beth Peor Show us where Moses is buried. stood above it appeared to them below below, it appeared to them above. They divided into two groups, those who were standing above, appeared to them below; below, appeared to them to be above, to fulfill that which is stated: “And no man knows of his grave
sentences.llm_translation: The chamber of the house of Peor: Show us where Moses is buried. If they stood above - it appeared to them as below, if below - it appeared to them as above. They divided into two groups, those standing above - it appeared to them as below, those below - it appeared to them as above, to fulfill what is said, "And no man knows his burial place."

sentences.text: רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר: אַף מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ הֵיכָן קָבוּר. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְלֹא יָדַע אִישׁ אֶת קְבֻרָתוֹ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וְזֹאת הַבְּרָכָה אֲשֶׁר בֵּרַךְ מֹשֶׁה אִישׁ הָאֱלֹהִים״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִפְּנֵי מָה נִקְבַּר מֹשֶׁה אֵצֶל בֵּית פְּעוֹר — כְּדֵי לְכַפֵּר עַל מַעֲשֵׂה פְעוֹר.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: Even Moses our teacher does not know where he is buried. It is written here: “And no man knows of his grave,” and it is written there: “And this is the blessing wherewith Moses the man of God blessed And Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: For what was Moses buried near Beth Peor? In order to atone for the incident Peor
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: Even Moses our teacher does not know where he is buried. It is written here: "And no man knows his burial place," and it is written there: "And this is the blessing with which Moses, the man of God, blessed." And Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: Why was Moses buried near the house of Peor? In order to atone for the incident of Peor.

sentences.text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אַחֲרֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם תֵּלֵכוּ״, וְכִי אֶפְשָׁר לוֹ לְאָדָם לְהַלֵּךְ אַחַר שְׁכִינָה? וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״כִּי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ אֵשׁ אוֹכְלָה הוּא״!
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: What is which is written: “After the Lord your God shall you walk, But is it possible for a person to follow the Divine Presence? But hasn’t it already been stated: “For the Lord your God is a devouring fire,
sentences.llm_translation: And Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said, what is the meaning of what is written: "After the Lord your God shall you walk"? Is it possible for a person to walk after the Divine Presence? Has it not already been stated: "For the Lord your God is a consuming fire"!

sentences.text: אֶלָּא, לְהַלֵּךְ אַחַר מִדּוֹתָיו שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: מָה הוּא מַלְבִּישׁ עֲרוּמִּים, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַשׂ ה׳ אֱלֹהִים לְאָדָם וּלְאִשְׁתּוֹ כׇּתְנוֹת עוֹר וַיַּלְבִּשֵׁם״ — אַף אַתָּה הַלְבֵּשׁ עֲרוּמִּים. הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בִּיקֵּר חוֹלִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּרָא אֵלָיו ה׳ בְּאֵלֹנֵי מַמְרֵא״ — אַף אַתָּה בַּקֵּר חוֹלִים. הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא נִיחֵם אֲבֵלִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי אַחֲרֵי מוֹת אַבְרָהָם וַיְבָרֶךְ אֱלֹהִים אֶת יִצְחָק בְּנוֹ״ — אַף אַתָּה נַחֵם אֲבֵלִים. הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא קָבַר מֵתִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּקְבֹּר אוֹתוֹ בַּגַּי״ — אַף אַתָּה קְבוֹר מֵתִים.
sentences.human_translation: Rather, that one should follow the attributes of the Holy One, Blessed be He. Just as He clothes the naked, as it is written: “And the Lord God made for Adam and for his wife garments of skin, and clothed them” so too, you clothe the naked. the Holy One, Blessed be He, visits the sick, as it is written “And the Lord appeared unto him by the terebinths of Mamre” so too, you visit the sick. the Holy One, Blessed be He, consoles mourners, as it is written: “And it came to pass after the death of Abraham, that God blessed Isaac his son” so too, you console mourners. the Holy One, Blessed be He, buried the dead, as it is written: “And he was buried in the valley so too, you bury the dead.
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, to walk after the attributes of the Holy One, blessed be He: Just as He clothes the naked, as it is written: "And the Lord God made for Adam and for his wife garments of skin and clothed them" — so too, you should clothe the naked. The Holy One, blessed be He, visited the sick, as it is written: "And the Lord appeared to him by the oaks of Mamre" — so too, you should visit the sick. The Holy One, blessed be He, comforted mourners, as it is written: "And it came to pass after the death of Abraham, that God blessed Isaac his son" — so too, you should comfort mourners. The Holy One, blessed be He, buried the dead, as it is written: "And he buried him in the valley" — so too, you should bury the dead.

sentences.text: ״כׇּתְנוֹת עוֹר״. רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל, חַד אָמַר: דָּבָר הַבָּא מִן הָעוֹר, וְחַד אָמַר: דָּבָר שֶׁהָעוֹר נֶהֱנֶה מִמֶּנּוּ.
sentences.human_translation: garments of skin, Rav and Shmuel One says something that comes from the skin, and one says something from which the skin benefits.
sentences.llm_translation: "Kotnot Or." Rav and Shmuel, one said: a matter that comes from the skin, and one said: a matter from which the skin benefits.

sentences.text: דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי שִׂמְלַאי: תּוֹרָה תְּחִלָּתָהּ גְּמִילוּת חֲסָדִים, וְסוֹפָהּ גְּמִילוּת חֲסָדִים. תְּחִילָּתָהּ גְּמִילוּת חֲסָדִים — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַשׂ ה׳ אֱלֹהִים לְאָדָם וּלְאִשְׁתּוֹ כׇּתְנוֹת עוֹר וַיַּלְבִּשֵׁם״, וְסוֹפָהּ גְּמִילוּת חֲסָדִים — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּקְבֹּר אוֹתוֹ בַּגַּי״.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Samlai taught: Torah, its beginning is an act of kindness and its end is an act of kindness. Its beginning is an act of kindness, as it is written: “And the Lord God made for Adam and for his wife garments of skin, and clothed them” And its end is an act of kindness, as it is written: “And he was buried in the valley
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Simlai expounded: The beginning of the Torah is acts of loving-kindness, and its end is acts of loving-kindness. Its beginning is acts of loving-kindness - as it is written: "And the Lord God made for Adam and for his wife garments of skin and clothed them," and its end is acts of loving-kindness - as it is written: "And he buried him in the valley."

sentences.text: דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי שִׂמְלַאי: מִפְּנֵי מָה נִתְאַוָּה מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ לִיכָּנֵס לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל? וְכִי לֶאֱכוֹל מִפִּרְיָהּ הוּא צָרִיךְ?! אוֹ לִשְׂבּוֹעַ מִטּוּבָהּ הוּא צָרִיךְ?! אֶלָּא כָּךְ אָמַר מֹשֶׁה: הַרְבֵּה מִצְוֹת נִצְטַוּוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְאֵין מִתְקַיְּימִין אֶלָּא בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל. אֶכָּנֵס אֲנִי לָאָרֶץ כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּתְקַיְּימוּ כּוּלָּן עַל יָדִי.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Samlai taught: For what did Moses our teacher desire to enter Eretz Yisrael? Did he need to eat of its produce, or did he need to satisfy himself from its goodness? Rather, this Moses said: Many mitzvot were commanded Jewish people, and them can be fulfilled only in Eretz Yisrael, I will enter the land in order that they can all be fulfilled by me.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Shmueli expounded: For what reason did our teacher Moses desire to enter the land of Israel? Was it to eat of its fruit that he needed?! Or to be satiated from its goodness that he needed?! Rather, thus said Moses: Many commandments were commanded to Israel, and they are only fulfilled in the land of Israel. I will enter the land so that they may all be fulfilled through me.

sentences.text: אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: כְּלוּם אַתָּה מְבַקֵּשׁ אֶלָּא לְקַבֵּל שָׂכָר? מַעֲלֶה אֲנִי עָלֶיךָ כְּאִילּוּ עֲשִׂיתָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לָכֵן אֲחַלֶּק לוֹ בָרַבִּים וְאֶת עֲצוּמִים יְחַלֵּק שָׁלָל תַּחַת אֲשֶׁר הֶעֱרָה לַמָּוֶת נַפְשׁוֹ וְאֶת פּוֹשְׁעִים נִמְנָה וְהוּא חֵטְא רַבִּים נָשָׂא וְלַפֹּשְׁעִים יַפְגִּיעַ״.
sentences.human_translation: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to him: Do you seek for any other than to receive a reward? I will ascribe you as if you had performed them as it is stated: “Therefore will I divide him a portion among the great, and he shall divide the spoil with the mighty; because he bared his soul unto death, and was numbered with the transgressors; yet he bore the sin of many, and made intercession for the transgressors”
sentences.llm_translation: He said to him the Holy One, blessed be He: "Are you seeking anything other than to receive reward? I credit you as if you have done it, as it is said: 'Therefore will I divide him a portion with the great, and he shall divide the spoil with the strong; because he poured out his soul unto death, and he was numbered with the transgressors; and he bore the sin of many, and made intercession for the transgressors.'"

sentences.text: ״לָכֵן אֲחַלֶּק לוֹ בָּרַבִּים״. יָכוֹל כָּאַחֲרוֹנִים וְלֹא כָּרִאשׁוֹנִים, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְאֶת עֲצוּמִים יְחַלֵּק שָׁלָל״, כְּאַבְרָהָם יִצְחָק וְיַעֲקֹב, שֶׁהֵן עֲצוּמִים בַּתּוֹרָה וּבְמִצְוֹת. ״תַּחַת אֲשֶׁר הֶעֱרָה לַמָּוֶת נַפְשׁוֹ״, שֶׁמָּסַר עַצְמוֹ לְמִיתָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִם אַיִן מְחֵנִי נָא וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: “Therefore will I divide him a portion among the great” might like the later ones and not like the earlier ones, the verse states: “And he shall divide the spoil with the mighty,” like Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, who were mighty in Torah and in mitzvot. “Because he bared his soul unto death,” he gave himself over to death as it is stated: and if not, blot me, I pray
sentences.llm_translation: "Therefore I will divide him a portion with the many." Could it be like the latter ones and not like the former ones? The Scripture says: "And he shall divide the spoil with the strong," like Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, who are strong in Torah and commandments. "Because he exposed himself to death," as he delivered himself to death, as it is said: "But if you will not redeem me, then..."

sentences.text: ״וְאֶת פּוֹשְׁעִים נִמְנָה״ — שֶׁנִּמְנָה עִם מֵתֵי מִדְבָּר. ״וְהוּא חֵטְא רַבִּים נָשָׂא״ — שֶׁכִּיפֵּר עַל מַעֲשֵׂה הָעֵגֶל. ״וְלַפֹּשְׁעִים יַפְגִּיעַ״ — שֶׁבִּיקֵּשׁ רַחֲמִים עַל פּוֹשְׁעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁיַּחְזְרוּ בִּתְשׁוּבָה. וְאֵין פְּגִיעָה אֶלָּא תְּפִלָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתָּה אַל תִּתְפַּלֵּל בְּעַד הָעָם הַזֶּה וְאַל תִּשָּׂא בַעֲדָם רִנָּה וּתְפִלָּה וְאַל תִּפְגַּע בִּי״.
sentences.human_translation: “And was numbered with the transgressors,” that he was counted among those who died in the desert, “Yet he bore the sin of many,” as he atoned for the incident of the Golden Calf. “And made intercession [ yafgia ] for the transgressors,” as he requested mercy for the sinners of Israel that they should engage in repentance. And pegia nothing other prayer, as it is stated: “Therefore pray not you for this people, neither lift up cry nor prayer for them, neither make intercession [ tifga ] to Me;
sentences.llm_translation: "And for the transgressors he shall be numbered" — that he was counted among the dead of the wilderness. "And he bore the sin of many" — that he atoned for the incident of the calf. "And for the transgressors he shall intercede" — that he sought mercy for the sinners of Israel that they may repent. And intercession is nothing but prayer, as it is stated: "Therefore do not pray for this people, nor lift up a cry or prayer for them, nor make intercession to Me."

sentences.text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַמְקַנֵּא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ
sentences.llm_translation: The one who is jealous for his wife, we will return to you.

sentences.text: הָיָה מֵבִיא אֶת מִנְחָתָהּ בְּתוֹךְ כְּפִיפָה מִצְרִית וְנוֹתְנָהּ עַל יָדֶיהָ כְּדֵי לְיַגְּעָהּ.
sentences.human_translation: would bring meal-offering in an Egyptian wicker basket and he would place in her hands in order to fatigue her.
sentences.llm_translation: He would bring her meal-offering in an Egyptian basket and place it on her hands in order to wave it.

sentences.text: כׇּל הַמְּנָחוֹת תְּחִילָּתָן וְסוֹפָן בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת, וְזוֹ תְּחִלָּתָהּ בִּכְפִיפָה מִצְרִית, וְסוֹפָהּ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת.
sentences.human_translation: all meal-offerings, their beginnings, and their ends, in a service vessel. But this one, its beginning is in a wicker basket and its end, in a service vessel.
sentences.llm_translation: All the meal offerings, their beginning and end are in a sacred vessel, and this is its beginning in an Egyptian cup, and its end in a sacred vessel.

sentences.text: כׇּל הַמְּנָחוֹת טְעוּנוֹת שֶׁמֶן וּלְבוֹנָה, וְזוֹ אֵינָהּ טְעוּנָה לֹא שֶׁמֶן וְלֹא לְבוֹנָה. כׇּל הַמְּנָחוֹת בָּאוֹת מִן הַחִטִּין, וְזוֹ בָּאָה מִן הַשְּׂעוֹרִין. מִנְחַת הָעוֹמֶר, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁבָּאָה מִן הַשְּׂעוֹרִין — הִיא הָיְתָה בָּאָה גֶּרֶשׂ, וְזוֹ בָּאָה קֶמַח. רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמַּעֲשֶׂיהָ מַעֲשֵׂה בְּהֵמָה, כָּךְ קׇרְבָּנָהּ מַאֲכַל בְּהֵמָה.
sentences.human_translation: All meal-offerings require oil and frankincense, and this one requires neither oil nor frankincense. all meal-offerings are brought from wheat, and this one is brought from barley. Although the omer meal-offering brought from barley, it was brought as groats, is brought as flour. Rabban Gamliel says: just as her actions were the actions of an animal, so too her offering is animal food,
sentences.llm_translation: All the meal offerings require oil and frankincense, except this one which does not require either oil or frankincense. All meal offerings come from wheat, except this one which comes from barley. The Omer meal offering, even though it comes from barley, it was brought as a sheaf, while this one is brought as flour. Rabban Gamliel says: Just as its preparation is similar to the work of an animal, so too its offering is food for an animal.

sentences.text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, אַבָּא חָנִין אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: [וְכׇל כָּךְ לָמָּה —] כְּדֵי לְיַגְּעָהּ, כְּדֵי שֶׁתַּחֲזוֹר בָּהּ. אִם כָּכָה חָסָה תּוֹרָה עַל עוֹבְרֵי רְצוֹנוֹ, קַל וָחוֹמֶר עַל עוֹשֵׂי רְצוֹנוֹ.
sentences.human_translation: It is taught Abba Ḥanin says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: And why so much in order to fatigue her, so that she will retract if the Torah is so protective of those who transgress His will, a fortiori of those who do His will.
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, tanya, Abba Hanin says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: And why all this? In order to toil in it, in order that it may be retained. If so, the Torah has mercy on those who transgress His will, all the more so on those who do His will."

sentences.text: וּמִמַּאי מִשּׁוּם דְּחָסָה הוּא? דִּילְמָא כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלֹא תִּימָּחֵק מְגִילָּה! קָסָבַר
sentences.human_translation: And from where because is protective Perhaps in order that the scroll will not be erased. holds
sentences.llm_translation: And from what is it derived that it is due to anger? Perhaps it is in order that the Megillah not be erased! He holds the opinion

sentences.text: מַשְׁקָהּ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַקְרִיב אֶת מִנְחָתָהּ. דְּאִי מִשּׁוּם מְגִילָּה הָא אִימְּחִיקָא לַהּ.
sentences.human_translation: give to drink, and afterward sacrifice her meal-offering. if due to the scroll, it was erased
sentences.llm_translation: Beverage, and afterwards brings her meal offering. For if due to the scroll, this is a contradiction to it.

sentences.text: כׇּל הַמְּנָחוֹת וְכוּ׳. וּרְמִינְהוּ: סֵדֶר מְנָחוֹת, כֵּיצַד? אָדָם מֵבִיא מִנְחָה מִתּוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ בִּקְלָתוֹת שֶׁל כֶּסֶף וְשֶׁל זָהָב, וְנוֹתְנָהּ לְתוֹךְ כְּלִי שָׁרֵת, וּמְקַדְּשָׁהּ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת, וְנוֹתֵן עָלֶיהָ שַׁמְנָהּ וּלְבוֹנָתָהּ, וּמוֹלִיכָהּ אֵצֶל כֹּהֵן. וְכֹהֵן מוֹלִיכָהּ אֵצֶל מִזְבֵּחַ, וּמַגִּישָׁהּ בְּקֶרֶן דְּרוֹמִית מַעֲרָבִית כְּנֶגֶד חוּדָּהּ שֶׁל קֶרֶן, וְדַיּוֹ.
sentences.human_translation: All meal-offerings, raises a contradiction What is the procedure for meal-offerings? A person brings his meal-offering from his property in baskets [ kelatot ] of silver and of gold, and he places it in a service vessel and sanctifies it in service vessel, and he puts its oil and frankincense on it, and he carries it to the priest. And the priest carries it to the altar and brings it near to the southwest horn opposite the corner of the horn And is sufficient.
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: "All the meal offerings, etc." And they raised a dilemma: The order of meal offerings, how? A person brings a meal offering from within his house in silver and gold baskets, and places it into a service vessel, and sanctifies it in a service vessel, and puts on it its oil and frankincense, and brings it to the priest. And the priest brings it to the altar, and offers it on the northeastern corner opposite the southwestern corner of the altar, and that suffices.

sentences.text: וּמְסַלֵּק אֶת הַלְּבוֹנָה לְצַד אֶחָד, וְקוֹמֵץ מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁנִּתְרַבָּה שַׁמְנָהּ וְנוֹתְנוֹ לְתוֹךְ כְּלִי שָׁרֵת, וּמְקַדְּשׁוֹ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת. וּמְלַקֵּט אֶת לְבוֹנָתָהּ וְנוֹתְנָהּ עַל גַּבָּיו, וּמַעֲלֶה אוֹתוֹ לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ, וּמַעֲלֵהוּ וּמַקְטִירוֹ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת, וּמוֹלְחוֹ, וְנוֹתְנוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי הָאִישִּׁים.
sentences.human_translation: And removes the frankincense to one side, and he removes a handful from the place where its oil has accumulated and he puts into a service vessel and consecrates it in service vessel. And he gathers its frankincense and puts it on top of and brings it up onto the altar. And he brings it up and burns it in service vessel; and he salts it and places it upon the fires.
sentences.llm_translation: And removes the frankincense to one side, and gathers from the place where its fat has increased and puts it into a service vessel, and sanctifies it in a service vessel. And collects its frankincense and puts it on its back, and brings it up to the top of the altar, and brings it up and burns it in a service vessel, and salts it, and puts it on the woodpile.

sentences.text: קָרַב הַקּוֹמֶץ שְׁיָרֶיהָ נֶאֱכָלִין, וְרַשָּׁאִין הַכֹּהֲנִים לִיתֵּן לְתוֹכָהּ יַיִן וְשֶׁמֶן וּדְבַשׁ, וְאֵין אֲסוּרִין אֶלָּא מִלְּחַמֵּץ.
sentences.human_translation: the handful is sacrificed, the remainders of are eaten. And the priests are permitted to put wine and oil and honey in it, And they are prohibited only from allowing to become leavened.
sentences.llm_translation: The close parts of the offering are eaten, and the priests are permitted to place wine, oil, and honey inside it, and they are only forbidden from leaven.

sentences.text: קָתָנֵי מִיהָא בִּקְלָתוֹת שֶׁל כֶּסֶף וּבִקְלָתוֹת שֶׁל זָהָב! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אֵימָא בְּכֵלִים הָרְאוּיִין לִכְלֵי שָׁרֵת.
sentences.human_translation: In any event, teaches in baskets of silver and baskets of gold Rav Pappa said: say in vessels these are suitable to be service vessels
sentences.llm_translation: It was taught in one place regarding silver vessels and regarding gold vessels! Rav Papa said: Say with vessels fit for service.

sentences.text: מִכְּלַל דִּכְפִיפָה מִצְרִית לָא חַזְיָא, כְּמַאן — דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּתַנְיָא: כְּלֵי שָׁרֵת שֶׁעֲשָׂאָן שֶׁל עֵץ, רַבִּי פּוֹסֵל וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר.
sentences.human_translation: by inference that an Egyptian wicker basket is not suitable In accordance with whose not in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught service vessels that were made of wood, Rabbi deems them unfit, and Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, deems them fit.
sentences.llm_translation: From the principle of an Egyptian basket, it is not seen. Like who? — Like one who is not like Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught: Vessels of service made of wood, Rabbi Posa'el and Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda deem them unfit and fit.

sentences.text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אֵימַר דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּחֲשׁוּבִין, בִּפְחוּתִין מִי אָמַר? לֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה ״הַקְרִיבֵהוּ נָא לְפֶחָתֶךָ״?!
sentences.human_translation: You even say that Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda. Say that Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says with regard to superior does he say with regard to lesser Doesn’t Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, hold present it now unto your governor,
sentences.llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, should we say that Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, said regarding the important ones, who did he say it regarding the less important ones? Does Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, not have "Bring him near to your less important one"?!

sentences.text: וְנוֹתְנָהּ לִכְלֵי שָׁרֵת, וּמְקַדְּשָׁהּ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת. שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ — כְּלִי שָׁרֵת אֵין מְקַדְּשִׁין אֶלָּא מִדַּעַת? אֵימָא: נוֹתְנָהּ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת לְקַדְּשָׁהּ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת.
sentences.human_translation: He places it in a service vessel and sanctifies it in service vessel. learn from service vessels can sanctify only with intention? Say: He places it in the service vessel to sanctify it in the service vessel.
sentences.llm_translation: And she shall place it in the vessels of the service, and sanctify it in the vessels of the service. You heard from it - vessels of the service only sanctify with intent? Say: She places it in the vessels of the service to sanctify it in the vessels of the service.

sentences.text: וְנוֹתֵן עָלֶיהָ שַׁמְנָהּ וּלְבוֹנָתָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיָצַק עָלֶיהָ שֶׁמֶן וְנָתַן עָלֶיהָ לְבֹנָה״.
sentences.human_translation: puts its oil and frankincense on it. As it is stated: and he shall pour oil upon it, and put frankincense thereon”
sentences.llm_translation: And he shall place upon it its oil and its frankincense, as it is stated: "And he shall pour upon it oil and place upon it frankincense."

sentences.text: וּמוֹלִיכָהּ אֵצֶל כֹּהֵן, דִּכְתִיב: ״וֶהֱבִיאָהּ אֶל בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: And he carries it to the priest. As it is written: “And he shall bring it to Aaron’s sons,
sentences.llm_translation: And he shall bring her to the kohen, as it is written: "And he shall bring her to the sons of Aharon, etc."

sentences.text: וְכֹהֵן מוֹלִיכָהּ אֵצֶל מִזְבֵּחַ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִגִּישָׁהּ אֵצֶל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״.
sentences.human_translation: And the priest carries it to the altar. As it is written: and he shall bring it unto the altar”
sentences.llm_translation: The Kohen shall bring it near the altar, as it is written: "And he shall bring it near the altar."

sentences.text: מַגִּישָׁהּ בְּקֶרֶן דְּרוֹמִית מַעֲרָבִית כְּנֶגֶד חוּדָּהּ שֶׁל קֶרֶן וְדַיּוֹ. מְנָלַן —
sentences.human_translation: brings it near to the southwest horn opposite the corner of the horn. And is sufficient. From where do we
sentences.llm_translation: He presents it with the horn of the southern-western corner opposite the chamber of the horn and enough. Whence do we derive this?

sentences.text: דִּכְתִיב: ״וְזֹאת תּוֹרַת הַמִּנְחָה הַקְרֵב אוֹתָהּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֶל פְּנֵי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״, וְתַנְיָא: ״לִפְנֵי ה׳״, יָכוֹל בַּמַּעֲרָב — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֶל פְּנֵי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״. אִי אֶל פְּנֵי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, יָכוֹל בַּדָּרוֹם — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לִפְנֵי ה׳״. הָא כֵּיצַד — מַגִּישָׁהּ בְּקֶרֶן דְּרוֹמִית מַעֲרָבִית כְּנֶגֶד חוּדָּהּ שֶׁל קֶרֶן, וְדַיּוֹ.
sentences.human_translation: As it is written: “And this is the law of the meal-offering: The sons of Aaron shall offer it before the Lord in front of the altar” And it is taught “Before the Lord,” might on the western side the verse states: “In front of the altar.” If In front of the altar, might on the southern side. the verse states: “Before the Lord,” How these brings it near to the southwest corner opposite the corner of the horn. And is sufficient.
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is written: "And this is the law of the meal offering: the sons of Aaron shall offer it before the Lord, in front of the altar." And it was taught: "Before the Lord," one might think to the west — the teaching is necessary to say: "in front of the altar." If not in front of the altar, one might think to the south — the teaching is necessary to say: "before the Lord." How so? One brings it in the southwestern corner opposite the corner of the altar, and it suffices.

sentences.text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל יַגִּישֶׁנָּה בְּמַעֲרָבָהּ שֶׁל קֶרֶן אוֹ לִדְרוֹמָהּ שֶׁל קֶרֶן — אָמַרְתָּ: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה מוֹצֵא שְׁנֵי מִקְרָאוֹת, אֶחָד מְקַיֵּים עַצְמוֹ וּמְקַיֵּים דִּבְרֵי חֲבֵירוֹ, וְאֶחָד מְקַיֵּים עַצְמוֹ וּמְבַטֵּל דִּבְרֵי חֲבֵירוֹ — מַנִּיחִין אֶת שֶׁמְּקַיֵּים עַצְמוֹ וּמְבַטֵּל חֲבֵירוֹ, וְתוֹפְסִין אֶת שֶׁמְּקַיֵּים עַצְמוֹ וּמְקַיֵּים חֲבֵירוֹ. כְּשֶׁאַתָּה אוֹמֵר ״לִפְנֵי ה׳״ בַּמַּעֲרָב — בִּטַּלְתָּה ״אֶל פְּנֵי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״ בַּדָּרוֹם, וּכְשֶׁאַתָּה אוֹמֵר ״אֶל פְּנֵי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״ בַּדָּרוֹם, קִיַּימְתָּה ״לִפְנֵי ה׳״ בַּמַּעֲרָב. הָא כֵּיצַד? מַגִּישָׁהּ לִדְרוֹמָהּ שֶׁל קֶרֶן.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says might he offers it up on the western side of the corner or on the southern side of the corner. Say: Anywhere you find two verses, one fulfills itself and fulfills the statement of the other, and one fulfills itself and nullifies the statement of the other, leave that fulfills itself and nullifies the other, and seize the one that fulfills itself and fulfills the other. When you say: “Before the Lord,” on the western side, you have nullified “In front of the altar,” on the southern side. But when you say: “In front of the altar,” on the southern side, you have fulfilled: “Before the Lord,” on the western side. How so? He brings it near to the southern side of the corner.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: One might have thought to bring it near to the western side of the altar horn or to its southern side of the horn - you say: In any place where you find two verses, one establishing itself and establishing the words of its fellow, and one establishing itself and nullifying the words of its fellow - we leave the one that establishes itself and nullifies its fellow, and we take the one that establishes itself and establishes its fellow. When you say "before the Lord" in the west - you nullified "to the front of the altar" in the south, and when you say "to the front of the altar" in the south, you established "before the Lord" in the west. How so? Bring it near to the southern side of the horn.

sentences.text: וְהֵיכָן קִיַּימְתָּה? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: קָסָבַר הַאי תַּנָּא כּוּלֵּיהּ מִזְבֵּחַ בְּצָפוֹן קָאֵי.
sentences.human_translation: But where have you fulfilled Rav Ashi said: This tanna holds the entire altar stands in the north
sentences.llm_translation: And where was it established? Rav Ashi said: He holds that this Tanna maintains that the entire altar is situated in the north.

sentences.text: מַאי ״וְדַיּוֹ״? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: תִּיבְּעֵי הַגָּשַׁת מִנְחָה גּוּפַהּ, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
sentences.human_translation: What And is sufficient? Rav Ashi said: was necessary, enter your mind to say: Require to bring the meal-offering itself near teaches us
sentences.llm_translation: What is "vedayo"? Rav Ashei said: It was necessary, for had your mind not said, I would have said: It requires the offering of its own meal offering, which teaches us.

sentences.text: וְאֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהִקְרִיבָהּ אֶל הַכֹּהֵן וְגוֹ׳ וְהִגִּישָׁהּ אֶל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״ — מָה הַקְרָבָה אֵצֶל כֹּהֵן בִּכְלִי, אַף הַגָּשָׁה אֵצֶל מִזְבֵּחַ בִּכְלִי.
sentences.human_translation: And say indeed The verse states: and it shall be presented unto the priest, and he shall bring it unto the altar” just as presentation to the priest is in a vessel, so too bringing to the altar in a vessel.
sentences.llm_translation: And why not say it like this? The verse says: "And he shall bring it to the kohen, etc., and he shall bring it near to the altar" — just as bringing near to the kohen is with a vessel, so too bringing near to the altar is with a vessel.

sentences.text: וּמְסַלֵּק אֶת לְבוֹנָתָהּ לְצַד אֶחָד. כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא תִּקְּמוֹץ בַּהֲדֵי מִנְחָה, כְּדִתְנַן: קָמַץ וְעָלָה בְּיָדוֹ צְרוֹר אוֹ גַּרְגֵּר מֶלַח אוֹ קוֹרֶט לְבוֹנָה — פָּסוּל.
sentences.human_translation: And he removes its frankincense to one side. in order that not be removed along with the meal-offering As we learned removed handful and a pebble, or a grain of salt, or a crumb [ koret ] of frankincense came out in his hand, it is invalid.
sentences.llm_translation: And removes its frankincense to one side. For so that it should not become crumbled in the hands of the offering, as we learned: If one crumbled and offered in his hand a handful or a lump of salt or a piece of frankincense - it is invalid.

sentences.text: וְקוֹמֵץ מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁנִּתְרַבָּה שַׁמְנָהּ. מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב ״מִסׇּלְתָּהּ וּמִשַּׁמְנָהּ״, ״מִגִּרְשָׂהּ וּמִשַּׁמְנָהּ״.
sentences.human_translation: And he removes a handful from the place where its oil has accumulated. From where do we As it is written: of the fine flour thereof, and of the oil thereof” of the groats thereof, and of the oil thereof”
sentences.llm_translation: "And a handful from where its fat increased. From where do we derive this? As it is written, 'from its fine flour and from its fat,' 'from its threshing floor and from its fat.'"

sentences.text: וְנוֹתְנוֹ לְתוֹךְ כְּלִי שָׁרֵת וּמְקַדְּשׁוֹ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת. לְמָה לִי? הָא קַדְּשַׁהּ חֲדָא זִימְנָא! מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַדָּם; דָּם, אַף עַל גַּב דְּקַדֵּישְׁתֵּיהּ סַכִּין בְּצַוַּאר בְּהֵמָה, הֲדַר מְקַדֵּישׁ לֵיהּ בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת, הָכָא נָמֵי לָא שְׁנָא.
sentences.human_translation: And he puts into a service vessel and sanctifies it in service vessel. Why do I He has sanctified it once, just as with blood Although the knife sanctifies blood the neck of the animal, sanctifies it again in the service vessel. Here too, it is not different;
sentences.llm_translation: And he shall place it within a service vessel and sanctify it in a service vessel. Why do I need it? This sanctification is only temporary! For as long as a person is alive; its blood, even though he sanctified the knife on the neck of an animal, he can sanctify it in a service vessel, here too it is no different.

sentences.text: וּמְלַקֵּט אֶת לְבוֹנָתָהּ וְנוֹתְנָהּ עַל גַּבָּיו — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֶת כׇּל הַלְּבוֹנָה אֲשֶׁר עַל הַמִּנְחָה״.
sentences.human_translation: And he gathers its frankincense and puts it on top of As it is written: and all the frankincense which is upon the meal-offering”
sentences.llm_translation: "And gathering its frankincense and placing it upon its handful" - as it is written: "And all the frankincense that is upon the meal-offering."

sentences.text: וּמַעֲלֵהוּ
sentences.human_translation: And he brings it up
sentences.llm_translation: And he brings it up.

text: שִׁילֹה נוֹב וְגִבְעוֹן וּבֵית עוֹלָמִים.

אִיסִי בֶּן מְנַחֵם אוֹמֵר, אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ: וּמָה בְּטוּמְאָה קַלָּה לֹא חָלַק הַכָּתוּב — בְּטוּמְאַת אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ חֲמוּרָה, לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן? אִם כֵּן מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בְּקַרְקַע הַמִּשְׁכָּן״ — שֶׁלֹּא יָבִיא מִתּוֹךְ קוּפָּתוֹ.
אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: אֵין שָׁם עָפָר, מַהוּ שֶׁיִּתֵּן אֵפֶר? אַלִּיבָּא דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ, דְּאָמְרִי: לֹא מָצִינוּ אֵפֶר שֶׁקָּרוּי ״עָפָר״.

כִּי תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ, אַלִּיבָּא דְּבֵית הִלֵּל דְּאָמְרִי: מָצִינוּ אֵפֶר שֶׁקָּרוּי ״עָפָר״, מַאי? אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיקְּרִי ״עָפָר״, הָכָא ״בְּקַרְקַע הַמִּשְׁכָּן״ כְּתִיב, אוֹ דִילְמָא הַאי ״בְּקַרְקַע הַמִּשְׁכָּן״ לְכִדְאִיסִי בֶּן יְהוּדָה וּלְכִדְאִיסִי בֶּן מְנַחֵם הוּא דְּאָתֵי?
תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה מְקוֹמוֹת הֲלָכָה עוֹקֶבֶת מִקְרָא.
הַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה בְּ״עָפָר״, וַהֲלָכָה בְּכׇל דָּבָר. הַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה בְּ״תַעַר״, וַהֲלָכָה בְּכׇל דָּבָר. הַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה ״סֵפֶר״, וַהֲלָכָה בְּכׇל דָּבָר.
וְאִם אִיתָא — לִיחְשׁוֹב נָמֵי הַאי!

תְּנָא וְשַׁיַּיר. וּמַאי שַׁיַּיר דְּהַאי שַׁיַּיר? שַׁיַּיר מְצוֹרָע, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְהָיָה בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי יְגַלַּח אֶת כׇּל שְׂעָרוֹ״ — כְּלָל, ״אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ וְאֶת זְקָנוֹ וְאֵת גַּבֹּת עֵינָיו״ — פְּרָט, ״וְאֶת כָּל שְׂעָרוֹ יְגַלֵּחַ״ — חָזַר וְכָלַל. כְּלָל וּפְרָט וּכְלָל — אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְעֵין הַפְּרָט. מָה פְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ: מְקוֹם כִּינּוּס שֵׂעָר וְנִרְאֶה — אַף כׇּל מָקוֹם כִּינּוּס שֵׂעָר וְנִרְאֶה.
מָה רַבִּי — רַבִּי שְׂעַר הָרַגְלַיִם. מַאי מִיעֵט — מִיעֵט דְּבֵית הַשֶּׁחִי וּדְכוּלֵּיהּ גּוּפֵיהּ.

וְהִלְכְתָא: מְגַלֵּחַ כְּדַלַּעַת. דִּתְנַן: בָּא לוֹ לְהַקִּיף אֶת הַמְצוֹרָע — מַעֲבִיר תַּעַר עַל כׇּל בְּשָׂרוֹ, וְקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: וּבַיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי מְגַלְּחוֹ תִּגְלַחַת שְׁנִיָּה כְּתִגְלַחַת רִאשׁוֹנָה.
אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: כִּי קָא חָשֵׁיב, הֲלָכָה עוֹקֶבֶת מִקְרָא, הָא עוֹקֶבֶת מִדְּרַבָּנַן הִיא.
רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: כִּי קָא חָשֵׁיב הֲלָכָה עוֹקֶבֶת וְעוֹקֶרֶת, הָא עוֹקֶבֶת וּמוֹסֶפֶת הִיא.
רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: הָא מַתְנִיתָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל הִיא, דְּדָרֵישׁ כְּלָלֵי וּפְרָטֵי.
