״וַיִּקְרָא שִׁמְשׁוֹן אֶל ה׳ וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֱלֹהִים זׇכְרֵנִי נָא וְחַזְּקֵנִי נָא אַךְ הַפַּעַם הַזֶּה וְאִנָּקְמָה נְקַם אַחַת מִשְּׁתֵי עֵינַי מִפְּלִשְׁתִּים״. אָמַר רַב: אָמַר שִׁמְשׁוֹן לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, זְכוֹר לִי עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁתַּיִם שָׁנָה שֶׁשָּׁפַטְתִּי אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְלֹא אָמַרְתִּי לְאֶחָד מֵהֶם הַעֲבֵר לִי מַקֵּל מִמָּקוֹם לְמָקוֹם.

״וַיֵּלֶךְ שִׁמְשׁוֹן וַיִּלְכֹּד שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת שׁוּעָלִים״. מַאי שְׁנָא שׁוּעָלִים? אָמַר רַבִּי אַיְּבוּ בַּר נַגְדִּי אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: אָמַר שִׁמְשׁוֹן, יָבֹא מִי שֶׁחוֹזֵר לַאֲחוֹרָיו, וְיִפָּרַע מִפְּלִשְׁתִּים שֶׁחָזְרוּ בִּשְׁבוּעָתָן.

תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הֶחָסִיד: בֵּין כְּתֵיפָיו שֶׁל שִׁמְשׁוֹן שִׁשִּׁים אַמָּה הָיָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּשְׁכַּב שִׁמְשׁוֹן עַד חֲצִי הַלַּיְלָה וַיָּקׇם בַּחֲצִי הַלַּיְלָה וַיֶּאֱחֹז בְּדַלְתוֹת שַׁעַר הָעִיר וּבִשְׁתֵּי הַמְּזוּזוֹת וַיִּסָּעֵם עִם הַבְּרִיחַ וַיָּשֶׂם עַל כְּתֵיפָיו״, וּגְמִירִי דְּאֵין דַּלְתוֹת עַזָּה פְּחוּתוֹת מִשִּׁשִּׁים אַמָּה.

״וַיְהִי טוֹחֵן בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִים״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין טְחִינָה אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן עֲבֵירָה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״תִּטְחַן לְאַחֵר אִשְׁתִּי״. מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד הֵבִיא לוֹ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ לְבֵית הָאֲסוּרִים כְּדֵי שֶׁתִּתְעַבֵּר הֵימֶנּוּ. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: קַמֵּי דְּשָׁתֵי חַמְרָא — חַמְרָא, קַמֵּי רָפוֹקָא (גְּרִידְיָא — דּוּבְלָא).

וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַמְזַנֶּה — אִשְׁתּוֹ (מְזַנֶּנֶת) [מְזַנָּה] עָלָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִם נִפְתָּה לִבִּי עַל אִשָּׁה וְעַל פֶּתַח רֵעִי אָרָבְתִּי״, וּכְתִיב: ״תִּטְחַן לְאַחֵר אִשְׁתִּי וְעָלֶיהָ יִכְרְעוּן אֲחֵרִין״, וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: אִיהוּ בֵּי קָארֵי, וְאִיתְּתֵיהּ בֵּי בוּצִינֵי.

וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שִׁמְשׁוֹן דָּן אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל כַּאֲבִיהֶם שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״דָּן יָדִין עַמּוֹ כְּאַחַד וְגוֹ׳״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שִׁמְשׁוֹן עַל שְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא נִקְרָא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי שֶׁמֶשׁ וּמָגֵן ה׳ אֱלֹהִים וְגוֹ׳״. אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, לֹא יִמָּחֶה! אֶלָּא: מֵעֵין שְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: מָה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מֵגֵין עַל כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ — אַף שִׁמְשׁוֹן מֵגֵין בְּדוֹרוֹ עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל.
וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בִּלְעָם חִיגֵּר בְּרַגְלוֹ אַחַת הָיָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וַיֵּלֶךְ שֶׁפִי״. שִׁמְשׁוֹן חִיגֵּר בִּשְׁתֵּי רַגְלָיו הָיָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שְׁפִיפֹן עֲלֵי אֹרַח״.

תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חֲמִשָּׁה נִבְרְאוּ מֵעֵין דּוּגְמָא שֶׁל מַעְלָה, וְכוּלָּן לָקוּ בָּהֶן. שִׁמְשׁוֹן בְּכֹחוֹ, שָׁאוּל בְּצַוָּארוֹ, אַבְשָׁלוֹם בִּשְׂעָרוֹ, צִדְקִיָּה בְּעֵינָיו, אָסָא בְּרַגְלָיו.
שִׁמְשׁוֹן בְּכֹחוֹ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּסַר כֹּחוֹ מֵעָלָיו״.
שָׁאוּל בְּצַוָּארוֹ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּקַּח שָׁאוּל אֶת הַחֶרֶב וַיִּפֹּל עָלֶיהָ״.
אַבְשָׁלוֹם בִּשְׂעָרוֹ, כִּדְבָעֵינַן לְמֵימַר קַמַּן. צִדְקִיָּה בְּעֵינָיו, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֶת עֵינֵי צִדְקִיָּהוּ עִוֵּר״.

אָסָא בְּרַגְלָיו, דִּכְתִיב: ״רַק לְעֵת זִקְנָתוֹ חָלָה אֶת רַגְלָיו״, וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: שֶׁאֲחָזַתּוּ פָּדַגְרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר זוּטְרָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן לְרַב נַחְמָן: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי פָּדַגְרָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּמַחַט בִּבְשַׂר הַחַי. מְנָא יָדַע? אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: מֵיחַשׁ הֲוָה חָשׁ בֵּיהּ. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: מֵרַבֵּיהּ שְׁמַע לֵיהּ. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: ״סוֹד ה׳ לִירֵאָיו וּבְרִיתוֹ לְהוֹדִיעָם״.

דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא: מִפְּנֵי מָה נֶעֱנַשׁ אָסָא — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁעָשָׂה אַנְגַּרְיָא בְּתַלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהַמֶּלֶךְ אָסָא הִשְׁמִיעַ אֶת כׇּל יְהוּדָה אֵין נָקִי״. מַאי ״אֵין נָקִי״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אֲפִילּוּ חָתָן מֵחֶדְרוֹ וְכַלָּה מֵחוּפָּתָהּ.

כְּתִיב: ״וַיֵּרֶד שִׁמְשׁוֹן תִּמְנָתָה״, וּכְתִיב: ״הִנֵּה חָמִיךְ עֹלֶה תִמְנָתָה״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שִׁמְשׁוֹן שֶׁנִּתְגַּנָּה בָּהּ — כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ יְרִידָה. יְהוּדָה שֶׁנִּתְעַלָּה בָּהּ — כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ עֲלִיָּה.
רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: שְׁתֵּי תִּמְנָאוֹת הָיוּ, חֲדָא בִּירִידָה, וַחֲדָא בַּעֲלִיָּה.
רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: חֲדָא תִּמְנָה הֲוַאי, דְּאָתֵי מֵהַאי גִּיסָא — יְרִידָה, וּדְאָתֵי מֵהַאי גִּיסָא — עֲלִיָּה. כְּגוֹן וַרְדּוֹנְיָא וּבֵי בָארֵי וְשׁוּקָא דְנַרֶשׁ.

״וַתֵּשֶׁב בְּפֶתַח עֵינַיִם״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִי: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָלְכָה וְיָשְׁבָה לָהּ בְּפִתְחוֹ שֶׁל אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ, מָקוֹם שֶׁכׇּל עֵינַיִם צוֹפוֹת לִרְאוֹתוֹ. רַבִּי חָנִין אָמַר רַב: מָקוֹם הוּא שֶׁשְּׁמוֹ עֵינַיִם, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״תַּפּוּחַ וְהָעֵינָם״.

רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: שֶׁנָּתְנָה עֵינַיִם לִדְבָרֶיהָ. כְּשֶׁתְּבָעָהּ אָמַר לָהּ: שֶׁמָּא נׇכְרִית אַתְּ? אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: גִּיּוֹרֶת אֲנִי. שֶׁמָּא אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ אַתְּ? אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: פְּנוּיָה אֲנִי. שֶׁמָּא קִיבֵּל בִּךְ אָבִיךָ קִידּוּשִׁין? אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: יְתוֹמָה אֲנִי. שֶׁמָּא טְמֵאָה אַתְּ? אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: טְהוֹרָה אֲנִי.
״וַיִּטַּע אֶשֶׁל בִּבְאֵר שָׁבַע״, אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁעָשָׂה פַּרְדֵּס, וְנָטַע בּוֹ כׇּל מִינֵי מְגָדִים.

רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, חַד אָמַר: פַּרְדֵּס, וְחַד אָמַר: פּוּנְדָּק. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר פַּרְדֵּס, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״וַיִּטַּע״. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר פּוּנְדָּק, מַאי ״וַיִּטַּע״? כְּדִכְתִיב: ״וַיִּטַּע אׇהֳלֵי אַפַּדְנוֹ וְגוֹ׳״.
״וַיִּקְרָא שָׁם בְּשֵׁם ה׳ אֵל עוֹלָם״. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״וַיִּקְרָא״,

אֶלָּא ״וַיַּקְרִיא״. מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִקְרִיא אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ לִשְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּפֶה כׇּל עוֹבֵר וָשָׁב. כֵּיצַד? לְאַחַר שֶׁאָכְלוּ וְשָׁתוּ, עָמְדוּ לְבָרְכוֹ. אָמַר לָהֶם: וְכִי מִשֶּׁלִּי אֲכַלְתֶּם? מִשֶּׁל אֱלֹהֵי עוֹלָם אֲכַלְתֶּם! הוֹדוּ וְשַׁבְּחוּ וּבָרְכוּ לְמִי שֶׁאָמַר וְהָיָה הָעוֹלָם.
״וַיִּרְאֶהָ יְהוּדָה וַיַּחְשְׁבֶהָ לְזוֹנָה כִּי כִסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ״. מִשּׁוּם דְּכִסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ, חַשְּׁבַהּ לְזוֹנָה?!

אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שֶׁכִּסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: כׇּל כַּלָּה שֶׁהִיא צְנוּעָה בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ — זוֹכָה וְיוֹצְאִין מִמֶּנָּה מְלָכִים וּנְבִיאִים. מְנָלַן — מִתָּמָר. נְבִיאִים — דִּכְתִיב: ״חֲזוֹן יְשַׁעְיָהוּ בֶן אָמוֹץ״. מְלָכִים — מִדָּוִד. וְאָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: דָּבָר זֶה מָסוֹרֶת בְּיָדֵינוּ מֵאֲבוֹתֵינוּ: אָמוֹץ וַאֲמַצְיָה — אַחִים הֲווֹ.
״הִיא מוּצֵאת״. ״הִיא מִיתּוֹצֵאת״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּמְצְאוּ סִימָנֶיהָ בָּא סַמָּאֵל וְרִיחֲקָן, בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וְקֵירְבָן.

הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״לִמְנַצֵּחַ עַל יוֹנַת אֵלֶם רְחוֹקִים לְדָוִד מִכְתָּם״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁנִּתְרַחֲקוּ סִימָנֶיהָ נַעֲשֵׂית כְּיוֹנָה אִילֶּמֶת. ״לְדָוִד מִכְתָּם״: שֶׁיָּצָא מִמֶּנָּה דָּוִד, שֶׁהָיָה מָךְ וְתָם לַכֹּל. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״מִכְתָּם״ — שֶׁהָיְתָה מַכָּתוֹ תַּמָּה, שֶׁנּוֹלַד כְּשֶׁהוּא מָהוּל. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״מִכְתָּם״ — כְּשֵׁם שֶׁבְּקַטְנוּתוֹ הִקְטִין עַצְמוֹ אֵצֶל מִי שֶׁגָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה, כָּךְ בִּגְדוּלָּתוֹ.

״וְהִיא שָׁלְחָה אֶל חָמִיהָ לֵאמֹר לְאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר אֵלֶּה לּוֹ אָנֹכִי הָרָה״. וְתֵימָא לֵיהּ מֵימָר! אָמַר רַב זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא, וְאָמְרִי לָהּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: נוֹחַ לוֹ לָאָדָם שֶׁיַּפִּיל עַצְמוֹ לְתוֹךְ כִּבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ, וְאַל יַלְבִּין פְּנֵי חֲבֵירוֹ בָּרַבִּים. מְנָלַן — מִתָּמָר.

״הַכֶּר נָא״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישֵּׂר לְאָבִיו — בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישְּׂרוּהוּ. בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישֵּׂר: ״הַכֶּר נָא הַכְּתֹנֶת בִּנְךָ הִיא״. בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישְּׂרוּהוּ: ״הַכֶּר נָא לְמִי״.
״נָא״. אֵין ״נָא״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן בַּקָּשָׁה. אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: בְּבַקָּשָׁה מִמְּךָ, הַכֵּר פְּנֵי בּוֹרַאֲךָ וְאַל תַּעֲלִים עֵינֶיךָ מִמֶּנִּי.

״וַיַּכֵּר יְהוּדָה וַיֹּאמֶר צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״. הַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַב חָנִין בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא: יוֹסֵף שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בַּסֵּתֶר — זָכָה וְהוֹסִיפוּ לוֹ אוֹת אַחַת מִשְּׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״עֵדוּת בִּיהוֹסֵף שָׂמוֹ״.

יְהוּדָה שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא — זָכָה וְנִקְרָא כּוּלּוֹ עַל שְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהוֹדָה וְאָמַר ״צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״, יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: אַתָּה הִצַּלְתָּ תָּמָר וּשְׁנֵי בָּנֶיהָ מִן הָאוּר — חַיֶּיךָ שֶׁאֲנִי מַצִּיל בִּזְכוּתְךָ שְׁלֹשָׁה מִבָּנֶיךָ מִן הָאוּר. מַאן נִינְהוּ — חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה.
״צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״. מְנָא יָדַע? יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: מִמֶּנִּי יָצְאוּ כְּבוּשִׁים.

״וְלֹא יָסַף עוֹד לְדַעְתָּה״. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל סָבָא חֲמוּהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי: כֵּיוָן שֶׁיְּדָעָהּ — שׁוּב לֹא פָּסַק מִמֶּנָּה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְלֹא יָסַף עוֹד לְדַעְתָּה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״קוֹל גָּדוֹל וְלֹא יָסָף״.

אַבְשָׁלוֹם נִתְגָּאָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַבְשָׁלוֹם בִּשְׂעָרוֹ מָרַד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּכְאַבְשָׁלוֹם לֹא הָיָה אִישׁ יָפֶה וְגוֹ׳. וּבְגַלְּחוֹ אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ וְהָיָה מִקֵּץ יָמִים לַיָּמִים אֲשֶׁר יְגַלֵּחַ כִּי כָבֵד עָלָיו וְגִלְּחוֹ וְשָׁקַל אֶת שְׂעַר רֹאשׁוֹ מָאתַיִם שְׁקָלִים בְּאֶבֶן הַמֶּלֶךְ״. תָּנָא: אֶבֶן שֶׁאַנְשֵׁי טְבֶרְיָא וְאַנְשֵׁי צִיפּוֹרִי שׁוֹקְלִים בָּהּ.

לְפִיכָךְ נִתְלָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקְרָא אַבְשָׁלוֹם לִפְנֵי עַבְדֵי דָוִד וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם רֹכֵב עַל הַפֶּרֶד וַיָּבֹא הַפֶּרֶד תַּחַת שׂוֹבֶךְ הָאֵלָה הַגְּדוֹלָה וַיֶּחֱזַק רֹאשׁוֹ בָאֵלָה וַיֻּתַּן בֵּין הַשָּׁמַיִם וּבֵין הָאָרֶץ וְהַפֶּרֶד אֲשֶׁר תַּחְתָּיו עָבָר״. שְׁקַל סַפְסִירָא בְּעָא לְמִיפְסְקֵיהּ. תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִבְקַע שְׁאוֹל מִתַּחְתָּיו.

״וַיִּרְגַּז הַמֶּלֶךְ וַיַּעַל עַל עֲלִיַּית הַשַּׁעַר וַיֵּבְךְּ וְכֹה אָמַר בְּלֶכְתּוֹ בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם מִי יִתֵּן מוּתִי אֲנִי תַחְתֶּיךָ אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי. וְהַמֶּלֶךְ לָאַט אֶת פָּנָיו וַיִּזְעַק הַמֶּלֶךְ קוֹל גָּדוֹל בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי״. הָנֵי תְּמָנְיָא ״בְּנִי״ לְמָה? שִׁבְעָה דְּאַסְּקֵיהּ מִשִּׁבְעָה מְדוֹרֵי גֵיהִנָּם, וְאִידַּךְ, אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּקָרֵיב רֵישֵׁיהּ לְגַבֵּי גוּפֵיהּ, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּאַיְיתֵיהּ לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי.

״וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם לָקַח וַיַּצֶּב לוֹ בְחַיָּיו״. מַאי ״לָקַח״? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: שֶׁלָּקַח מִקָּח רַע לְעַצְמוֹ. ״אֶת מַצֶּבֶת אֲשֶׁר בְּעֵמֶק הַמֶּלֶךְ וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא: בְּעֵצָה עֲמוּקָּה שֶׁל מַלְכּוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם,
llm_translation: The week of Abimelech began, as it is written: "If you deal falsely with me and with my offspring and with my posterity."

"And the youth grew up, and the Lord blessed him." With what did He bless him? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, that He blessed him with his mother's cubit: His mother's cubit like that of other people, and his seed like a flowing stream.

"And Samson called to the Lord and said, 'Lord God, please remember me and strengthen me, please, just this once, O God, that I may be avenged with one vengeance for my two eyes from the Philistines.' Rav said: Samson said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, remember for me the twenty-two years that I judged Israel, and I did not say to any one of them, 'Pass to me a staff from place to place.'"

"And Samson went and caught three hundred foxes." What is different about foxes? Rabbi Ayvu son of Nagdi said, Rabbi Hiyya son of Abba said: Samson said, 'Let the one who turns back behind him come, and take revenge on the Philistines who went back on their oath.'"

It was taught: Rabbi Shimon the Pious said: Between the shoulders of Samson there were sixty cubits, as it is stated: "And Samson lay until midnight, and at midnight he arose, and took hold of the doors of the gate of the city, and the two doorposts, and pulled them up, bar and all, and put them on his shoulders." And it is learned that there are no doors stronger or weaker than sixty cubits.

"And it came to pass, while he was talking with them in prison." Rabbi Yochanan said: "Tachina is nothing but a language of transgression," as it says: "Grind for another my wife." This teaches that each and every one brought his wife to prison so that she would become pregnant by him. Rav Papa said: This is what people say: in front of a wine-drinker, wine; in front of a beer-drinker, beer.

And Rabbi Yochanan said: Anyone who provides sustenance - his wife (provides sustenance) is sustained by him, as it is stated: "If my heart has been enticed by a woman, and I have lain in wait at my neighbor's door." And it is written: "Let my wife grind for another, and let others bow down over her." And this is what people say: He is of the family of Karai, and his wife is of the family of Butzinei.

And Rabbi Yochanan said: Samson judged Israel like their Father in Heaven, as it is stated: "Dan will judge his people like one." And Rabbi Yochanan said: Samson was called by the name of the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is stated: "For the Lord God is a sun and shield." Rather, from now on, he will not be erased! Rather, from the likeness of the name of the Holy One, blessed be He: Just as the Holy One, blessed be He, shields the entire world, so too Samson shielded in his generation over Israel.
And said Rabbi Yochanan: Balaam limped with one foot, as it is said, "And he went limping." Samson limped with both his feet, as it is said, "Crippled upon both his legs."

The Rabbis taught: Five were created from the supernal pattern, and all of them were punished by them. Samson with his strength, Saul with his neck, Absalom with his hair, Zedekiah with his eyes, Asa with his feet.
Shimshon in his strength, as it is written: "And he removed his strength from him."
Saul in his neck, as it is written: "And Saul took the sword and fell upon it."
Avshalom in his hair, as we require to say later. Tzidkiyah in his eyes, as it is written: "And the eyes of Tzidkiyahu were blinded."

Talmudic text: Asa b'raglav, dikhtiv: "rak l'et ziknato chalah et raglav," v'amar Rav Yehudah amar Rav: she'achazatu padgara. Amar lei Mar Zutra brei d'Rav Nachman l'Rav Nachman: heichi damei padgara? Amar lei: k'machat bivsar hachai. Menah yada? Ikka d'amri: meichash hava chash beih. V'ikka d'amri: merabbei shema lei. V'ikka d'amri: "sod Hashem l'yireav u'vrito l'hodi'am." English translation: Asa with his feet, as it is written: "only in his old age did he suffer from his feet," and Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: that he had gout. Mar Zutra, son of Rav Nachman, said to Rav Nachman: How is gout similar? He said to him: Like a thread in the flesh of a living animal. How do we know? Some say: He was preoccupied with it. And some say: He learned it from his teacher. And some say: "The secret of the Lord is for those who fear Him, and His covenant to make it known to them."

Rava expounded: For what reason was Asa punished? Because he made an enclosure for the disciples of the sages, as it is stated: "And King Asa proclaimed throughout Judah, none is clean." What is meant by "none is clean"? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Even a groom from his bridal chamber and a bride from her wedding canopy.

It is written: "And Samson went down to Timnah," and it is written: "Behold, your father-in-law is going up to Timnah." Rabbi Elazar said: Samson, who was degraded through her - it is written in him descent. Judah, who was elevated through her - it is written in him ascent.
Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: Two figs there were, one in descent, and one in ascent.
Rav Papa said: One furrow is that which comes from this side - it is a descent, and that which comes from that side - it is an ascent. For example, Vardoniya, Bevarei, and the market of Nareshe.

"And she sat at the entrance of the eyes." Rabbi Alexandri said: It teaches that the halacha went and settled for her at the entrance of our father Abraham's tent, the place where all eyes gazed to see him. Rabbi Chanin said in the name of Rav: It is a place called 'Eynayim,' as it is written: 'The apple of the eye' (Deuteronomy 32:10).

Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: "She has given eyes to her words." When he proposed to her, he said to her: "Perhaps you are a foreigner?" She said to him: "I am a convert." "Perhaps you are a married woman?" He said to her: "I am single." "Perhaps your father accepted betrothal for you?" He said to her: "I am an orphan." "Perhaps you are impure?" She said to him: "I am pure."
"And he planted a tamarisk tree in Beersheba," Reish Lakish said: This teaches that he made a paradise and planted in it all kinds of delicacies."

Rabbi Yehudah and Rabbi Nechemiah, one said: "pardes," and one said: "pundak." Granted according to the one who said "pardes," that is as it is written, "and he planted." But according to the one who said "pundak," what is "and he planted"? As it is written: "And he planted the tents of Edom..."
"And he called there in the name of the Lord, the God of eternity." Reish Lakish said: Do not read it as "וַיִּקְרָא" (and he called),

Talmudic text: Rather, "And he called." Teaches that our father Abraham called the name of the Holy One, blessed be He, with the mouth of every passerby. How so? After they ate and drank, they stood to bless. He said to them: Did you eat from what is mine? You ate from what belongs to the God of the world! Give thanks, praise, and bless to the One who spoke and the world came into being.
"And Judah saw her and he thought her to be a harlot, for she had covered her face." Because she covered her face, he thought her to be a harlot?!

Rabbi Elazar said: "She covered her face in her father-in-law's house." As Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: "Every bride who is modest in her father-in-law's house merits that kings and prophets descend from her." From where do we derive this? From a palm tree. Prophets - as it is written: "The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz." Kings - from David. And Rabbi Levi said: "This matter is a tradition handed down to us from our ancestors: Amoz and Amatzyah were brothers."
"She finds." "She is found." What does it require? Rabbi Elazar said: After her signs were found, Samael came and distanced them, then Gabriel came and brought them close.

That is as it is written: "For the conductor, upon the silent dove, distant ones, a michtam of David." Rabbi Yochanan said: From the moment its signs distanced themselves, it became like a silent dove. "A michtam of David": that David emerged from it, for he was humble and simple towards all. Another explanation: "michtam" - that his strike was wondrous, as he was born circumcised. Another explanation: "michtam" - just as in his youth he humbled himself before one greater than him to learn Torah, so too in his greatness.

"And she sent to her mother-in-law, saying, 'To the man to whom these belong, I am pregnant.' And say to him from me! Rav Zutra bar Tobiah said in the name of Rav, and some say in the name of Rav Hana bar Bizna said in the name of Rabbi Shimon Chasida, and some say in the name of Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: It is better for a person to cast himself into a fiery furnace than to shame his fellow in public. From where do we derive this? From a palm tree."

"The pit, please." Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: With 'the pit,' he clarified to his father - with 'the pit,' they clarified it. With 'the pit,' he clarified: 'The pit, please, is it your son's tunic.' With 'the pit,' they clarified it: 'The pit, please, to whom.'"
"Na." There is no "na" except as a language of difficulty. She said to him: 'With difficulty from you, recognize the face of your Creator, and do not hide your eyes from me.'

"And Judah recognized and said, 'She is more righteous than I.' That is as Rav Hanin bar Bizna said in the name of Rabbi Shimon Chasida: If Joseph sanctified the name of Heaven in secret - he merited and they added to him one letter from the name of the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is written: 'The testimony in Joseph was established.'"

Judah who sanctified the name of Heaven in public - he merited and was called by the name of the Holy One, blessed be He. Once he acknowledged and said, "Righteousness is from me," a heavenly voice emerged and said: "You have saved Tamar and her two sons from the fire - by your merit, I save three of your sons from the fire." Who are they? Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah.
"Charity from me." From where did he know? A heavenly voice emerged and said: "From me they came out embarrassed."

"And she shall not add anymore to her knowledge." Shmuel Saba said in the name of Rav Shmuel bar Ammi from the name of Rav Shmuel bar Ammi: Once she knew it - she did not cease from it. It is written here: "And she shall not add anymore to her knowledge," and it is written there: "A loud voice and he did not add."

Talmudic text: Avshalom nitga'ah bis'aro v'chu. Tanu Rabanan: Avshalom bis'aro marad, shene'emar: "u'ch'Avshalom lo hayah ish yafeh v'chu. u'v'galcho et rosho v'hayah miketz yamim layamim asher yegale'ach ki kaveid alav v'gilcho v'shakal et se'ar rosho matayim sh'kalim b'even hammelech." Tanah: even she'anshei Teverya v'anshei Tzipori shoklim bah. English translation: Avshalom was proud of his hair, as it is stated: "Now in all Israel there was no one so much to be praised for his beauty as Absalom; from the sole of his foot to the crown of his head there was no blemish in him. And when he cut the hair of his head (for at the end of every year he used to cut it; when it was heavy on him, he cut it), he weighed the hair of his head, two hundred shekels by the king's weight." It was taught: The stone that the men of Tiberias and the men of Sepphoris weigh with.

Therefore, he was hanged by his hair, as it is stated: "And Absalom called before David's servants, and Absalom rode upon the mule, and the mule came under the thick branches of a great terebinth, and his head caught hold of the terebinth, and he was suspended between heaven and earth, and the mule that was under him passed by." Shikl Sapsera sought to depart. It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: At that moment, Sheol split open beneath him.

The king was agitated and went up to the upper chamber of the gate and wept, and thus he said as he went, "O my son Absalom, my son, my son Absalom! Would I had died instead of you, O Absalom, my son, my son!" And the king covered his face and cried out with a loud voice, "O my son Absalom, Absalom, my son, my son!" Those Talmudic scholars say, "Why 'my son' seven times? Because he was sentenced to seven compartments of Gehenna. And others say: He brought his head close to his body, and others say: He brought him to the world to come."

"And Absalom took and set up for himself in his lifetime." What is meant by "took"? Reish Lakish said: that he took an evil acquisition for himself. "The pillar which is in the King's Valley, etc.," Rabbi Chanina bar Papa said: with deep counsel of the King of the world.

sentences.text: הוּחַל שְׁבוּעָתוֹ שֶׁל אֲבִימֶלֶךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״אִם תִּשְׁקֹר לִי וּלְנִינִי וּלְנֶכְדִּי״.
sentences.human_translation: the oath of Abimelech, was negated, as it is written that you will not deal falsely with me, nor with my son, nor with my son’s son;
sentences.llm_translation: The week of Abimelech began, as it is written: "If you deal falsely with me and with my offspring and with my posterity."

sentences.text: ״וַיִּגְדַּל הַנַּעַר וַיְבָרְכֵהוּ ה׳״. בַּמֶּה בֵּרְכוֹ? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, שֶׁבֵּרְכוֹ בְּאַמָּתוֹ: אַמָּתוֹ כִּבְנֵי אָדָם, וְזַרְעוֹ כְּנַחַל שׁוֹטֵף.
sentences.human_translation: and the child grew, and the Lord blessed him” With what did He bless him? Rav Yehuda says Rav says: that He blessed him with regard to his penis, his penis like men, and his seed like an overflowing river.
sentences.llm_translation: "And the youth grew up, and the Lord blessed him." With what did He bless him? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, that He blessed him with his mother's cubit: His mother's cubit like that of other people, and his seed like a flowing stream.

sentences.text: ״וַיִּקְרָא שִׁמְשׁוֹן אֶל ה׳ וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֱלֹהִים זׇכְרֵנִי נָא וְחַזְּקֵנִי נָא אַךְ הַפַּעַם הַזֶּה וְאִנָּקְמָה נְקַם אַחַת מִשְּׁתֵי עֵינַי מִפְּלִשְׁתִּים״. אָמַר רַב: אָמַר שִׁמְשׁוֹן לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, זְכוֹר לִי עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁתַּיִם שָׁנָה שֶׁשָּׁפַטְתִּי אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְלֹא אָמַרְתִּי לְאֶחָד מֵהֶם הַעֲבֵר לִי מַקֵּל מִמָּקוֹם לְמָקוֹם.
sentences.human_translation: “And Samson called unto the Lord, and said: Lord God, remember me, I pray to You, and strengthen me, I pray to You, only this once, that I may be this once avenged of the Philistines for my two eyes” Rav said Samson said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, remember my twenty-two years that I judged the Jewish people and I did not say to any one of them: Move a stick for me from place to place.
sentences.llm_translation: "And Samson called to the Lord and said, 'Lord God, please remember me and strengthen me, please, just this once, O God, that I may be avenged with one vengeance for my two eyes from the Philistines.' Rav said: Samson said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, remember for me the twenty-two years that I judged Israel, and I did not say to any one of them, 'Pass to me a staff from place to place.'"

sentences.text: ״וַיֵּלֶךְ שִׁמְשׁוֹן וַיִּלְכֹּד שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת שׁוּעָלִים״. מַאי שְׁנָא שׁוּעָלִים? אָמַר רַבִּי אַיְּבוּ בַּר נַגְדִּי אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: אָמַר שִׁמְשׁוֹן, יָבֹא מִי שֶׁחוֹזֵר לַאֲחוֹרָיו, וְיִפָּרַע מִפְּלִשְׁתִּים שֶׁחָזְרוּ בִּשְׁבוּעָתָן.
sentences.human_translation: “And Samson went and caught three hundred foxes, What is different foxes Rabbi Aivu bar Nagdi says Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says: Samson said: Let that goes in reverse come and exact punishment from the Philistines, who reneged on their oath
sentences.llm_translation: "And Samson went and caught three hundred foxes." What is different about foxes? Rabbi Ayvu son of Nagdi said, Rabbi Hiyya son of Abba said: Samson said, 'Let the one who turns back behind him come, and take revenge on the Philistines who went back on their oath.'"

sentences.text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הֶחָסִיד: בֵּין כְּתֵיפָיו שֶׁל שִׁמְשׁוֹן שִׁשִּׁים אַמָּה הָיָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּשְׁכַּב שִׁמְשׁוֹן עַד חֲצִי הַלַּיְלָה וַיָּקׇם בַּחֲצִי הַלַּיְלָה וַיֶּאֱחֹז בְּדַלְתוֹת שַׁעַר הָעִיר וּבִשְׁתֵּי הַמְּזוּזוֹת וַיִּסָּעֵם עִם הַבְּרִיחַ וַיָּשֶׂם עַל כְּתֵיפָיו״, וּגְמִירִי דְּאֵין דַּלְתוֹת עַזָּה פְּחוּתוֹת מִשִּׁשִּׁים אַמָּה.
sentences.human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon the Pious said: between the shoulders of Samson was sixty cubits, as it is stated: “And Samson lay till midnight, and arose at midnight, and grabbed hold of the doors of the gate of the city, and the two posts, and plucked them up, bar and all, and put them upon his shoulders, and it is learned that doors of Gaza were no less than sixty cubits
sentences.llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon the Pious said: Between the shoulders of Samson there were sixty cubits, as it is stated: "And Samson lay until midnight, and at midnight he arose, and took hold of the doors of the gate of the city, and the two doorposts, and pulled them up, bar and all, and put them on his shoulders." And it is learned that there are no doors stronger or weaker than sixty cubits.

sentences.text: ״וַיְהִי טוֹחֵן בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִים״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין טְחִינָה אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן עֲבֵירָה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״תִּטְחַן לְאַחֵר אִשְׁתִּי״. מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד הֵבִיא לוֹ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ לְבֵית הָאֲסוּרִים כְּדֵי שֶׁתִּתְעַבֵּר הֵימֶנּוּ. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: קַמֵּי דְּשָׁתֵי חַמְרָא — חַמְרָא, קַמֵּי רָפוֹקָא (גְּרִידְיָא — דּוּבְלָא).
sentences.human_translation: and he did grind in the prison-house” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Grinding is nothing other a language of a transgression and so says: “Then let my wife grind unto another man” teaches that each and every brought his wife to the prison in order that she should be impregnated by Rav Pappa said: This that people say: Before a wine drinker, wine; before one who digs in the ground, figs.
sentences.llm_translation: "And it came to pass, while he was talking with them in prison." Rabbi Yochanan said: "Tachina is nothing but a language of transgression," as it says: "Grind for another my wife." This teaches that each and every one brought his wife to prison so that she would become pregnant by him. Rav Papa said: This is what people say: in front of a wine-drinker, wine; in front of a beer-drinker, beer.

sentences.text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַמְזַנֶּה — אִשְׁתּוֹ (מְזַנֶּנֶת) [מְזַנָּה] עָלָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִם נִפְתָּה לִבִּי עַל אִשָּׁה וְעַל פֶּתַח רֵעִי אָרָבְתִּי״, וּכְתִיב: ״תִּטְחַן לְאַחֵר אִשְׁתִּי וְעָלֶיהָ יִכְרְעוּן אֲחֵרִין״, וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: אִיהוּ בֵּי קָארֵי, וְאִיתְּתֵיהּ בֵּי בוּצִינֵי.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: anyone who commits adultery, his wife commits adultery against him, as it is stated: “If my heart has been enticed unto a woman, and I have lain in wait at my neighbor’s door” and it is written: “Then let my wife grind unto another man and may strangers kneel over her” And this that people say: He is among the pumpkins [ karei ] and his wife among the zucchinis [ butzinei ],
sentences.llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: Anyone who provides sustenance - his wife (provides sustenance) is sustained by him, as it is stated: "If my heart has been enticed by a woman, and I have lain in wait at my neighbor's door." And it is written: "Let my wife grind for another, and let others bow down over her." And this is what people say: He is of the family of Karai, and his wife is of the family of Butzinei.

sentences.text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שִׁמְשׁוֹן דָּן אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל כַּאֲבִיהֶם שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״דָּן יָדִין עַמּוֹ כְּאַחַד וְגוֹ׳״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שִׁמְשׁוֹן עַל שְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא נִקְרָא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי שֶׁמֶשׁ וּמָגֵן ה׳ אֱלֹהִים וְגוֹ׳״. אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, לֹא יִמָּחֶה! אֶלָּא: מֵעֵין שְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: מָה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מֵגֵין עַל כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ — אַף שִׁמְשׁוֹן מֵגֵין בְּדוֹרוֹ עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Samson judged the Jewish people as their Father in Heaven as it is stated: “Dan shall judge his people, as one And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Samson [ Shimshon ] is called by the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, as it is stated: “For the Lord God is a sun [ shemesh ] and a shield” If that is so, should not be erased Rather, is akin to the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, just as the Holy One, Blessed be He, protects the entire world, so too Samson, in his generation, protected all the Jewish people.
sentences.llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: Samson judged Israel like their Father in Heaven, as it is stated: "Dan will judge his people like one." And Rabbi Yochanan said: Samson was called by the name of the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is stated: "For the Lord God is a sun and shield." Rather, from now on, he will not be erased! Rather, from the likeness of the name of the Holy One, blessed be He: Just as the Holy One, blessed be He, shields the entire world, so too Samson shielded in his generation over Israel.

sentences.text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בִּלְעָם חִיגֵּר בְּרַגְלוֹ אַחַת הָיָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וַיֵּלֶךְ שֶׁפִי״. שִׁמְשׁוֹן חִיגֵּר בִּשְׁתֵּי רַגְלָיו הָיָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שְׁפִיפֹן עֲלֵי אֹרַח״.
sentences.human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Balaam was lame in one of his legs, as it is stated “And he went, limping [ shefi ]” Samson was lame in his two legs, as it is stated a horned snake [ shefifon ] in the path”
sentences.llm_translation: And said Rabbi Yochanan: Balaam limped with one foot, as it is said, "And he went limping." Samson limped with both his feet, as it is said, "Crippled upon both his legs."

sentences.text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חֲמִשָּׁה נִבְרְאוּ מֵעֵין דּוּגְמָא שֶׁל מַעְלָה, וְכוּלָּן לָקוּ בָּהֶן. שִׁמְשׁוֹן בְּכֹחוֹ, שָׁאוּל בְּצַוָּארוֹ, אַבְשָׁלוֹם בִּשְׂעָרוֹ, צִדְקִיָּה בְּעֵינָיו, אָסָא בְּרַגְלָיו.
sentences.human_translation: The Sages taught Five were created akin to a representation of the High, and they were all stricken by that Samson in his strength, Saul in his neck Absalom in his hair, Zedekiah in his eyes, Asa in his feet.
sentences.llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Five were created from the supernal pattern, and all of them were punished by them. Samson with his strength, Saul with his neck, Absalom with his hair, Zedekiah with his eyes, Asa with his feet.

sentences.text: שִׁמְשׁוֹן בְּכֹחוֹ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּסַר כֹּחוֹ מֵעָלָיו״.
sentences.human_translation: Samson by his strength, as it is written: and his strength went from him”
sentences.llm_translation: Shimshon in his strength, as it is written: "And he removed his strength from him."

sentences.text: שָׁאוּל בְּצַוָּארוֹ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּקַּח שָׁאוּל אֶת הַחֶרֶב וַיִּפֹּל עָלֶיהָ״.
sentences.human_translation: Saul in his neck, as it is written: Therefore, Saul took his sword and fell upon it”
sentences.llm_translation: Saul in his neck, as it is written: "And Saul took the sword and fell upon it."

sentences.text: אַבְשָׁלוֹם בִּשְׂעָרוֹ, כִּדְבָעֵינַן לְמֵימַר קַמַּן. צִדְקִיָּה בְּעֵינָיו, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֶת עֵינֵי צִדְקִיָּהוּ עִוֵּר״.
sentences.human_translation: Absalom in his hair, as we will state later. Zedekiah in his eyes, as it is written: and put out the eyes of Zedekiah,
sentences.llm_translation: Avshalom in his hair, as we require to say later. Tzidkiyah in his eyes, as it is written: "And the eyes of Tzidkiyahu were blinded."

sentences.text: אָסָא בְּרַגְלָיו, דִּכְתִיב: ״רַק לְעֵת זִקְנָתוֹ חָלָה אֶת רַגְלָיו״, וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: שֶׁאֲחָזַתּוּ פָּדַגְרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר זוּטְרָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן לְרַב נַחְמָן: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי פָּדַגְרָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּמַחַט בִּבְשַׂר הַחַי. מְנָא יָדַע? אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: מֵיחַשׁ הֲוָה חָשׁ בֵּיהּ. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: מֵרַבֵּיהּ שְׁמַע לֵיהּ. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: ״סוֹד ה׳ לִירֵאָיו וּבְרִיתוֹ לְהוֹדִיעָם״.
sentences.human_translation: Asa in his feet, as it is written: But in the time of his old age he was diseased in his feet” And Rav Yehuda says Rav says: that gout [ padagra ] grabbed hold of him. Mar Zutra, son of Rav Naḥman, said to Rav Naḥman: What are the circumstances gout? He said to him: like a needle into living flesh. From where did he know this? Some say suffered from this and some say he heard it from his teacher, and some say “The secret of the Lord is with them that fear Him; and His covenant, to make them know it”
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: Asa b'raglav, dikhtiv: "rak l'et ziknato chalah et raglav," v'amar Rav Yehudah amar Rav: she'achazatu padgara. Amar lei Mar Zutra brei d'Rav Nachman l'Rav Nachman: heichi damei padgara? Amar lei: k'machat bivsar hachai. Menah yada? Ikka d'amri: meichash hava chash beih. V'ikka d'amri: merabbei shema lei. V'ikka d'amri: "sod Hashem l'yireav u'vrito l'hodi'am." English translation: Asa with his feet, as it is written: "only in his old age did he suffer from his feet," and Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: that he had gout. Mar Zutra, son of Rav Nachman, said to Rav Nachman: How is gout similar? He said to him: Like a thread in the flesh of a living animal. How do we know? Some say: He was preoccupied with it. And some say: He learned it from his teacher. And some say: "The secret of the Lord is for those who fear Him, and His covenant to make it known to them."

sentences.text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא: מִפְּנֵי מָה נֶעֱנַשׁ אָסָא — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁעָשָׂה אַנְגַּרְיָא בְּתַלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהַמֶּלֶךְ אָסָא הִשְׁמִיעַ אֶת כׇּל יְהוּדָה אֵין נָקִי״. מַאי ״אֵין נָקִי״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אֲפִילּוּ חָתָן מֵחֶדְרוֹ וְכַלָּה מֵחוּפָּתָהּ.
sentences.human_translation: Rava taught: For what Asa punished Because he made Torah scholars perform forced labor [ angarya ], as it is stated: “Then King Asa made a proclamation unto all Judah; none was exempted; everyone, including What “None was exempted [ ein naki ]”? Rav Yehuda says Rav says: even a bridegroom from his chamber and a bride from her canopy,
sentences.llm_translation: Rava expounded: For what reason was Asa punished? Because he made an enclosure for the disciples of the sages, as it is stated: "And King Asa proclaimed throughout Judah, none is clean." What is meant by "none is clean"? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Even a groom from his bridal chamber and a bride from her wedding canopy.

sentences.text: כְּתִיב: ״וַיֵּרֶד שִׁמְשׁוֹן תִּמְנָתָה״, וּכְתִיב: ״הִנֵּה חָמִיךְ עֹלֶה תִמְנָתָה״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שִׁמְשׁוֹן שֶׁנִּתְגַּנָּה בָּהּ — כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ יְרִידָה. יְהוּדָה שֶׁנִּתְעַלָּה בָּהּ — כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ עֲלִיָּה.
sentences.human_translation: It is written “And Samson went down to Timnah, and it is written Behold, your father-in-law is going up to Timnah Rabbi Elazar says: Samson, who was disgraced there descent is written with regard to his Judah, who was elevated there, ascent is written with regard to his
sentences.llm_translation: It is written: "And Samson went down to Timnah," and it is written: "Behold, your father-in-law is going up to Timnah." Rabbi Elazar said: Samson, who was degraded through her - it is written in him descent. Judah, who was elevated through her - it is written in him ascent.

sentences.text: רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: שְׁתֵּי תִּמְנָאוֹת הָיוּ, חֲדָא בִּירִידָה, וַחֲדָא בַּעֲלִיָּה.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says There were two Timnah, one by descent and one by ascent.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: Two figs there were, one in descent, and one in ascent.

sentences.text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: חֲדָא תִּמְנָה הֲוַאי, דְּאָתֵי מֵהַאי גִּיסָא — יְרִידָה, וּדְאָתֵי מֵהַאי גִּיסָא — עֲלִיָּה. כְּגוֹן וַרְדּוֹנְיָא וּבֵי בָארֵי וְשׁוּקָא דְנַרֶשׁ.
sentences.human_translation: Rav Pappa said There was one Timnah, who came from this side descent, and who came from that side ascent. For example: Vardonia, and Bei Varei, and the market of Neresh.
sentences.llm_translation: Rav Papa said: One furrow is that which comes from this side - it is a descent, and that which comes from that side - it is an ascent. For example, Vardoniya, Bevarei, and the market of Nareshe.

sentences.text: ״וַתֵּשֶׁב בְּפֶתַח עֵינַיִם״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִי: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָלְכָה וְיָשְׁבָה לָהּ בְּפִתְחוֹ שֶׁל אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ, מָקוֹם שֶׁכׇּל עֵינַיִם צוֹפוֹת לִרְאוֹתוֹ. רַבִּי חָנִין אָמַר רַב: מָקוֹם הוּא שֶׁשְּׁמוֹ עֵינַיִם, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״תַּפּוּחַ וְהָעֵינָם״.
sentences.human_translation: and sat in the entrance of Enaim [ befetaḥ einayim ], Rabbi Alexandri says: teaches that she went and she sat at the entrance of Abraham our forefather, a place that all eyes hope to see it, Rabbi Ḥanin Rav says: a place called Enaim, and similarly states “Tappuah and Enam”
sentences.llm_translation: "And she sat at the entrance of the eyes." Rabbi Alexandri said: It teaches that the halacha went and settled for her at the entrance of our father Abraham's tent, the place where all eyes gazed to see him. Rabbi Chanin said in the name of Rav: It is a place called 'Eynayim,' as it is written: 'The apple of the eye' (Deuteronomy 32:10).

sentences.text: רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: שֶׁנָּתְנָה עֵינַיִם לִדְבָרֶיהָ. כְּשֶׁתְּבָעָהּ אָמַר לָהּ: שֶׁמָּא נׇכְרִית אַתְּ? אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: גִּיּוֹרֶת אֲנִי. שֶׁמָּא אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ אַתְּ? אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: פְּנוּיָה אֲנִי. שֶׁמָּא קִיבֵּל בִּךְ אָבִיךָ קִידּוּשִׁין? אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: יְתוֹמָה אֲנִי. שֶׁמָּא טְמֵאָה אַתְּ? אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: טְהוֹרָה אֲנִי.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says: She provided eyes [ einayim ] for her statements, When solicited her he said to her: you perhaps are a gentile? She said to him: I am a convert. Perhaps you are a married woman? She said to him: I am an unmarried woman. Perhaps your father accepted betrothal for you She said to him: I am an orphan. Maybe you are impure? She said to him: I am pure.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: "She has given eyes to her words." When he proposed to her, he said to her: "Perhaps you are a foreigner?" She said to him: "I am a convert." "Perhaps you are a married woman?" He said to her: "I am single." "Perhaps your father accepted betrothal for you?" He said to her: "I am an orphan." "Perhaps you are impure?" She said to him: "I am pure."

sentences.text: ״וַיִּטַּע אֶשֶׁל בִּבְאֵר שָׁבַע״, אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁעָשָׂה פַּרְדֵּס, וְנָטַע בּוֹ כׇּל מִינֵי מְגָדִים.
sentences.human_translation: “And he planted an eshel in Beersheba, Reish Lakish says: teaches that made an orchard and planted in it all kinds of sweet things.
sentences.llm_translation: "And he planted a tamarisk tree in Beersheba," Reish Lakish said: This teaches that he made a paradise and planted in it all kinds of delicacies."

sentences.text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, חַד אָמַר: פַּרְדֵּס, וְחַד אָמַר: פּוּנְדָּק. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר פַּרְדֵּס, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״וַיִּטַּע״. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר פּוּנְדָּק, מַאי ״וַיִּטַּע״? כְּדִכְתִיב: ״וַיִּטַּע אׇהֳלֵי אַפַּדְנוֹ וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Neḥemya One said an orchard [ pardes ], and one said an inn [ pundak ]. Granted, according to the one who said an orchard, this is what is written: “And he planted,” But according to the one who said an inn, what is “and he planted”? As it is written: “And he shall plant [ vayitta ] the tents of his palace
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah and Rabbi Nechemiah, one said: "pardes," and one said: "pundak." Granted according to the one who said "pardes," that is as it is written, "and he planted." But according to the one who said "pundak," what is "and he planted"? As it is written: "And he planted the tents of Edom..."

sentences.text: ״וַיִּקְרָא שָׁם בְּשֵׁם ה׳ אֵל עוֹלָם״. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״וַיִּקְרָא״,
sentences.human_translation: and called there [ vayyikra ] on the name of the Lord, the Everlasting God” Reish Lakish said: Do not read “ vayyikra ,”
sentences.llm_translation: "And he called there in the name of the Lord, the God of eternity." Reish Lakish said: Do not read it as "וַיִּקְרָא" (and he called),

sentences.text: אֶלָּא ״וַיַּקְרִיא״. מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִקְרִיא אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ לִשְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּפֶה כׇּל עוֹבֵר וָשָׁב. כֵּיצַד? לְאַחַר שֶׁאָכְלוּ וְשָׁתוּ, עָמְדוּ לְבָרְכוֹ. אָמַר לָהֶם: וְכִי מִשֶּׁלִּי אֲכַלְתֶּם? מִשֶּׁל אֱלֹהֵי עוֹלָם אֲכַלְתֶּם! הוֹדוּ וְשַׁבְּחוּ וּבָרְכוּ לְמִי שֶׁאָמַר וְהָיָה הָעוֹלָם.
sentences.human_translation: rather vayyakri , and he caused to call. teaches that Abraham our forefather caused the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, to be called in the mouth of all passersby. How so? After ate and drank, they arose to bless him. He said to them: But did you eat from mine? you ate from the God of the world. you thank and praise and bless the One Who spoke and the world was
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, "And he called." Teaches that our father Abraham called the name of the Holy One, blessed be He, with the mouth of every passerby. How so? After they ate and drank, they stood to bless. He said to them: Did you eat from what is mine? You ate from what belongs to the God of the world! Give thanks, praise, and bless to the One who spoke and the world came into being.

sentences.text: ״וַיִּרְאֶהָ יְהוּדָה וַיַּחְשְׁבֶהָ לְזוֹנָה כִּי כִסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ״. מִשּׁוּם דְּכִסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ, חַשְּׁבַהּ לְזוֹנָה?!
sentences.human_translation: “When Judah saw her, he thought her to be a prostitute, for she had covered her face” Because she had covered her face he thought her to be a prostitute?
sentences.llm_translation: "And Judah saw her and he thought her to be a harlot, for she had covered her face." Because she covered her face, he thought her to be a harlot?!

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שֶׁכִּסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: כׇּל כַּלָּה שֶׁהִיא צְנוּעָה בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ — זוֹכָה וְיוֹצְאִין מִמֶּנָּה מְלָכִים וּנְבִיאִים. מְנָלַן — מִתָּמָר. נְבִיאִים — דִּכְתִיב: ״חֲזוֹן יְשַׁעְיָהוּ בֶן אָמוֹץ״. מְלָכִים — מִדָּוִד. וְאָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: דָּבָר זֶה מָסוֹרֶת בְּיָדֵינוּ מֵאֲבוֹתֵינוּ: אָמוֹץ וַאֲמַצְיָה — אַחִים הֲווֹ.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: that covered her face in the home of her father-in-law, As Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: Any daughter-in-law who is modest in the house of her father-in-law merits that kings and prophets emerge from her. From where do we From Tamar. Prophets as it is written: “The vision of Isaiah, the son of Amoz” Kings from David. And Rabbi Levi says: This matter is a tradition we from our ancestors: Amoz, and Amaziah, were brothers.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: "She covered her face in her father-in-law's house." As Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: "Every bride who is modest in her father-in-law's house merits that kings and prophets descend from her." From where do we derive this? From a palm tree. Prophets - as it is written: "The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz." Kings - from David. And Rabbi Levi said: "This matter is a tradition handed down to us from our ancestors: Amoz and Amatzyah were brothers."

sentences.text: ״הִיא מוּצֵאת״. ״הִיא מִיתּוֹצֵאת״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּמְצְאוּ סִימָנֶיהָ בָּא סַמָּאֵל וְרִיחֲקָן, בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וְקֵירְבָן.
sentences.human_translation: “When she was brought forth [ mutzet ], It should have When she was mitutzet . Rabbi Elazar says: After her signs, were brought out, Samael came and distanced them Gabriel came and moved closer
sentences.llm_translation: "She finds." "She is found." What does it require? Rabbi Elazar said: After her signs were found, Samael came and distanced them, then Gabriel came and brought them close.

sentences.text: הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״לִמְנַצֵּחַ עַל יוֹנַת אֵלֶם רְחוֹקִים לְדָוִד מִכְתָּם״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁנִּתְרַחֲקוּ סִימָנֶיהָ נַעֲשֵׂית כְּיוֹנָה אִילֶּמֶת. ״לְדָוִד מִכְתָּם״: שֶׁיָּצָא מִמֶּנָּה דָּוִד, שֶׁהָיָה מָךְ וְתָם לַכֹּל. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״מִכְתָּם״ — שֶׁהָיְתָה מַכָּתוֹ תַּמָּה, שֶׁנּוֹלַד כְּשֶׁהוּא מָהוּל. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״מִכְתָּם״ — כְּשֵׁם שֶׁבְּקַטְנוּתוֹ הִקְטִין עַצְמוֹ אֵצֶל מִי שֶׁגָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה, כָּךְ בִּגְדוּלָּתוֹ.
sentences.human_translation: This is as it is written: “For the leader, upon yonat eilem reḥokim , a psalm [ mikhtam ] of David” Rabbi Yoḥanan says From the moment that her signs were distanced [ reḥokim ], she became like a mute dove [ yona illemet ]. “a psalm [ mikhtam ] of David” from whom David emerged, as he was modest [ makh ] and flawless [ tam ] with everyone. Alternatively, mikhtam that makkato , was complete [ tama ], that was born circumcised. Alternatively, mikhtam just as in his youth made himself small in front of one who was greater than him to learn Torah so too, when he became great
sentences.llm_translation: That is as it is written: "For the conductor, upon the silent dove, distant ones, a michtam of David." Rabbi Yochanan said: From the moment its signs distanced themselves, it became like a silent dove. "A michtam of David": that David emerged from it, for he was humble and simple towards all. Another explanation: "michtam" - that his strike was wondrous, as he was born circumcised. Another explanation: "michtam" - just as in his youth he humbled himself before one greater than him to learn Torah, so too in his greatness.

sentences.text: ״וְהִיא שָׁלְחָה אֶל חָמִיהָ לֵאמֹר לְאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר אֵלֶּה לּוֹ אָנֹכִי הָרָה״. וְתֵימָא לֵיהּ מֵימָר! אָמַר רַב זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא, וְאָמְרִי לָהּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: נוֹחַ לוֹ לָאָדָם שֶׁיַּפִּיל עַצְמוֹ לְתוֹךְ כִּבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ, וְאַל יַלְבִּין פְּנֵי חֲבֵירוֹ בָּרַבִּים. מְנָלַן — מִתָּמָר.
sentences.human_translation: “She sent to her father-in-law, saying: By the man whose these are, am I with child” And let her say to him Rav Zutra bar Tuviyya says Rav says, and some say Rav Ḥana bar Bizna says Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida says, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: It is more amenable for a person to throw himself into a fiery furnace and not humiliate another in public. From where do we From Tamar,
sentences.llm_translation: "And she sent to her mother-in-law, saying, 'To the man to whom these belong, I am pregnant.' And say to him from me! Rav Zutra bar Tobiah said in the name of Rav, and some say in the name of Rav Hana bar Bizna said in the name of Rabbi Shimon Chasida, and some say in the name of Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: It is better for a person to cast himself into a fiery furnace than to shame his fellow in public. From where do we derive this? From a palm tree."

sentences.text: ״הַכֶּר נָא״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישֵּׂר לְאָבִיו — בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישְּׂרוּהוּ. בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישֵּׂר: ״הַכֶּר נָא הַכְּתֹנֶת בִּנְךָ הִיא״. בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישְּׂרוּהוּ: ״הַכֶּר נָא לְמִי״.
sentences.human_translation: Discern, please, Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: With discern informed his father with discern they informed With discern he informed Discern now whether it is your son’s coat With discern they informed him: Discern, please, whose are
sentences.llm_translation: "The pit, please." Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: With 'the pit,' he clarified to his father - with 'the pit,' they clarified it. With 'the pit,' he clarified: 'The pit, please, is it your son's tunic.' With 'the pit,' they clarified it: 'The pit, please, to whom.'"

sentences.text: ״נָא״. אֵין ״נָא״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן בַּקָּשָׁה. אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: בְּבַקָּשָׁה מִמְּךָ, הַכֵּר פְּנֵי בּוֹרַאֲךָ וְאַל תַּעֲלִים עֵינֶיךָ מִמֶּנִּי.
sentences.human_translation: please [ na ].” na nothing other a language of request. She said to him: I request of you: Discern the image of your Creator and do not avert your eyes from me.
sentences.llm_translation: "Na." There is no "na" except as a language of difficulty. She said to him: 'With difficulty from you, recognize the face of your Creator, and do not hide your eyes from me.'

sentences.text: ״וַיַּכֵּר יְהוּדָה וַיֹּאמֶר צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״. הַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַב חָנִין בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא: יוֹסֵף שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בַּסֵּתֶר — זָכָה וְהוֹסִיפוּ לוֹ אוֹת אַחַת מִשְּׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״עֵדוּת בִּיהוֹסֵף שָׂמוֹ״.
sentences.human_translation: “And Judah acknowledged them, and said: She is more righteous than I; This is as Rav Ḥanin bar Bizna says Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida says: Joseph, who sanctified the name of Heaven in private merited that one letter from the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, was added to his as it is written: “He appointed it in Joseph [ bihosef ] for a testimony in his name,
sentences.llm_translation: "And Judah recognized and said, 'She is more righteous than I.' That is as Rav Hanin bar Bizna said in the name of Rabbi Shimon Chasida: If Joseph sanctified the name of Heaven in secret - he merited and they added to him one letter from the name of the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is written: 'The testimony in Joseph was established.'"

sentences.text: יְהוּדָה שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא — זָכָה וְנִקְרָא כּוּלּוֹ עַל שְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהוֹדָה וְאָמַר ״צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״, יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: אַתָּה הִצַּלְתָּ תָּמָר וּשְׁנֵי בָּנֶיהָ מִן הָאוּר — חַיֶּיךָ שֶׁאֲנִי מַצִּיל בִּזְכוּתְךָ שְׁלֹשָׁה מִבָּנֶיךָ מִן הָאוּר. מַאן נִינְהוּ — חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה.
sentences.human_translation: Judah, who sanctified the name of Heaven in public, merited that his entire is called by the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, When he confessed and said: “She is more righteous than I,” a Divine Voice went forth and said: You saved Tamar and her two children from the fire. your life, in your merit, I will save three of your children from the fire. who are they? Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah
sentences.llm_translation: Judah who sanctified the name of Heaven in public - he merited and was called by the name of the Holy One, blessed be He. Once he acknowledged and said, "Righteousness is from me," a heavenly voice emerged and said: "You have saved Tamar and her two sons from the fire - by your merit, I save three of your sons from the fire." Who are they? Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah.

sentences.text: ״צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״. מְנָא יָדַע? יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: מִמֶּנִּי יָצְאוּ כְּבוּשִׁים.
sentences.human_translation: “She is more righteous than I [ mimmenni ].” From where did he know A Divine Voice went forth and said: From Me these hidden emerged,
sentences.llm_translation: "Charity from me." From where did he know? A heavenly voice emerged and said: "From me they came out embarrassed."

sentences.text: ״וְלֹא יָסַף עוֹד לְדַעְתָּה״. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל סָבָא חֲמוּהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי: כֵּיוָן שֶׁיְּדָעָהּ — שׁוּב לֹא פָּסַק מִמֶּנָּה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְלֹא יָסַף עוֹד לְדַעְתָּה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״קוֹל גָּדוֹל וְלֹא יָסָף״.
sentences.human_translation: “And he knew her [ leda’atah ] again no more [ velo yasaf ],” Shmuel the Elder, father-in-law of Rav Shmuel bar Ami, says in the name of Rav Shmuel bar Ami: once he knew her he did not desist from her again, it is written here: “ Velo yasaf od leda’atah ,” and it is written there with a great voice and it went on no more [ velo yasaf ]”
sentences.llm_translation: "And she shall not add anymore to her knowledge." Shmuel Saba said in the name of Rav Shmuel bar Ammi from the name of Rav Shmuel bar Ammi: Once she knew it - she did not cease from it. It is written here: "And she shall not add anymore to her knowledge," and it is written there: "A loud voice and he did not add."

sentences.text: אַבְשָׁלוֹם נִתְגָּאָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַבְשָׁלוֹם בִּשְׂעָרוֹ מָרַד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּכְאַבְשָׁלוֹם לֹא הָיָה אִישׁ יָפֶה וְגוֹ׳. וּבְגַלְּחוֹ אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ וְהָיָה מִקֵּץ יָמִים לַיָּמִים אֲשֶׁר יְגַלֵּחַ כִּי כָבֵד עָלָיו וְגִלְּחוֹ וְשָׁקַל אֶת שְׂעַר רֹאשׁוֹ מָאתַיִם שְׁקָלִים בְּאֶבֶן הַמֶּלֶךְ״. תָּנָא: אֶבֶן שֶׁאַנְשֵׁי טְבֶרְיָא וְאַנְשֵׁי צִיפּוֹרִי שׁוֹקְלִים בָּהּ.
sentences.human_translation: Absalom was proud of his hair, The Sages taught Absalom rebelled due to his hair, as it is stated: there was none as Absalom for his beauty; And when he shaved his head, as it was at every year’s end that he shaved it; because the hair was heavy on him, therefore he shaved it, and he weighed the hair of his head at two hundred shekels, by the king’s stone” taught: A stone with which the people of Tiberias and the people of Tzippori weigh
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: Avshalom nitga'ah bis'aro v'chu. Tanu Rabanan: Avshalom bis'aro marad, shene'emar: "u'ch'Avshalom lo hayah ish yafeh v'chu. u'v'galcho et rosho v'hayah miketz yamim layamim asher yegale'ach ki kaveid alav v'gilcho v'shakal et se'ar rosho matayim sh'kalim b'even hammelech." Tanah: even she'anshei Teverya v'anshei Tzipori shoklim bah. English translation: Avshalom was proud of his hair, as it is stated: "Now in all Israel there was no one so much to be praised for his beauty as Absalom; from the sole of his foot to the crown of his head there was no blemish in him. And when he cut the hair of his head (for at the end of every year he used to cut it; when it was heavy on him, he cut it), he weighed the hair of his head, two hundred shekels by the king's weight." It was taught: The stone that the men of Tiberias and the men of Sepphoris weigh with.

sentences.text: לְפִיכָךְ נִתְלָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקְרָא אַבְשָׁלוֹם לִפְנֵי עַבְדֵי דָוִד וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם רֹכֵב עַל הַפֶּרֶד וַיָּבֹא הַפֶּרֶד תַּחַת שׂוֹבֶךְ הָאֵלָה הַגְּדוֹלָה וַיֶּחֱזַק רֹאשׁוֹ בָאֵלָה וַיֻּתַּן בֵּין הַשָּׁמַיִם וּבֵין הָאָרֶץ וְהַפֶּרֶד אֲשֶׁר תַּחְתָּיו עָבָר״. שְׁקַל סַפְסִירָא בְּעָא לְמִיפְסְקֵיהּ. תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִבְקַע שְׁאוֹל מִתַּחְתָּיו.
sentences.human_translation: therefore, he was hung by his hair, as it is stated “And Absalom chanced to meet the servants of David. And Absalom was riding upon his mule, and the mule went under the thick boughs of a great terebinth, and his head caught hold of the terebinth, and he was taken up between the heaven and the earth; and the mule that was under him went on” took a sword [ safseira ] and wanted to cut his hair The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: At that moment, the netherworld opened beneath him
sentences.llm_translation: Therefore, he was hanged by his hair, as it is stated: "And Absalom called before David's servants, and Absalom rode upon the mule, and the mule came under the thick branches of a great terebinth, and his head caught hold of the terebinth, and he was suspended between heaven and earth, and the mule that was under him passed by." Shikl Sapsera sought to depart. It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: At that moment, Sheol split open beneath him.

sentences.text: ״וַיִּרְגַּז הַמֶּלֶךְ וַיַּעַל עַל עֲלִיַּית הַשַּׁעַר וַיֵּבְךְּ וְכֹה אָמַר בְּלֶכְתּוֹ בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם מִי יִתֵּן מוּתִי אֲנִי תַחְתֶּיךָ אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי. וְהַמֶּלֶךְ לָאַט אֶת פָּנָיו וַיִּזְעַק הַמֶּלֶךְ קוֹל גָּדוֹל בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי״. הָנֵי תְּמָנְיָא ״בְּנִי״ לְמָה? שִׁבְעָה דְּאַסְּקֵיהּ מִשִּׁבְעָה מְדוֹרֵי גֵיהִנָּם, וְאִידַּךְ, אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּקָרֵיב רֵישֵׁיהּ לְגַבֵּי גוּפֵיהּ, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּאַיְיתֵיהּ לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי.
sentences.human_translation: “And the king was much moved, and went up to the chamber over the gate, and wept; and as he went about he said: O my son Absalom, my son, my son Absalom! Would I had died in your place, O Absalom, my son, my son” “And the king covered his face, and the king cried with a loud voice: O my son Absalom, O Absalom, my son, my son” Why these eight “my son” Seven which he raised him up from the seven chambers of Gehenna. And the other, some say that brought head close to body, and some say that brought to the World-to-Come.
sentences.llm_translation: The king was agitated and went up to the upper chamber of the gate and wept, and thus he said as he went, "O my son Absalom, my son, my son Absalom! Would I had died instead of you, O Absalom, my son, my son!" And the king covered his face and cried out with a loud voice, "O my son Absalom, Absalom, my son, my son!" Those Talmudic scholars say, "Why 'my son' seven times? Because he was sentenced to seven compartments of Gehenna. And others say: He brought his head close to his body, and others say: He brought him to the world to come."

sentences.text: ״וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם לָקַח וַיַּצֶּב לוֹ בְחַיָּיו״. מַאי ״לָקַח״? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: שֶׁלָּקַח מִקָּח רַע לְעַצְמוֹ. ״אֶת מַצֶּבֶת אֲשֶׁר בְּעֵמֶק הַמֶּלֶךְ וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא: בְּעֵצָה עֲמוּקָּה שֶׁל מַלְכּוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם,
sentences.human_translation: “Now Absalom in his lifetime had taken and reared up for himself What did take? Reish Lakish says: He engaged in a bad transaction for himself “The pillar, which is in the king’s valley [ be’emek hammelekh ].” Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa says: in the deep [ amukka ] counsel of the King [ melekh ] of the universe,
sentences.llm_translation: "And Absalom took and set up for himself in his lifetime." What is meant by "took"? Reish Lakish said: that he took an evil acquisition for himself. "The pillar which is in the King's Valley, etc.," Rabbi Chanina bar Papa said: with deep counsel of the King of the world.

text: וְשׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם, וּכְנוּסָה. אָמֵן שֶׁלֹּא נִטְמֵאתִי, וְאִם נִטְמֵאתִי — יָבוֹאוּ בִּי.
רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אָמֵן שֶׁלֹּא נִטְמֵאתִי, אָמֵן שֶׁלֹּא אֶטָּמֵא.
הַכֹּל שָׁוִין שֶׁאֵין מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ, לֹא עַל קוֹדֶם שֶׁתִּתְאָרֵס וְלֹא עַל אַחַר שֶׁתִּתְגָּרֵשׁ.
נִסְתְּרָה לְאֶחָד וְנִטְמֵאת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ הֶחְזִירָה — לֹא הָיָה מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ.
זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל שֶׁתִּבָּעֵל וְלֹא הָיְתָה אֲסוּרָה לוֹ — לֹא הָיָה מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ.
גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם שֶׁזִּינְּתָה — אֲסוּרָה לִיבָמָהּ. מִמַּאי — מִדְּקָתָנֵי שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם וּכְנוּסָה.

אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא אֲסִירָה — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי מַתְנֵה בַּהֲדַהּ, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לָא אֲסִירָה — הֵיכִי מַתְנֵה בַּהֲדַהּ? וְהָתְנַן, זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁאִילּוּ תִּיבָּעֵל וְלֹא תְּהֵא אֲסוּרָה לוֹ — לֹא הָיָה מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ!
אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא: לֵית הִילְכְתָא כְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא.
אֶלָּא הָא דְּקָתָנֵי ״שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם וּכְנוּסָה״ — הָא מַנִּי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אֵין קִידּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בְּחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין, וּמְשַׁוֵּי לַהּ כִּי עֶרְוָה.
בָּעֵי רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: מַהוּ שֶׁיַּתְנֶה אָדָם עַל נִישּׂוּאִין הָרִאשׁוֹנִים, עַל נִישּׂוּאֵי אָחִיו, מַהוּ?
תָּא שְׁמַע, זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁתִּיבָּעֵל וְלֹא תְּהֵא אֲסוּרָה לוֹ — לֹא הָיָה מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ. הָא אֲסִירָה — הָכִי נָמֵי דְּמַתְנֶה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.

רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אָמֵן שֶׁלֹּא נִטְמֵאתִי וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא: לֹא כְּשֶׁאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר אָמֵן שֶׁלֹּא אֶטָּמֵא שֶׁאִם תִּטָּמֵא מַיִם בּוֹדְקִין אוֹתָהּ מֵעַכְשָׁיו, אֶלָּא: לִכְשֶׁתִּטָּמֵא — מַיִם מְעַרְעֲרִין אוֹתָהּ וּבוֹדְקִין אוֹתָהּ.
בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: מַהוּ שֶׁיַּתְנֶה אָדָם עַל נִישּׂוּאִין הָאַחֲרוֹנִים? הַשְׁתָּא מִיהָא לָא אֲסִירָה לֵיהּ, אוֹ דִילְמָא זִימְנִין דִּמְגָרֵשׁ לַהּ וַהֲדַר מַהְדַּר לַהּ?

תָּא שְׁמַע: הַכֹּל שָׁוִין שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ לֹא עַל קוֹדֶם שֶׁתִּתְאָרֵס, וְלֹא עַל אַחַר שֶׁתִּתְגָּרֵשׁ. נִסְתְּרָה לְאֶחָד וְנִטְמֵאת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ יַחְזִירֶנָּה — לֹא הָיָה מַתְנֶה. הָא יַחְזִירֶנָּה וְתִיטָּמֵא, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּמַתְנֵי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הַקְּנָאֹת״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה.

רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״זֹאת״, שֶׁאֵין הָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה וְהֵעִיד לְפָנֵינוּ נְחוּנְיָא חוֹפֵר שִׁיחִין שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה, וְקִיבַּלְנוּ עֵדוּתוֹ בִּשְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים, אֲבָל לֹא בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד.
וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין הָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה, בֵּין בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד בֵּין בִּשְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים.
וְתַנָּא קַמָּא נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב ״זֹאת״! וְרַבָּנַן בָּתְרָאֵי נָמֵי, הָא כְתִיב ״תּוֹרַת״!
אָמַר רָבָא: בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד וּבוֹעֵל אֶחָד — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּאֵין הָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה,
human_translation: וְשׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם, וּכְנוּסָה. אָמֵן שֶׁלֹּא נִטְמֵאתִי, וְאִם נִטְמֵאתִי — יָבוֹאוּ בִּי.
רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אָמֵן שֶׁלֹּא נִטְמֵאתִי, אָמֵן שֶׁלֹּא אֶטָּמֵא.
הַכֹּל שָׁוִין שֶׁאֵין מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ, לֹא עַל קוֹדֶם שֶׁתִּתְאָרֵס וְלֹא עַל אַחַר שֶׁתִּתְגָּרֵשׁ.
נִסְתְּרָה לְאֶחָד וְנִטְמֵאת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ הֶחְזִירָה — לֹא הָיָה מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ.

אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא אֲסִירָה — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי מַתְנֵה בַּהֲדַהּ, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לָא אֲסִירָה — הֵיכִי מַתְנֵה בַּהֲדַהּ? וְהָתְנַן, זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁאִילּוּ תִּיבָּעֵל וְלֹא תְּהֵא אֲסוּרָה לוֹ — לֹא הָיָה מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ!
אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא: לֵית הִילְכְתָא כְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא.
אֶלָּא הָא דְּקָתָנֵי ״שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם וּכְנוּסָה״ — הָא מַנִּי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אֵין קִידּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בְּחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין, וּמְשַׁוֵּי לַהּ כִּי עֶרְוָה.
בָּעֵי רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: מַהוּ שֶׁיַּתְנֶה אָדָם עַל נִישּׂוּאִין הָרִאשׁוֹנִים, עַל נִישּׂוּאֵי אָחִיו, מַהוּ?
תָּא שְׁמַע, זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁתִּיבָּעֵל וְלֹא תְּהֵא אֲסוּרָה לוֹ — לֹא הָיָה מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ. הָא אֲסִירָה — הָכִי נָמֵי דְּמַתְנֶה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.

רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אָמֵן שֶׁלֹּא נִטְמֵאתִי וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא: לֹא כְּשֶׁאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר אָמֵן שֶׁלֹּא אֶטָּמֵא שֶׁאִם תִּטָּמֵא מַיִם בּוֹדְקִין אוֹתָהּ מֵעַכְשָׁיו, אֶלָּא: לִכְשֶׁתִּטָּמֵא — מַיִם מְעַרְעֲרִין אוֹתָהּ וּבוֹדְקִין אוֹתָהּ.
בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: מַהוּ שֶׁיַּתְנֶה אָדָם עַל נִישּׂוּאִין הָאַחֲרוֹנִים? הַשְׁתָּא מִיהָא לָא אֲסִירָה לֵיהּ, אוֹ דִילְמָא זִימְנִין דִּמְגָרֵשׁ לַהּ וַהֲדַר מַהְדַּר לַהּ?

תָּא שְׁמַע: הַכֹּל שָׁוִין שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה מַתְנֶה עִמָּהּ לֹא עַל קוֹדֶם שֶׁתִּתְאָרֵס, וְלֹא עַל אַחַר שֶׁתִּתְגָּרֵשׁ. נִסְתְּרָה לְאֶחָד וְנִטְמֵאת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ יַחְזִירֶנָּה — לֹא הָיָה מַתְנֶה. הָא יַחְזִירֶנָּה וְתִיטָּמֵא, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּמַתְנֵי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הַקְּנָאֹת״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה.

רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״זֹאת״, שֶׁאֵין הָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה וְהֵעִיד לְפָנֵינוּ נְחוּנְיָא חוֹפֵר שִׁיחִין שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה, וְקִיבַּלְנוּ עֵדוּתוֹ בִּשְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים, אֲבָל לֹא בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד.
וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין הָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה, בֵּין בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד בֵּין בִּשְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים.
וְתַנָּא קַמָּא נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב ״זֹאת״! וְרַבָּנַן בָּתְרָאֵי נָמֵי, הָא כְתִיב ״תּוֹרַת״!
אָמַר רָבָא: בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד וּבוֹעֵל אֶחָד — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּאֵין הָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹתָה וְשׁוֹנָה,
llm_translation: The guardian of the yavam, and her gathering. Amen that I have not become impure, and if I have become impure - let them enter into me.
Rabbi Meir says: Amen that I have not become impure, amen that I will not become impure.
All are equal that there is no gift with her, not on before that she will be betrothed and not on after that she will be divorced.
It was hidden from one and became impure, and afterwards she returned - there was no gift with her.
This is the principle: anyone who marries and she was not forbidden to him - there was no condition with her.
Gemara: Rav Hamnuna said: A yevamah who committed adultery is forbidden to her yavam. From where do we know this? From the fact that it is written "a yevamah who guards and gathers."

If you say it is permitted, then why does he give her a gift? But if you say it is not permitted, how does he give her a gift? And we learned in the Mishnah: This is the general principle: anything that, if it were to be claimed, and it would not be forbidden to him, he did not make a gift with it!
They said in the West: There is no halacha like Rav Hamnuna.

Talmudic text: Rather, this that it teaches "she guards the yavam and enters" — this is according to the opinion of Rabbi Akiva, for he said: Betrothals do not take effect with those who are obligated in negative commandments, and he compares it to a case of ervah.
The question of Rabbi Yirmeya: What should a person give for the first marriages, for the marriages of his brothers, what?

Listen and hear, this is the principle: anything that becomes betrothed and should not be forbidden to him - he did not make a stipulation with it. If it is forbidden - so it is said that he made a stipulation. Learn from it.

Rabbi Meir says: "Amen that I have not become impure, etc." It was taught: Not as when Rabbi Meir said, "Amen that I do not become impure," for if you become impure, they immerse you immediately in water. Rather, when you become impure, they sprinkle water on you and immerse you.

Ba'ei Rav Ashi: What is the law regarding a man who gives a gift to his subsequent wife? Perhaps he does not relinquish it to her, or maybe there are times when he divorces her and then remarries her?

Talmudic text: Come and hear: Everything is equal, that if he did not make a condition with her, neither before she becomes engaged, nor after she is divorced. If she hid herself with one and became defiled, and afterwards he returns her - he did not make a condition. If he returns her and she becomes defiled, so it is fitting that he should return her. Learn from this.
The sages taught: "This is the law of jealousy," teaches that a woman drinks and changes.

Rabbi Yehuda says: "This," that a woman does not drink and inspect. Rabbi Yehuda said: There was an incident, and Nahum the digger testified before us that a woman drinks and inspects, and we accepted his testimony with two men, but not with one man.
The sages say: A woman does not drink and become forbidden, whether with one man or with two men.
And it was taught in the first Tanna, it is written "this"! And the Rabbis in the latter teaching, it is written "Torat"!
Rava said: In the case of one man and one woman - everyone agrees that the woman does not drink and drink.

sentences.human_translation: nor as a widow waiting for my yavam nor married amen that I did not become defiled, and if I did become defiled, may come upon me.
sentences.llm_translation: The guardian of the yavam, and her gathering. Amen that I have not become impure, and if I have become impure - let them enter into me.

sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: Amen that I have not become impure, amen that I will not become impure.
