מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהֶחְזִירוּהוּ לְמֹשֶׁה עַל כׇּל הַמִּצְרִיּוֹת כּוּלָּן, וְלֹא יָנַק, אָמַר: פֶּה שֶׁעָתִיד לְדַבֵּר עִם הַשְּׁכִינָה יִינַק דָּבָר טָמֵא? וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶת מִי יוֹרֶה דֵעָה וְגוֹ׳״. לְמִי יוֹרֶה דֵּעָה וּלְמִי יָבִין שְׁמוּעָה — ״לִגְמוּלֵי מֵחָלָב וּלְעַתִּיקֵי מִשָּׁדַיִם״.
״וַתֹּאמֶר לָהּ בַּת פַּרְעֹה לֵכִי וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָלְכָה בִּזְרִיזוּת כְּעַלְמָה. רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: ״הָעַלְמָה״ — שֶׁהֶעֱלִימָה אֶת דְּבָרֶיהָ.

״וַתֹּאמֶר לָהּ בַּת פַּרְעֹה הֵילִיכִי אֶת הַיֶּלֶד הַזֶּה״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִתְנַבְּאָה וְאֵינָהּ יוֹדַעַת מָה מִתְנַבְּאָה, ״הֵילִיכִי״ — הָא שֶׁלִּיכִי. ״וַאֲנִי אֶתֵּן אֶת שְׂכָרֵךְ״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לֹא דַּיָּין לַצַּדִּיקִים שֶׁמַּחְזִירִין לָהֶן אֲבֵידָתָן, אֶלָּא שֶׁנּוֹתְנִין לָהֶן שְׂכָרָן.

״וַתִּקַּח מִרְיָם הַנְּבִיאָה אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן וְגוֹ׳״. אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן וְלֹא אֲחוֹת מֹשֶׁה? אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַב: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיְתָה מִתְנַבְּאָה כְּשֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן,

וְאוֹמֶרֶת: עֲתִידָה אִמִּי שֶׁתֵּלֵד בֵּן שֶׁמּוֹשִׁיעַ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁנּוֹלַד מֹשֶׁה נִתְמַלֵּא כָּל הַבַּיִת כּוּלּוֹ אוֹר. עָמַד אָבִיהָ וּנְשָׁקָהּ עַל רֹאשָׁהּ, אָמַר לָהּ: בִּתִּי, נִתְקַיְּימָה נְבוּאָתִיךְ. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁהִטִּילוּהוּ לַיְאוֹר, עָמַד אָבִיהָ וּטְפָחָהּ עַל רֹאשָׁהּ, אָמַר לָהּ: בִּתִּי הֵיכָן נְבוּאָתִיךְ? וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתֵּתַצַּב אֲחוֹתוֹ מֵרָחוֹק לְדֵעָה מַה יֵּעָשֶׂה לוֹ״ — לֵידַע מָה יְהֵא בְּסוֹף נְבוּאָתָהּ.

יוֹסֵף זָכָה וְכוּ׳. מַאי שְׁנָא מֵעִיקָּרָא דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַל יוֹסֵף לִקְבּוֹר אֶת אָבִיו וַיַּעֲלוּ אִתּוֹ כׇּל עַבְדֵי פַּרְעֹה וְגוֹ׳״, וַהֲדַר: ״וְכֹל בֵּית יוֹסֵף וְאֶחָיו וּבֵית אָבִיו״, וּמַאי שְׁנָא לְבַסּוֹף דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּשׇׁב יוֹסֵף מִצְרַיְמָה הוּא וְאֶחָיו״, וַהֲדַר: ״וְכׇל הָעוֹלִים אִתּוֹ לִקְבּוֹר אֶת אָבִיו״?
אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בַּתְּחִילָּה עַד שֶׁלֹּא רָאוּ בִּכְבוֹדָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל — לֹא נָהֲגוּ בָּהֶן כָּבוֹד, וּלְבַסּוֹף שֶׁרָאוּ בִּכְבוֹדָן — נָהֲגוּ בָּהֶן כָּבוֹד.

דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּבֹאוּ עַד גּוֹרֶן הָאָטָד״, וְכִי גוֹרֶן יֵשׁ לוֹ לָאָטָד? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִקִּיפוּהוּ כְּתָרִים לַאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב כְּגוֹרֶן זֶה שֶׁמַּקִּיפִים לוֹ אָטָד, שֶׁבָּאוּ בְּנֵי עֵשָׂו וּבְנֵי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וּבְנֵי קְטוּרָה.

תָּנָא: כּוּלָּם לַמִּלְחָמָה בָּאוּ, כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאוּ כִּתְרוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף תָּלוּי בַּאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב, נָטְלוּ כּוּלָּן כִּתְרֵיהֶן וּתְלָאוּם בַּאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב. תָּנָא: שְׁלֹשִׁים וְשִׁשָּׁה כְּתָרִים נִתְלוּ בַּאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב.
״וַיִּסְפְּדוּ שָׁם מִסְפֵּד גָּדוֹל וְכָבֵד מְאֹד״. תָּנָא: אֲפִילּוּ סוּסִים וַאֲפִילּוּ חֲמוֹרִים.

(מֵאֵילּוּ מֵאֵילּוּ) כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעוּ לִמְעָרַת הַמַּכְפֵּלָה, אֲתָא עֵשָׂו קָא מְעַכֵּב, אָמַר לָהֶן: ״מַמְרֵא קִרְיַת הָאַרְבַּע הִיא חֶבְרוֹן״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: קִרְיַת אַרְבַּע — אַרְבַּע זוּגוֹת הָיוּ: אָדָם וְחַוָּה, אַבְרָהָם וְשָׂרָה, יִצְחָק וְרִבְקָה, יַעֲקֹב וְלֵאָה. אִיהוּ קַבְרַהּ לְלֵאָה בְּדִידֵיהּ, וְהַאי דְּפָיֵישׁ — דִּידִי הוּא.

אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: זַבֵּינְתֵּהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: נְהִי דְּזַבֵּינִי בְּכֵירוּתָא, פְּשִׁיטוּתָא מִי זַבֵּינִי? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּקִבְרִי אֲשֶׁר כָּרִיתִי לִי״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוֹצָדָק: אֵין ״כִּירָה״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן מְכִירָה, שֶׁכֵּן בִּכְרַכֵּי הַיָּם קוֹרִין לִמְכִירָה ״כִּירָה״.

אֲמַר לְהוּ: הַבוּ לִי אִיגַּרְתָּא! אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִיגַּרְתָּא בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם הִיא. וּמַאן נֵיזִיל — נֵיזִיל נַפְתָּלִי דְּקַלִּיל כִּי אַיָּילְתָּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״נַפְתָּלִי אַיָּלָה שְׁלוּחָה הַנּוֹתֵן אִמְרֵי שָׁפֶר״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אַל תִּקְרֵי ״אִמְרֵי שָׁפֶר״, אֶלָּא ״אִמְרֵי סֵפֶר״.

חוּשִׁים בְּרֵיהּ דְּדָן תַּמָּן הֲוָה, וְיַקִּירָן לֵיהּ אוּדְנֵיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַאי הַאי? וְאָמְרוּ לֵיהּ: קָא מְעַכֵּב הַאי עַד דְּאָתֵי נַפְתָּלִי מֵאַרְעָא דְּמִצְרַיִם. אֲמַר לְהוּ: וְעַד דְּאָתֵי נַפְתָּלִי מֵאַרְעָא דְּמִצְרַיִם, יְהֵא אֲבִי אַבָּא מוּטָל בְּבִזָּיוֹן? שְׁקַל קוּלְפָא מַחְיֵיהּ אַרֵישֵׁיהּ, נָתְרָן עֵינֵיהּ וּנְפַלוּ אַכַּרְעָא דְיַעֲקֹב, פַּתְחִינְהוּ יַעֲקֹב לְעֵינֵיהּ וְאַחֵיךְ. וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״יִשְׂמַח צַדִּיק כִּי חָזָה נָקָם פְּעָמָיו יִרְחַץ בְּדַם הָרָשָׁע״.

בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִתְקַיְּימָה נְבוּאָתָהּ שֶׁל רִבְקָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״לָמָּה אֶשְׁכַּל גַּם שְׁנֵיכֶם יוֹם אֶחָד״. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּמִיתָתָן לֹא בְּיוֹם אֶחָד הֲוַאי — קְבוּרָתָן מִיהָא בְּיוֹם אֶחָד הֲוַאי.

וְאִי לָא [אִי]עֲסַק בֵּיהּ יוֹסֵף, אֶחָיו לָא הֲווֹ מִעַסְּקִי בֵּיהּ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׂאוּ אוֹתוֹ בָנָיו אַרְצָה כְּנַעַן״? אָמְרוּ: הַנִּיחוּ לוֹ, כְּבוֹדוֹ בִּמְלָכִים יוֹתֵר מִבְּהֶדְיוֹטוֹת.

מִי לָנוּ גָּדוֹל מִיּוֹסֵף כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בֹּא וּרְאֵה כַּמָּה חֲבִיבוֹת מִצְוֹת עַל מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, שֶׁכׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל כּוּלָּן נִתְעַסְּקוּ בַּבִּיזָּה, וְהוּא נִתְעַסֵּק בְּמִצְוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חֲכַם לֵב יִקַּח מִצְוֹת וְגוֹ׳״.

וּמִנַּיִן הָיָה יוֹדֵעַ מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ הֵיכָן יוֹסֵף קָבוּר? אָמְרוּ: סֶרַח בַּת אָשֵׁר נִשְׁתַּיְּירָה מֵאוֹתוֹ הַדּוֹר. הָלַךְ מֹשֶׁה אֶצְלָהּ, אָמַר לָהּ: כְּלוּם אַתְּ יוֹדַעַת הֵיכָן יוֹסֵף קָבוּר? אָמְרָה לוֹ: אָרוֹן שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת עָשׂוּ לוֹ מִצְרִים וּקְבָעוּהוּ בְּנִילוּס הַנָּהָר, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּתְבָּרְכוּ מֵימָיו. הָלַךְ מֹשֶׁה וְעָמַד עַל שְׂפַת נִילוּס, אָמַר לוֹ: יוֹסֵף יוֹסֵף! הִגִּיעַ הָעֵת שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּע הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁאֲנִי גּוֹאֵל אֶתְכֶם, וְהִגִּיעָה הַשְּׁבוּעָה שֶׁהִשְׁבַּעְתָּ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. אִם אַתָּה מַרְאֶה עַצְמְךָ מוּטָב, אִם לָאו — הֲרֵי אָנוּ מְנוּקִּין מִשְּׁבוּעָתֶךָ. מִיָּד צָף אֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף.

וְאַל תִּתְמַהּ הֵיאַךְ בַּרְזֶל צָף, שֶׁהֲרֵי כְּתִיב: ״וַיְהִי הָאֶחָד מַפִּיל הַקּוֹרָה וְאֶת הַבַּרְזֶל נָפַל אֶל הַמָּיִם וְגוֹ׳ אֲהָהּ אֲדוֹנִי וְהוּא שָׁאוּל. וַיֹּאמֶר אִישׁ הָאֱלֹהִים אָנָה נָפָל וַיַּרְאֵהוּ אֶת הַמָּקוֹם וַיִּקְצׇב עֵץ וַיַּשְׁלֶךְ שָׁמָּה וַיָּצֶף הַבַּרְזֶל״. וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה אֱלִישָׁע תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל אֵלִיָּהוּ, וְאֵלִיָּהוּ תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה — צָף בַּרְזֶל מִפָּנָיו, מִפְּנֵי מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.

רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: בְּקַבַּרְנִיט שֶׁל מְלָכִים הָיָה קָבוּר. הָלַךְ מֹשֶׁה וְעָמַד עַל קַבַּרְנִיט שֶׁל מְלָכִים, אָמַר: יוֹסֵף, הִגִּיעַ עֵת שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּע הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁאֲנִי גּוֹאֵל אֶתְכֶם, וְהִגִּיעָה שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁהִשְׁבַּעְתָּ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. אִם אַתָּה מַרְאֶה עַצְמְךָ — מוּטָב, וְאִם לָאו — הֲרֵי אָנוּ מְנוּקִּין מִשְּׁבוּעָתֶךָ. בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִזְדַּעְזַע אֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף, נְטָלוֹ מֹשֶׁה, וֶהֱבִיאוֹ אֶצְלוֹ.

וְכׇל אוֹתָן שָׁנִים שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר, הָיוּ שְׁנֵי אֲרוֹנוֹת הַלָּלוּ, אֶחָד שֶׁל מֵת וְאֶחָד שֶׁל שְׁכִינָה, מְהַלְּכִין זֶה עִם זֶה, וְהָיוּ עוֹבְרִין וְשָׁבִין אוֹמְרִים: מָה טִיבָן שֶׁל שְׁנֵי אֲרוֹנוֹת הַלָּלוּ? אָמְרוּ: אֶחָד שֶׁל מֵת וְאֶחָד שֶׁל שְׁכִינָה. וְכִי מָה דַּרְכּוֹ שֶׁל מֵת לְהַלֵּךְ עִם שְׁכִינָה? אָמְרוּ:
llm_translation: Agam, as it is written: "Reed and rushes shall wither."

"And she went down the daughter of Pharaoh to bathe in the river," Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: This teaches that she went down to bathe from the idols of her father's house, as it is also stated: "If the Lord washes away the filth of the daughters of Zion, etc."
"And her maidens walking, etc.," Rabbi Yochanan said: This walking is nothing but a language of death, as it says: "Behold, I am going to die."

"And she saw the basket in the midst of the reeds," as soon as they saw that he was coming to take Moses, they said to her: Our lady, the custom of the world, the king of flesh and blood decrees a decree, if the entire world does not fulfill it - his sons and the members of his household fulfill it, and you are transgressing the decree of your father? Gabriel came and struck them to the ground.

"And she sent her maidservant, and she took her." Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Nechemiah, one said: her hand, and one said: her maidservant. The one who said her hand - as it is written "her maidservant." And the one who said her maidservant - because it is not written "her hand."
And according to the one who says, "her maidservant," behold, you said, "Gabriel came and struck the ground!" For he left her one, that she not be the way of the king to establish her testimony.

Talmudic text: And according to the one who said "her hand," why write "her hand"! This teaches us that it is multiplied, it is multiplied. As the Master said: "And so you find in the cubit of the daughter of Pharaoh, and so you find in the teeth of the wicked," as it is written: "You broke the teeth of the wicked," and Reish Lakish said: Do not read "You broke," but "You shattered."
"And she opened and saw him, the child." "And she saw" - what does it come to teach us? Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: She saw the Divine Presence with him.

"And behold, a youth weeping." It is called "child" and it is called "youth." It was taught: He is a child and his voice is like that of a youth, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Nechemiah said to him: If so, you have made Moses our teacher blemished. Rather, it teaches that his mother made for him a chest of drawers in the ark, she said: Perhaps I will not merit to make his chest of drawers.
"And she had compassion on him and said, 'This is one of the Hebrews' children." How did she know? Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: Because she saw that he was circumcised."
"This." Rabbi Yochanan said: teaches that if a prophecy came without her knowledge - this one falls, and another does not fall.

And this is what Rabbi Elazar said, what is the meaning of what is written: "And if they say to you, inquire of the mediums and the wizards who chirp and mutter": They look and do not know what they are looking at, they mutter and do not know what they are muttering.

They saw that the savior of Israel was in the water, he struck him. They stood and decreed: "Every son that is born, you shall cast into the river." Once they let him go, they said: "Did we not see that he is the same one? Let us annul their decree." And they do not know that he is punished for the waters of Meribah.

Talmudic text: And this is what Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: What is the meaning of what is written, "They are the waters of Meribah, where the children of Israel strove" (Numbers 20:13)? — They are the ones who saw the tricks of Pharaoh and erred. And this is what Moses said: "Six hundred thousand footmen, etc." (Exodus 12:37), Moses said to the children of Israel: For my sake, you were all saved.

Rabbi Chanina bar Papa said: That day was the twenty-first of Nisan. The ministering angels said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, one who is destined to sing a song at the sea on this day - shall be drowned on this day?

Rabbi Ahah bar Hanina said: That day was the sixth of Sivan. The ministering angels said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, one who is destined to receive the Torah from Mount Sinai on this day - shall he be punished on this day?

In truth, according to the one who says on the sixth of Sivan, you find three months. For the Master said: On the seventh of Adar, Moses died, and on the seventh of Adar, Moses was born, and from the seventh of Adar until the sixth of Sivan is three months. But according to the one who says on the twenty-first of Nisan, how do you find it?
That year was a leap year: the majority of the first, the majority of the last, and the middle complete.
"And his sister said to Pharaoh's daughter, 'Shall I go and call for you a nursemaid from the Hebrew women?'" What is different about Hebrew women?

It teaches that they returned him to Moses on all the Egyptian women, all of them, and he did not nurse, he said: "Shall a mouth that is destined to speak with the Divine Presence nurse impure speech?" And this is what is written: "Who will instruct knowledge, etc." To whom will he instruct knowledge, and to whom will he make known the report - "To those weaned from milk and removed from the breast."

"And she said to her, 'Pharaoh's daughter, go and...'." Rabbi Elazar said: This teaches that the halakha is in haste like a young woman. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: 'The young woman' - who concealed her words.

"And she said to her, 'Take this child.' Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: She would prophesy and not know what she was prophesying. 'Heilichi' - that is, 'take him.' 'And I will give you your wages.' Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: It is not enough for the righteous that their lost property is returned to them, but they are also given their wages."

"And Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took, etc." (Exodus 15:20). The sister of Aaron and not the sister of Moses? Rav Amram said in the name of Rav, and some say it was said to him, Rav Nachman said in the name of Rav: This teaches that she prophesied when she was the sister of Aaron.

And she says: My mother is destined to give birth to a son who will save Israel. And once Moses was born, the entire house was filled with light. Her father stood up and kissed her on her head, and said to her: My daughter, your prophecy has been fulfilled. And once they cast him into the river, her father stood up and slapped her on her head, and said to her: My daughter, where is your prophecy now? And this is what is written: "And his sister stood at a distance to know what would be done to him" - to know what would be the end of her prophecy.

Joseph merited, etc. What is different from the beginning where it is written: "And Joseph went up to bury his father, and all of Pharaoh's servants went up with him, etc." And later: "And all the household of Joseph and his brothers and his father's household." And what is different at the end where it is written: "And Joseph went up from Egypt, he and his brothers," and later: "And all those who went up with him to bury his father?"

Rabbi Yochanan said: In the beginning, before they saw the honor of the children of Israel, they did not treat them with honor, but in the end, after they saw their honor, they treated them with honor.

It is written: "And they came to the threshing floor of Atad." Does Atad have a threshing floor? Rabbi Abbahu said: It teaches that they encompassed it with crowns like the crown of the Ark of Jacob, as this threshing floor that they encompassed with a thornbush, for the sons of Esau, the sons of Ishmael, and the sons of Keturah came.

Mishnah: They all came to the war, once they saw the crown of Joseph hanging on the ark of Jacob, they all took off their crowns and hung them on the ark of Jacob. Mishnah: Thirty-six crowns were hung on the ark of Jacob.
"And they mourned there with very great and heavy mourning." It was taught: Even horses and even donkeys.

(From which, from which) Once they arrived at the Cave of Machpelah, Esau came and delayed them. He said to them: "The bitterness of the city of the four is Hebron." And Rabbi Yitzchak said: The city of the four - there were four pairs: Adam and Eve, Abraham and Sarah, Isaac and Rebekah, Jacob and Leah. He buried Leah by herself, and this one, Ephron - it is mine.

They said to him: "Your wife has menstruated." He said to them: "If she has menstruated, who has caused her to menstruate?" They said to him: "No, as it is written: 'In my grave which I have dug for myself,' and Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: 'Kira' is only a term of recognition, as in the coral reefs of the sea they call recognition 'kira'."

He said to them: "Bring me the letter!" They said to him: "The letter is in the land of Egypt." And who goes there? - Let Naftali, who is swift as a hind, go, as it is written: "Naftali is a hind let loose, who gives beautiful words." Rabbi Abbahu said: Do not read "beautiful words," but rather "beautiful books."

Chushim, son of Dan, was there, and they were dear to him. He said to them: What is this? And they said to him: This is delaying until Naphtali comes from the land of Egypt. He said to them: And until Naphtali comes from the land of Egypt, should my grandfather be subjected to disgrace? He took a club, struck him on his head, his eyes popped out, and the sockets of Jacob's thigh fell. Jacob opened his eyes and saw his brother. This is what is written: "The righteous will rejoice when he sees vengeance; he will bathe his feet in the blood of the wicked."

At that moment, the prophecy of Rivkah was fulfilled, as it is written: "Why should I be bereaved of you both in one day." And even though their death did not occur on the same day, their burial did indeed take place on one day.

And if if he did not engage with him, were his brothers not engaging with him? And it is written: "And his sons carried him to the land of Canaan"? They said: Leave him, his honor is greater among kings than among commoners.

Talmudic text: Who is greater than our master Joseph? The Rabbis taught: Come and see how beloved are the commandments to Moses our teacher, for all of Israel were engaged in shearing, and he was engaged in commandments, as it is stated: "A wise heart will take commandments, etc."

Talmudic text: And from where did Moses, our teacher, know where Joseph was buried? They said: Serach the daughter of Asher remained from that generation. Moses went to her, he said to her: Do you know where Joseph is buried? She said to him: A metal coffin the Egyptians made for him and they fixed it in the Nile River, so that his blessings may emanate from his waters. Moses went and stood on the bank of the Nile, he said: Joseph, Joseph! The time has come that the Holy One, blessed be He, swore that I will redeem you, and the week has arrived that you swore to the children of Israel. If you show yourself favorable, good; if not, behold, we are absolved from your oath. Immediately his coffin floated up.

Talmudic text: And do not wonder how iron can float, for it is written: "And the iron head fell into the water, and alas, my master, and it was Saul. And the man of God said, 'Where did it fall?' And he showed him the place, and he cut a stick and threw it there, and the iron floated." And are these not logical arguments: If Elisha, the disciple of Elijah, and Elijah, the disciple of Moses, made iron float before him, how much more so before our teacher Moses - all the more so.

Rabbi Nathan says: In the burial cave of kings he was buried. Moses went and stood at the burial cave of kings, he said: Joseph, the time has come that the Holy One, blessed be He, swore that I will redeem you, and the week has arrived that you swore to Israel. If you show yourself - good, and if not - behold, we are exempt from your oath. At that moment, the coffin of Joseph shook, Moses took it and brought it with him.

And all those years that Israel was in the wilderness, these two arks were there, one of the deceased and one of the Divine Presence, walking together, and they would pass and return, saying: What is the nature of these two arks? They said: One of the deceased and one of the Divine Presence. And is it the way of the deceased to walk with the Divine Presence? They said:

sentences.text: אֲגַם, כְּדִכְתִיב: ״קָנֶה וָסוּף קָמֵלוּ״.
sentences.human_translation: a marsh, as it is written: “The reeds and willows [ suf ] shall wither”
sentences.llm_translation: Agam, as it is written: "Reed and rushes shall wither."

sentences.text: ״וַתֵּרֶד בַּת פַּרְעֹה לִרְחוֹץ עַל הַיְאֹר״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁיָּרְדָה לִרְחוֹץ מִגִּלּוּלֵי [בֵּית] אָבִיהָ, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אִם רָחַץ ה׳ אֵת צוֹאַת בְּנוֹת צִיּוֹן וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: “And the daughter of Pharaoh came down to bathe [ lirḥotz ] in the river” Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: teaches that she came down to cleanse from her father’s idols, And similarly it states: “When the Lord shall have washed [ raḥatz ] away the filth of the daughters of Zion,
sentences.llm_translation: "And she went down the daughter of Pharaoh to bathe in the river," Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: This teaches that she went down to bathe from the idols of her father's house, as it is also stated: "If the Lord washes away the filth of the daughters of Zion, etc."

sentences.text: ״וְנַעֲרֹתֶיהָ הוֹלְכוֹת וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין הֲלִיכָה זוֹ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן מִיתָה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״הִנֵּה אָנֹכִי הוֹלֵךְ לָמוּת״.
sentences.human_translation: “And her maidens walked [ holekhot ] Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This walking nothing other terminology of death, and similarly it states: “Behold, I am going [ holekh ] to die”
sentences.llm_translation: "And her maidens walking, etc.," Rabbi Yochanan said: This walking is nothing but a language of death, as it says: "Behold, I am going to die."

sentences.text: ״וַתֵּרֶא אֶת הַתֵּיבָה בְּתוֹךְ הַסּוּף״, כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזוֹ דְּקָא בָעוּ לְאַצּוֹלֵי לְמֹשֶׁה, אָמְרוּ לָהּ: גְּבִירְתֵּנוּ, מִנְהָגוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם מֶלֶךְ בָּשָׂר וָדָם גּוֹזֵר גְּזֵירָה, אִם כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ אֵין מְקַיְּימִין אוֹתָהּ — בָּנָיו וּבְנֵי בֵיתוֹ מְקַיְּימִין אוֹתָהּ, וְאַתְּ עוֹבֶרֶת עַל גְּזֵירַת אָבִיךְ? בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וַחֲבָטָן בַּקַּרְקַע.
sentences.human_translation: “And she saw the ark among the willows” Once saw that was intending to save Moses, they said to her: Our mistress, the custom of the world a king of flesh and blood decrees a decree, if all the world does not fulfill it, his children and members of his household fulfill it, and you are violating the decree of your father. Gabriel came and beat them to the ground
sentences.llm_translation: "And she saw the basket in the midst of the reeds," as soon as they saw that he was coming to take Moses, they said to her: Our lady, the custom of the world, the king of flesh and blood decrees a decree, if the entire world does not fulfill it - his sons and the members of his household fulfill it, and you are transgressing the decree of your father? Gabriel came and struck them to the ground.

sentences.text: ״וַתִּשְׁלַח אֶת אֲמָתָהּ וַתִּקָּחֶהָ״. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, חַד אָמַר: יָדָהּ, וְחַד אָמַר: שִׁפְחָתָהּ. מַאן דְּאָמַר יָדָהּ — דִּכְתִיב ״אַמָּתָהּ״. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר שִׁפְחָתָהּ — מִדְּלָא כְּתִיב ״יָדָהּ״.
sentences.human_translation: “And she sent amatah to take it” Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Neḥemya One says her arm, and one says her maidservant. The one who says her arm as it is written “ amatah ,” And the one who says her maidservant because it does not write Her hand [ yadah ].
sentences.llm_translation: "And she sent her maidservant, and she took her." Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Nechemiah, one said: her hand, and one said: her maidservant. The one who said her hand - as it is written "her maidservant." And the one who said her maidservant - because it is not written "her hand."

sentences.text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר שִׁפְחָתָהּ, הָא אָמְרַתְּ בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וַחֲבָטָן בַּקַּרְקַע! דְּשַׁיַּיר לַהּ חֲדָא, דְּלָאו אוֹרְחַהּ דְּבַת מַלְכָּא לְמֵיקַם לְחוֹדַהּ.
sentences.human_translation: And according to the one who says her maidservant, didn’t you say Gabriel came and beat them to the ground that left her one as it is not proper that a princess should stand alone.
sentences.llm_translation: And according to the one who says, "her maidservant," behold, you said, "Gabriel came and struck the ground!" For he left her one, that she not be the way of the king to establish her testimony.

sentences.text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר יָדָהּ, לִיכְתּוֹב ״יָדָהּ״! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאִישְׁתַּרְבַּב אִישְׁתַּרְבּוֹבֵי. דְּאָמַר מָר: וְכֵן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא בְּאַמָּתָהּ שֶׁל בַּת פַּרְעֹה, וְכֵן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא בְּשִׁינֵּי רְשָׁעִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״שִׁנֵּי רְשָׁעִים שִׁבַּרְתָּ״, וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״שִׁבַּרְתָּ״, אֶלָּא ״שֶׁרִיבַּבְתָּה״.
sentences.human_translation: And according to the one who says her hand, let write Her hand [ yadah ]. This teaches us that her arm extended [ ishtarbav ] As the Master said And similarly you find with regard to the hand of Pharaoh’s daughter and similarly you find with regard to the teeth of evildoers, as it is written: “You have broken [ shibbarta ] the teeth of the wicked” and Reish Lakish said: Do not read shibbarta , rather sheribbavta ,
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: And according to the one who said "her hand," why write "her hand"! This teaches us that it is multiplied, it is multiplied. As the Master said: "And so you find in the cubit of the daughter of Pharaoh, and so you find in the teeth of the wicked," as it is written: "You broke the teeth of the wicked," and Reish Lakish said: Do not read "You broke," but "You shattered."

sentences.text: ״וַתִּפְתַּח וַתִּרְאֵהוּ אֶת הַיֶּלֶד״. ״וַתֵּרֶא״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: שֶׁרָאֲתָה שְׁכִינָה עִמּוֹ.
sentences.human_translation: “And she opened it and saw it [ vatirehu ], even the child” it should have And she saw. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: she saw the Divine Presence with him.
sentences.llm_translation: "And she opened and saw him, the child." "And she saw" - what does it come to teach us? Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: She saw the Divine Presence with him.

sentences.text: ״וְהִנֵּה נַעַר בֹּכֶה״. קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״יֶלֶד״, וְקָרֵי לֵיהּ ״נַעַר״. תָּנָא: הוּא יֶלֶד וְקוֹלוֹ כְּנַעַר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה: אִם כֵּן, עֲשִׂיתוֹ לְמֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ בַּעַל מוּם. אֶלָּא, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁעָשְׂתָה לוֹ אִמּוֹ חוּפַּת נְעוּרִים בַּתֵּיבָה, אָמְרָה: שֶׁמָּא לֹא אֶזְכֶּה לְחוּפָּתוֹ.
sentences.human_translation: and behold a lad [ na’ar ] that wept” calls him “a child [ yeled ],” and calls him “a lad [ na’ar ].” teaches: He is a child but his voice as a lad; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Neḥemya said to him: If so, you made Moses our teacher blemished, Rather, teaches that his mother made a canopy of youth, for him in the ark, she said: Perhaps I will not merit to his canopy.
sentences.llm_translation: "And behold, a youth weeping." It is called "child" and it is called "youth." It was taught: He is a child and his voice is like that of a youth, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Nechemiah said to him: If so, you have made Moses our teacher blemished. Rather, it teaches that his mother made for him a chest of drawers in the ark, she said: Perhaps I will not merit to make his chest of drawers.

sentences.text: ״וַתַּחְמֹל עָלָיו וַתֹּאמֶר מִיַּלְדֵי הָעִבְרִים זֶה״. מְנָא יָדְעָה? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: שֶׁרָאֲתָה אוֹתוֹ מָהוּל.
sentences.human_translation: “And she had compassion on him, and said: This [ zeh ] is one of the Hebrews’ children” From where did she know Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: As she saw he was circumcised.
sentences.llm_translation: "And she had compassion on him and said, 'This is one of the Hebrews' children." How did she know? Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: Because she saw that he was circumcised."

sentences.text: ״זֶה״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁנִּתְנַבְּאָה שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתָּהּ — זֶה נוֹפֵל, וְאֵין אַחֵר נוֹפֵל.
sentences.human_translation: “This [ zeh ] Rabbi Yoḥanan says: teaches that she prophesied unknowingly, This falls, but no other fall
sentences.llm_translation: "This." Rabbi Yochanan said: teaches that if a prophecy came without her knowledge - this one falls, and another does not fall.

sentences.text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכִי יֹאמְרוּ אֲלֵיכֶם דִּרְשׁוּ אֶל הָאֹבוֹת וְאֶל הַיִּדְּעֹנִים הַמְצַפְצְפִים וְהַמַּהְגִּים״: צוֹפִין וְאֵינָם יוֹדְעִין מָה צוֹפִין, מְהַגִּים וְאֵינָן יוֹדְעִים מָה מְהַגִּים.
sentences.human_translation: And this is what Rabbi Elazar said: What is which is written: “And when they shall say to you: Seek unto the necromancers and the diviners, that chirp [ metzaftzefim ] and that mutter [ mahggim ]” They see [ tzofin ], but they do not know what they are seeing; they enunciate [ mahggim ], but they do not know what they are enunciating.
sentences.llm_translation: And this is what Rabbi Elazar said, what is the meaning of what is written: "And if they say to you, inquire of the mediums and the wizards who chirp and mutter": They look and do not know what they are looking at, they mutter and do not know what they are muttering.

sentences.text: רָאוּ שֶׁמּוֹשִׁיעָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמַּיִם הוּא לוֹקֶה, עָמְדוּ וְגָזְרוּ: ״כׇּל הַבֵּן הַיִּלּוֹד הַיְאֹרָה תַּשְׁלִיכֻהוּ״. כֵּיוָן דְּשַׁדְיוּהּ לְמֹשֶׁה, אָמְרוּ: תּוּ לָא חָזֵינַן כִּי הָהוּא סִימָנָא, בַּטִּלוּ לִגְזֵירְתַּיְיהוּ. וְהֵם אֵינָן יוֹדְעִין שֶׁעַל מֵי מְרִיבָה הוּא לוֹקֶה.
sentences.human_translation: saw that the savior of the Jewish people would be stricken by water. they arose and decreed: “Every son that is born you shall cast into the river” Once cast Moses said: We no longer see like that sign they canceled their decree. But they did not know that would be stricken on account of the waters of Meribah.
sentences.llm_translation: They saw that the savior of Israel was in the water, he struck him. They stood and decreed: "Every son that is born, you shall cast into the river." Once they let him go, they said: "Did we not see that he is the same one? Let us annul their decree." And they do not know that he is punished for the waters of Meribah.

sentences.text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״הֵמָּה מֵי מְרִיבָה אֲשֶׁר רָבוּ״ — הֵמָּה שֶׁרָאוּ אִיצְטַגְנִינֵי פַּרְעֹה וְטָעוּ. וְהַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר מֹשֶׁה: ״שֵׁשׁ מֵאוֹת אֶלֶף רַגְלִי וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר לָהֶן מֹשֶׁה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: בִּשְׁבִילִי נִצַּלְתֶּם כּוּלְּכֶם.
sentences.human_translation: And this is what Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: What is which is written: “These [ hemma ] are the waters of Meribah, where strove these are that the astrologers of Pharaoh saw and erred. And this is what Moses said: are six hundred thousand men on foot [ ragli ]; Moses said to the Jewish people: On account of me, all of you were saved,
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: And this is what Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: What is the meaning of what is written, "They are the waters of Meribah, where the children of Israel strove" (Numbers 20:13)? — They are the ones who saw the tricks of Pharaoh and erred. And this is what Moses said: "Six hundred thousand footmen, etc." (Exodus 12:37), Moses said to the children of Israel: For my sake, you were all saved.

sentences.text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא אָמַר: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם עֶשְׂרִים וְאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן הָיָה, אָמְרוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, מִי שֶׁעָתִיד לוֹמַר שִׁירָה עַל הַיָּם בְּיוֹם זֶה — יִלְקֶה בְּיוֹם זֶה?
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa says: That day was the twenty-first of Nisan. The ministering angels said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, one who in the future will say Song at the Sea on this day be stricken on this day?
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina bar Papa said: That day was the twenty-first of Nisan. The ministering angels said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, one who is destined to sing a song at the sea on this day - shall be drowned on this day?

sentences.text: רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם שִׁשָּׁה בְּסִיוָן הָיָה, אָמְרוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, מִי שֶׁעָתִיד לְקַבֵּל תּוֹרָה מֵהַר סִינַי בְּיוֹם זֶה — יִלְקֶה בְּיוֹם זֶה?
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina says: That day was the sixth of Sivan. The ministering angels said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, one who in the future will receive Torah on Mount Sinai on this day be stricken on this day?
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Ahah bar Hanina said: That day was the sixth of Sivan. The ministering angels said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, one who is destined to receive the Torah from Mount Sinai on this day - shall he be punished on this day?

sentences.text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּשִׁשָּׁה בְּסִיוָן, מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ תְּלָתָא יַרְחֵי. דְּאָמַר מָר: בְּשִׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר מֵת, וּבְשִׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר נוֹלָד מֹשֶׁה, וּמִשִּׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר וְעַד שִׁשָּׁה בְּסִיוָן תְּלָתָא יַרְחֵי. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
sentences.human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says on the sixth of Sivan, you find three months as the Master said died on the seventh of Adar, and Moses was born on the seventh of Adar. And from the seventh of Adar until the sixth of Sivan three months, But according to the one who says on the twenty-first of Nisan, how can you find
sentences.llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says on the sixth of Sivan, you find three months. For the Master said: On the seventh of Adar, Moses died, and on the seventh of Adar, Moses was born, and from the seventh of Adar until the sixth of Sivan is three months. But according to the one who says on the twenty-first of Nisan, how do you find it?

sentences.text: אוֹתָהּ שָׁנָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת הָיְתָה: רוּבּוֹ שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹן, וְרוּבּוֹ שֶׁל אַחֲרוֹן, וְאֶמְצָעִי שָׁלֵם.
sentences.human_translation: That year was a leap year most of the first and most of the last and the entire middle one.
sentences.llm_translation: That year was a leap year: the majority of the first, the majority of the last, and the middle complete.

sentences.text: ״וַתֹּאמֶר אֲחוֹתוֹ אֶל בַּת פַּרְעֹה הַאֵלֵךְ וְקָרָאתִי לָךְ אִשָּׁה מֵינֶקֶת מִן הָעִבְרִיּוֹת״. וּמַאי שְׁנָא מֵעִבְרִיּוֹת?
sentences.human_translation: “Then said his sister to Pharaoh’s daughter: Shall I go and call you a nurse of the Hebrew women, And what is different of the Hebrew women?
sentences.llm_translation: "And his sister said to Pharaoh's daughter, 'Shall I go and call for you a nursemaid from the Hebrew women?'" What is different about Hebrew women?

sentences.text: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהֶחְזִירוּהוּ לְמֹשֶׁה עַל כׇּל הַמִּצְרִיּוֹת כּוּלָּן, וְלֹא יָנַק, אָמַר: פֶּה שֶׁעָתִיד לְדַבֵּר עִם הַשְּׁכִינָה יִינַק דָּבָר טָמֵא? וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶת מִי יוֹרֶה דֵעָה וְגוֹ׳״. לְמִי יוֹרֶה דֵּעָה וּלְמִי יָבִין שְׁמוּעָה — ״לִגְמוּלֵי מֵחָלָב וּלְעַתִּיקֵי מִשָּׁדַיִם״.
sentences.human_translation: teaches that they took Moses around to all the Egyptian and he did not nurse he said: a mouth that in the future speak with the Divine Presence nurse something impure? And this is as it is written: “Whom shall one teach knowledge? To whom shall teach knowledge and to whom shall make to understand the message “Them that are weaned from the milk, them that are drawn from the breasts”
sentences.llm_translation: It teaches that they returned him to Moses on all the Egyptian women, all of them, and he did not nurse, he said: "Shall a mouth that is destined to speak with the Divine Presence nurse impure speech?" And this is what is written: "Who will instruct knowledge, etc." To whom will he instruct knowledge, and to whom will he make known the report - "To those weaned from milk and removed from the breast."

sentences.text: ״וַתֹּאמֶר לָהּ בַּת פַּרְעֹה לֵכִי וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָלְכָה בִּזְרִיזוּת כְּעַלְמָה. רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: ״הָעַלְמָה״ — שֶׁהֶעֱלִימָה אֶת דְּבָרֶיהָ.
sentences.human_translation: “And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her: Go. Rabbi Elazar says: teaches that she went quickly like a maiden, Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says: ha’alma for she hid her words
sentences.llm_translation: "And she said to her, 'Pharaoh's daughter, go and...'." Rabbi Elazar said: This teaches that the halakha is in haste like a young woman. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: 'The young woman' - who concealed her words.

sentences.text: ״וַתֹּאמֶר לָהּ בַּת פַּרְעֹה הֵילִיכִי אֶת הַיֶּלֶד הַזֶּה״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִתְנַבְּאָה וְאֵינָהּ יוֹדַעַת מָה מִתְנַבְּאָה, ״הֵילִיכִי״ — הָא שֶׁלִּיכִי. ״וַאֲנִי אֶתֵּן אֶת שְׂכָרֵךְ״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לֹא דַּיָּין לַצַּדִּיקִים שֶׁמַּחְזִירִין לָהֶן אֲבֵידָתָן, אֶלָּא שֶׁנּוֹתְנִין לָהֶן שְׂכָרָן.
sentences.human_translation: “And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her: Take this [ heilikhi ] child away, Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: is prophesying and she does not know what she is prophesying, heilikhi This is yours [ ha shellikhi ], “And I will give you your wages.” Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: with regard to righteous people, not only that that their lost items are returned to them, but also that they get their wages,
sentences.llm_translation: "And she said to her, 'Take this child.' Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: She would prophesy and not know what she was prophesying. 'Heilichi' - that is, 'take him.' 'And I will give you your wages.' Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: It is not enough for the righteous that their lost property is returned to them, but they are also given their wages."

sentences.text: ״וַתִּקַּח מִרְיָם הַנְּבִיאָה אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן וְגוֹ׳״. אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן וְלֹא אֲחוֹת מֹשֶׁה? אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַב: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיְתָה מִתְנַבְּאָה כְּשֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן,
sentences.human_translation: “And Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took “the sister of Aaron,” and not the sister of Moses? Rav Amram says Rav says, and some say Rav Naḥman says Rav says: teaches that prophesied when she was the sister of Aaron,
sentences.llm_translation: "And Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took, etc." (Exodus 15:20). The sister of Aaron and not the sister of Moses? Rav Amram said in the name of Rav, and some say it was said to him, Rav Nachman said in the name of Rav: This teaches that she prophesied when she was the sister of Aaron.

sentences.text: וְאוֹמֶרֶת: עֲתִידָה אִמִּי שֶׁתֵּלֵד בֵּן שֶׁמּוֹשִׁיעַ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁנּוֹלַד מֹשֶׁה נִתְמַלֵּא כָּל הַבַּיִת כּוּלּוֹ אוֹר. עָמַד אָבִיהָ וּנְשָׁקָהּ עַל רֹאשָׁהּ, אָמַר לָהּ: בִּתִּי, נִתְקַיְּימָה נְבוּאָתִיךְ. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁהִטִּילוּהוּ לַיְאוֹר, עָמַד אָבִיהָ וּטְפָחָהּ עַל רֹאשָׁהּ, אָמַר לָהּ: בִּתִּי הֵיכָן נְבוּאָתִיךְ? וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתֵּתַצַּב אֲחוֹתוֹ מֵרָחוֹק לְדֵעָה מַה יֵּעָשֶׂה לוֹ״ — לֵידַע מָה יְהֵא בְּסוֹף נְבוּאָתָהּ.
sentences.human_translation: And would say: In the future, my mother will give birth to a son who will save the Jewish people. And once Moses was born, the entire house was filled with light. Her father arose and kissed her on her head. He said to her: My daughter, your prophecy has been fulfilled. And once they put him into the river, her father arose and hit her on her head. He said to her: My daughter, where is your prophecy? And this is as it is written: “And his sister stood afar off, to know what would be done to him” to know what will be the ultimate of her prophecy.
sentences.llm_translation: And she says: My mother is destined to give birth to a son who will save Israel. And once Moses was born, the entire house was filled with light. Her father stood up and kissed her on her head, and said to her: My daughter, your prophecy has been fulfilled. And once they cast him into the river, her father stood up and slapped her on her head, and said to her: My daughter, where is your prophecy now? And this is what is written: "And his sister stood at a distance to know what would be done to him" - to know what would be the end of her prophecy.

sentences.text: יוֹסֵף זָכָה וְכוּ׳. מַאי שְׁנָא מֵעִיקָּרָא דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַל יוֹסֵף לִקְבּוֹר אֶת אָבִיו וַיַּעֲלוּ אִתּוֹ כׇּל עַבְדֵי פַּרְעֹה וְגוֹ׳״, וַהֲדַר: ״וְכֹל בֵּית יוֹסֵף וְאֶחָיו וּבֵית אָבִיו״, וּמַאי שְׁנָא לְבַסּוֹף דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּשׇׁב יוֹסֵף מִצְרַיְמָה הוּא וְאֶחָיו״, וַהֲדַר: ״וְכׇל הָעוֹלִים אִתּוֹ לִקְבּוֹר אֶת אָבִיו״?
sentences.human_translation: Joseph merited What is different initially that it is written: “And Joseph went up to bury his father; and with him went up all the servants of Pharaoh, and afterward “And all the house of Joseph, and his brethren, and his father’s house; And what is different at the end that it is written: “And Joseph returned into Egypt, he, and his brethren,” and afterward “And all that went up with him to bury his father,
sentences.llm_translation: Joseph merited, etc. What is different from the beginning where it is written: "And Joseph went up to bury his father, and all of Pharaoh's servants went up with him, etc." And later: "And all the household of Joseph and his brothers and his father's household." And what is different at the end where it is written: "And Joseph went up from Egypt, he and his brothers," and later: "And all those who went up with him to bury his father?"

sentences.text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בַּתְּחִילָּה עַד שֶׁלֹּא רָאוּ בִּכְבוֹדָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל — לֹא נָהֲגוּ בָּהֶן כָּבוֹד, וּלְבַסּוֹף שֶׁרָאוּ בִּכְבוֹדָן — נָהֲגוּ בָּהֶן כָּבוֹד.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Initially, before saw the honor of the Jewish people, they did not treat them honor, And in the end, when they saw their honor, they treated honor.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: In the beginning, before they saw the honor of the children of Israel, they did not treat them with honor, but in the end, after they saw their honor, they treated them with honor.

sentences.text: דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּבֹאוּ עַד גּוֹרֶן הָאָטָד״, וְכִי גוֹרֶן יֵשׁ לוֹ לָאָטָד? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִקִּיפוּהוּ כְּתָרִים לַאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב כְּגוֹרֶן זֶה שֶׁמַּקִּיפִים לוֹ אָטָד, שֶׁבָּאוּ בְּנֵי עֵשָׂו וּבְנֵי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וּבְנֵי קְטוּרָה.
sentences.human_translation: As it is written: “And they came to the threshing floor of Atad, And does a boxthorn have a threshing floor? Rabbi Abbahu says: teaches that they surrounded the casket of Jacob with crowns, like this threshing floor that is surrounded with boxthorns, because the children of Esau and the children of Ishmael and the children of Keturah came
sentences.llm_translation: It is written: "And they came to the threshing floor of Atad." Does Atad have a threshing floor? Rabbi Abbahu said: It teaches that they encompassed it with crowns like the crown of the Ark of Jacob, as this threshing floor that they encompassed with a thornbush, for the sons of Esau, the sons of Ishmael, and the sons of Keturah came.

sentences.text: תָּנָא: כּוּלָּם לַמִּלְחָמָה בָּאוּ, כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאוּ כִּתְרוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף תָּלוּי בַּאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב, נָטְלוּ כּוּלָּן כִּתְרֵיהֶן וּתְלָאוּם בַּאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב. תָּנָא: שְׁלֹשִׁים וְשִׁשָּׁה כְּתָרִים נִתְלוּ בַּאֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב.
sentences.human_translation: taught: they all came to war once they saw the crown of Joseph, hanging on the casket of Jacob, they all took their crowns and hung them on the casket of Jacob. taught: Thirty-six crowns were hung on the casket of Jacob.
sentences.llm_translation: Mishnah: They all came to the war, once they saw the crown of Joseph hanging on the ark of Jacob, they all took off their crowns and hung them on the ark of Jacob. Mishnah: Thirty-six crowns were hung on the ark of Jacob.

sentences.text: ״וַיִּסְפְּדוּ שָׁם מִסְפֵּד גָּדוֹל וְכָבֵד מְאֹד״. תָּנָא: אֲפִילּוּ סוּסִים וַאֲפִילּוּ חֲמוֹרִים.
sentences.human_translation: “And there they wailed with a very great and sore wailing” taught: Even horses and even donkeys
sentences.llm_translation: "And they mourned there with very great and heavy mourning." It was taught: Even horses and even donkeys.

sentences.text: (מֵאֵילּוּ מֵאֵילּוּ) כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעוּ לִמְעָרַת הַמַּכְפֵּלָה, אֲתָא עֵשָׂו קָא מְעַכֵּב, אָמַר לָהֶן: ״מַמְרֵא קִרְיַת הָאַרְבַּע הִיא חֶבְרוֹן״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: קִרְיַת אַרְבַּע — אַרְבַּע זוּגוֹת הָיוּ: אָדָם וְחַוָּה, אַבְרָהָם וְשָׂרָה, יִצְחָק וְרִבְקָה, יַעֲקֹב וְלֵאָה. אִיהוּ קַבְרַהּ לְלֵאָה בְּדִידֵיהּ, וְהַאי דְּפָיֵישׁ — דִּידִי הוּא.
sentences.human_translation: Once they reached the Cave of Machpelah, Esau came and was preventing them He said to them: Mamre, to Kiryat Arba, the same is Hebron, And Rabbi Yitzḥak says: Kiryat Arba were four couples Adam and Eve, Abraham and Sarah, Isaac and Rebecca, Jacob and Leah. buried Leah in his and the that is remaining is mine.
sentences.llm_translation: (From which, from which) Once they arrived at the Cave of Machpelah, Esau came and delayed them. He said to them: "The bitterness of the city of the four is Hebron." And Rabbi Yitzchak said: The city of the four - there were four pairs: Adam and Eve, Abraham and Sarah, Isaac and Rebekah, Jacob and Leah. He buried Leah by herself, and this one, Ephron - it is mine.

sentences.text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: זַבֵּינְתֵּהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: נְהִי דְּזַבֵּינִי בְּכֵירוּתָא, פְּשִׁיטוּתָא מִי זַבֵּינִי? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּקִבְרִי אֲשֶׁר כָּרִיתִי לִי״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוֹצָדָק: אֵין ״כִּירָה״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן מְכִירָה, שֶׁכֵּן בִּכְרַכֵּי הַיָּם קוֹרִין לִמְכִירָה ״כִּירָה״.
sentences.human_translation: said to You sold to said to them: Though I sold the birthright, did I sell an ordinary said to him: Yes, as it is written in my grave that I have dug [ kariti ] for me And Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: kira is nothing other a term of a sale [ mekhira ] because in the cities overseas they call a sale kira .
sentences.llm_translation: They said to him: "Your wife has menstruated." He said to them: "If she has menstruated, who has caused her to menstruate?" They said to him: "No, as it is written: 'In my grave which I have dug for myself,' and Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: 'Kira' is only a term of recognition, as in the coral reefs of the sea they call recognition 'kira'."

sentences.text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: הַבוּ לִי אִיגַּרְתָּא! אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִיגַּרְתָּא בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם הִיא. וּמַאן נֵיזִיל — נֵיזִיל נַפְתָּלִי דְּקַלִּיל כִּי אַיָּילְתָּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״נַפְתָּלִי אַיָּלָה שְׁלוּחָה הַנּוֹתֵן אִמְרֵי שָׁפֶר״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אַל תִּקְרֵי ״אִמְרֵי שָׁפֶר״, אֶלָּא ״אִמְרֵי סֵפֶר״.
sentences.human_translation: said to them: Bring the bill to me, They said to him: The bill is in the land of Egypt. And who will go Naphtali will go, for he is as fast as a doe, as it is written: “Naphtali is a doe let loose, he gives goodly words” Rabbi Abbahu says: Do not read goodly words [ imrei shafer ]”; rather, imrei sefer ,
sentences.llm_translation: He said to them: "Bring me the letter!" They said to him: "The letter is in the land of Egypt." And who goes there? - Let Naftali, who is swift as a hind, go, as it is written: "Naftali is a hind let loose, who gives beautiful words." Rabbi Abbahu said: Do not read "beautiful words," but rather "beautiful books."

sentences.text: חוּשִׁים בְּרֵיהּ דְּדָן תַּמָּן הֲוָה, וְיַקִּירָן לֵיהּ אוּדְנֵיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַאי הַאי? וְאָמְרוּ לֵיהּ: קָא מְעַכֵּב הַאי עַד דְּאָתֵי נַפְתָּלִי מֵאַרְעָא דְּמִצְרַיִם. אֲמַר לְהוּ: וְעַד דְּאָתֵי נַפְתָּלִי מֵאַרְעָא דְּמִצְרַיִם, יְהֵא אֲבִי אַבָּא מוּטָל בְּבִזָּיוֹן? שְׁקַל קוּלְפָא מַחְיֵיהּ אַרֵישֵׁיהּ, נָתְרָן עֵינֵיהּ וּנְפַלוּ אַכַּרְעָא דְיַעֲקֹב, פַּתְחִינְהוּ יַעֲקֹב לְעֵינֵיהּ וְאַחֵיךְ. וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״יִשְׂמַח צַדִּיק כִּי חָזָה נָקָם פְּעָמָיו יִרְחַץ בְּדַם הָרָשָׁע״.
sentences.human_translation: Hushim, the son of Dan, was there and his ears were heavy, He said to them: What this And they said to him: This one, is preventing until Naphtali comes from the land of Egypt He said to them: And until Naphtali comes from the land of Egypt will father’s father lie in degradation? He took a club [ kulepa ] and hit on the head, eyes fell out and they fell on the legs of Jacob. Jacob opened his eyes and smiled. And this is that which is written: “The righteous shall rejoice when he sees the vengeance; he shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked”
sentences.llm_translation: Chushim, son of Dan, was there, and they were dear to him. He said to them: What is this? And they said to him: This is delaying until Naphtali comes from the land of Egypt. He said to them: And until Naphtali comes from the land of Egypt, should my grandfather be subjected to disgrace? He took a club, struck him on his head, his eyes popped out, and the sockets of Jacob's thigh fell. Jacob opened his eyes and saw his brother. This is what is written: "The righteous will rejoice when he sees vengeance; he will bathe his feet in the blood of the wicked."

sentences.text: בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִתְקַיְּימָה נְבוּאָתָהּ שֶׁל רִבְקָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״לָמָּה אֶשְׁכַּל גַּם שְׁנֵיכֶם יוֹם אֶחָד״. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּמִיתָתָן לֹא בְּיוֹם אֶחָד הֲוַאי — קְבוּרָתָן מִיהָא בְּיוֹם אֶחָד הֲוַאי.
sentences.human_translation: At that moment the prophecy of Rebecca was fulfilled, as it is written “Why should I be bereaved of you both in one day?” And although their deaths were not on the same day, in any event their burials were on the same day,
sentences.llm_translation: At that moment, the prophecy of Rivkah was fulfilled, as it is written: "Why should I be bereaved of you both in one day." And even though their death did not occur on the same day, their burial did indeed take place on one day.

sentences.text: וְאִי לָא [אִי]עֲסַק בֵּיהּ יוֹסֵף, אֶחָיו לָא הֲווֹ מִעַסְּקִי בֵּיהּ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׂאוּ אוֹתוֹ בָנָיו אַרְצָה כְּנַעַן״? אָמְרוּ: הַנִּיחוּ לוֹ, כְּבוֹדוֹ בִּמְלָכִים יוֹתֵר מִבְּהֶדְיוֹטוֹת.
sentences.human_translation: And if Joseph would not have dealt with would his brothers not have dealt with it? But isn’t it written: “For his sons carried him into the land of Canaan, They said: Allow more honor by royalty than by common [ hedyotot ].
sentences.llm_translation: And if if he did not engage with him, were his brothers not engaging with him? And it is written: "And his sons carried him to the land of Canaan"? They said: Leave him, his honor is greater among kings than among commoners.

sentences.text: מִי לָנוּ גָּדוֹל מִיּוֹסֵף כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בֹּא וּרְאֵה כַּמָּה חֲבִיבוֹת מִצְוֹת עַל מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, שֶׁכׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל כּוּלָּן נִתְעַסְּקוּ בַּבִּיזָּה, וְהוּא נִתְעַסֵּק בְּמִצְוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חֲכַם לֵב יִקַּח מִצְוֹת וְגוֹ׳״.
sentences.human_translation: Who, to us, a greater than Joseph, The Sages taught Come and see how beloved mitzvot are to Moses our teacher. As, all the Jewish people were involved in the plunder and he was involved in mitzvot, as it is stated: “The wise in heart will take mitzvot”
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is greater than our master Joseph? The Rabbis taught: Come and see how beloved are the commandments to Moses our teacher, for all of Israel were engaged in shearing, and he was engaged in commandments, as it is stated: "A wise heart will take commandments, etc."

sentences.text: וּמִנַּיִן הָיָה יוֹדֵעַ מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ הֵיכָן יוֹסֵף קָבוּר? אָמְרוּ: סֶרַח בַּת אָשֵׁר נִשְׁתַּיְּירָה מֵאוֹתוֹ הַדּוֹר. הָלַךְ מֹשֶׁה אֶצְלָהּ, אָמַר לָהּ: כְּלוּם אַתְּ יוֹדַעַת הֵיכָן יוֹסֵף קָבוּר? אָמְרָה לוֹ: אָרוֹן שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת עָשׂוּ לוֹ מִצְרִים וּקְבָעוּהוּ בְּנִילוּס הַנָּהָר, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּתְבָּרְכוּ מֵימָיו. הָלַךְ מֹשֶׁה וְעָמַד עַל שְׂפַת נִילוּס, אָמַר לוֹ: יוֹסֵף יוֹסֵף! הִגִּיעַ הָעֵת שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּע הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁאֲנִי גּוֹאֵל אֶתְכֶם, וְהִגִּיעָה הַשְּׁבוּעָה שֶׁהִשְׁבַּעְתָּ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. אִם אַתָּה מַרְאֶה עַצְמְךָ מוּטָב, אִם לָאו — הֲרֵי אָנוּ מְנוּקִּין מִשְּׁבוּעָתֶךָ. מִיָּד צָף אֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף.
sentences.human_translation: And from where did Moses our teacher know where Joseph was buried? said: Serah, the daughter of Asher, remained from that generation Moses went to her said to her: Do you know anything where Joseph is buried? She said to him: The Egyptians fashioned a metal casket for him and set it in the Nile [ Nilus ] River so that its water would be blessed. Moses went and stood on the bank of the Nile. said to Joseph, Joseph, the time has arrived which the Holy One, Blessed be He, took an oath that I, will redeem you. And the oath that you administered to the Jewish people has arrived. If you show yourself, good, if not, we are clear from your oath. Immediately, the casket of Joseph floated
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where did Moses, our teacher, know where Joseph was buried? They said: Serach the daughter of Asher remained from that generation. Moses went to her, he said to her: Do you know where Joseph is buried? She said to him: A metal coffin the Egyptians made for him and they fixed it in the Nile River, so that his blessings may emanate from his waters. Moses went and stood on the bank of the Nile, he said: Joseph, Joseph! The time has come that the Holy One, blessed be He, swore that I will redeem you, and the week has arrived that you swore to the children of Israel. If you show yourself favorable, good; if not, behold, we are absolved from your oath. Immediately his coffin floated up.

sentences.text: וְאַל תִּתְמַהּ הֵיאַךְ בַּרְזֶל צָף, שֶׁהֲרֵי כְּתִיב: ״וַיְהִי הָאֶחָד מַפִּיל הַקּוֹרָה וְאֶת הַבַּרְזֶל נָפַל אֶל הַמָּיִם וְגוֹ׳ אֲהָהּ אֲדוֹנִי וְהוּא שָׁאוּל. וַיֹּאמֶר אִישׁ הָאֱלֹהִים אָנָה נָפָל וַיַּרְאֵהוּ אֶת הַמָּקוֹם וַיִּקְצׇב עֵץ וַיַּשְׁלֶךְ שָׁמָּה וַיָּצֶף הַבַּרְזֶל״. וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה אֱלִישָׁע תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל אֵלִיָּהוּ, וְאֵלִיָּהוּ תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה — צָף בַּרְזֶל מִפָּנָיו, מִפְּנֵי מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
sentences.human_translation: And do not wonder how iron float, as it is written “But as one was felling a beam, the ax head fell into the water; Alas, my master! For it was borrowed. And the man of God said: Where did it fall? And he showed him the place. And he cut down a stick, and cast it in there, and the iron floated up” And are matters not a fortiori : And just as Elisha, student of Elijah, and Elijah student of Moses, iron float before him, all the more so before Moses our teacher
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: And do not wonder how iron can float, for it is written: "And the iron head fell into the water, and alas, my master, and it was Saul. And the man of God said, 'Where did it fall?' And he showed him the place, and he cut a stick and threw it there, and the iron floated." And are these not logical arguments: If Elisha, the disciple of Elijah, and Elijah, the disciple of Moses, made iron float before him, how much more so before our teacher Moses - all the more so.

sentences.text: רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: בְּקַבַּרְנִיט שֶׁל מְלָכִים הָיָה קָבוּר. הָלַךְ מֹשֶׁה וְעָמַד עַל קַבַּרְנִיט שֶׁל מְלָכִים, אָמַר: יוֹסֵף, הִגִּיעַ עֵת שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּע הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁאֲנִי גּוֹאֵל אֶתְכֶם, וְהִגִּיעָה שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁהִשְׁבַּעְתָּ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. אִם אַתָּה מַרְאֶה עַצְמְךָ — מוּטָב, וְאִם לָאו — הֲרֵי אָנוּ מְנוּקִּין מִשְּׁבוּעָתֶךָ. בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִזְדַּעְזַע אֲרוֹנוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף, נְטָלוֹ מֹשֶׁה, וֶהֱבִיאוֹ אֶצְלוֹ.
sentences.human_translation: Rabbi Natan says: was buried in the crypt [ kabbarnit ] of kings. Moses went and stood by the crypt of kings said: Joseph, the time has arrived which the Holy One, Blessed be He, took an oath that: I will redeem you. And the oath that you administered to the Jewish people has arrived. If you show yourself, good, but if not, we are clear from your oath. At that moment, the casket of Joseph shook Moses took it and brought it to himself.
sentences.llm_translation: Rabbi Nathan says: In the burial cave of kings he was buried. Moses went and stood at the burial cave of kings, he said: Joseph, the time has come that the Holy One, blessed be He, swore that I will redeem you, and the week has arrived that you swore to Israel. If you show yourself - good, and if not - behold, we are exempt from your oath. At that moment, the coffin of Joseph shook, Moses took it and brought it with him.

sentences.text: וְכׇל אוֹתָן שָׁנִים שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר, הָיוּ שְׁנֵי אֲרוֹנוֹת הַלָּלוּ, אֶחָד שֶׁל מֵת וְאֶחָד שֶׁל שְׁכִינָה, מְהַלְּכִין זֶה עִם זֶה, וְהָיוּ עוֹבְרִין וְשָׁבִין אוֹמְרִים: מָה טִיבָן שֶׁל שְׁנֵי אֲרוֹנוֹת הַלָּלוּ? אָמְרוּ: אֶחָד שֶׁל מֵת וְאֶחָד שֶׁל שְׁכִינָה. וְכִי מָה דַּרְכּוֹ שֶׁל מֵת לְהַלֵּךְ עִם שְׁכִינָה? אָמְרוּ:
sentences.human_translation: And all those years that the Jewish people were in the wilderness, these two arks, one of a dead man, and one of the Divine Presence, were traveling together, and passersby would say: What is the nature of these two arks? They said One of a dead person and one of the Divine Presence. And what the manner of a dead person to travel with the Divine Presence? They said
sentences.llm_translation: And all those years that Israel was in the wilderness, these two arks were there, one of the deceased and one of the Divine Presence, walking together, and they would pass and return, saying: What is the nature of these two arks? They said: One of the deceased and one of the Divine Presence. And is it the way of the deceased to walk with the Divine Presence? They said:

text: אֶלָּא ״וַיַּקְרִיא״. מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִקְרִיא אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ לִשְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּפֶה כׇּל עוֹבֵר וָשָׁב. כֵּיצַד? לְאַחַר שֶׁאָכְלוּ וְשָׁתוּ, עָמְדוּ לְבָרְכוֹ. אָמַר לָהֶם: וְכִי מִשֶּׁלִּי אֲכַלְתֶּם? מִשֶּׁל אֱלֹהֵי עוֹלָם אֲכַלְתֶּם! הוֹדוּ וְשַׁבְּחוּ וּבָרְכוּ לְמִי שֶׁאָמַר וְהָיָה הָעוֹלָם.
״וַיִּרְאֶהָ יְהוּדָה וַיַּחְשְׁבֶהָ לְזוֹנָה כִּי כִסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ״. מִשּׁוּם דְּכִסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ, חַשְּׁבַהּ לְזוֹנָה?!

אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שֶׁכִּסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: כׇּל כַּלָּה שֶׁהִיא צְנוּעָה בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ — זוֹכָה וְיוֹצְאִין מִמֶּנָּה מְלָכִים וּנְבִיאִים. מְנָלַן — מִתָּמָר. נְבִיאִים — דִּכְתִיב: ״חֲזוֹן יְשַׁעְיָהוּ בֶן אָמוֹץ״. מְלָכִים — מִדָּוִד. וְאָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: דָּבָר זֶה מָסוֹרֶת בְּיָדֵינוּ מֵאֲבוֹתֵינוּ: אָמוֹץ וַאֲמַצְיָה — אַחִים הֲווֹ.
״הִיא מוּצֵאת״. ״הִיא מִיתּוֹצֵאת״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּמְצְאוּ סִימָנֶיהָ בָּא סַמָּאֵל וְרִיחֲקָן, בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וְקֵירְבָן.

הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״לִמְנַצֵּחַ עַל יוֹנַת אֵלֶם רְחוֹקִים לְדָוִד מִכְתָּם״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁנִּתְרַחֲקוּ סִימָנֶיהָ נַעֲשֵׂית כְּיוֹנָה אִילֶּמֶת. ״לְדָוִד מִכְתָּם״: שֶׁיָּצָא מִמֶּנָּה דָּוִד, שֶׁהָיָה מָךְ וְתָם לַכֹּל. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״מִכְתָּם״ — שֶׁהָיְתָה מַכָּתוֹ תַּמָּה, שֶׁנּוֹלַד כְּשֶׁהוּא מָהוּל. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״מִכְתָּם״ — כְּשֵׁם שֶׁבְּקַטְנוּתוֹ הִקְטִין עַצְמוֹ אֵצֶל מִי שֶׁגָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה, כָּךְ בִּגְדוּלָּתוֹ.

״וְהִיא שָׁלְחָה אֶל חָמִיהָ לֵאמֹר לְאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר אֵלֶּה לּוֹ אָנֹכִי הָרָה״. וְתֵימָא לֵיהּ מֵימָר! אָמַר רַב זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא, וְאָמְרִי לָהּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: נוֹחַ לוֹ לָאָדָם שֶׁיַּפִּיל עַצְמוֹ לְתוֹךְ כִּבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ, וְאַל יַלְבִּין פְּנֵי חֲבֵירוֹ בָּרַבִּים. מְנָלַן — מִתָּמָר.

״הַכֶּר נָא״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישֵּׂר לְאָבִיו — בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישְּׂרוּהוּ. בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישֵּׂר: ״הַכֶּר נָא הַכְּתֹנֶת בִּנְךָ הִיא״. בְּ״הַכֶּר״ בִּישְּׂרוּהוּ: ״הַכֶּר נָא לְמִי״.
״נָא״. אֵין ״נָא״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן בַּקָּשָׁה. אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: בְּבַקָּשָׁה מִמְּךָ, הַכֵּר פְּנֵי בּוֹרַאֲךָ וְאַל תַּעֲלִים עֵינֶיךָ מִמֶּנִּי.

״וַיַּכֵּר יְהוּדָה וַיֹּאמֶר צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״. הַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַב חָנִין בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא: יוֹסֵף שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בַּסֵּתֶר — זָכָה וְהוֹסִיפוּ לוֹ אוֹת אַחַת מִשְּׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״עֵדוּת בִּיהוֹסֵף שָׂמוֹ״.

יְהוּדָה שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא — זָכָה וְנִקְרָא כּוּלּוֹ עַל שְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהוֹדָה וְאָמַר ״צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״, יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: אַתָּה הִצַּלְתָּ תָּמָר וּשְׁנֵי בָּנֶיהָ מִן הָאוּר — חַיֶּיךָ שֶׁאֲנִי מַצִּיל בִּזְכוּתְךָ שְׁלֹשָׁה מִבָּנֶיךָ מִן הָאוּר. מַאן נִינְהוּ — חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה.
״צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״. מְנָא יָדַע? יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: מִמֶּנִּי יָצְאוּ כְּבוּשִׁים.

״וְלֹא יָסַף עוֹד לְדַעְתָּה״. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל סָבָא חֲמוּהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי: כֵּיוָן שֶׁיְּדָעָהּ — שׁוּב לֹא פָּסַק מִמֶּנָּה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְלֹא יָסַף עוֹד לְדַעְתָּה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״קוֹל גָּדוֹל וְלֹא יָסָף״.

״וַיִּרְגַּז הַמֶּלֶךְ וַיַּעַל עַל עֲלִיַּית הַשַּׁעַר וַיֵּבְךְּ וְכֹה אָמַר בְּלֶכְתּוֹ בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם מִי יִתֵּן מוּתִי אֲנִי תַחְתֶּיךָ אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי. וְהַמֶּלֶךְ לָאַט אֶת פָּנָיו וַיִּזְעַק הַמֶּלֶךְ קוֹל גָּדוֹל בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי״. הָנֵי תְּמָנְיָא ״בְּנִי״ לְמָה? שִׁבְעָה דְּאַסְּקֵיהּ מִשִּׁבְעָה מְדוֹרֵי גֵיהִנָּם, וְאִידַּךְ, אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּקָרֵיב רֵישֵׁיהּ לְגַבֵּי גוּפֵיהּ, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּאַיְיתֵיהּ לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי.

״וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם לָקַח וַיַּצֶּב לוֹ בְחַיָּיו״. מַאי ״לָקַח״? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: שֶׁלָּקַח מִקָּח רַע לְעַצְמוֹ. ״אֶת מַצֶּבֶת אֲשֶׁר בְּעֵמֶק הַמֶּלֶךְ וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא: בְּעֵצָה עֲמוּקָּה שֶׁל מַלְכּוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, "And he called." Teaches that our father Abraham called the name of the Holy One, blessed be He, with the mouth of every passerby. How so? After they ate and drank, they stood to bless. He said to them: Did you eat from what is mine? You ate from what belongs to the God of the world! Give thanks, praise, and bless to the One who spoke and the world came into being.
"And Judah saw her and he thought her to be a harlot, for she had covered her face." Because she covered her face, he thought her to be a harlot?!

Rabbi Elazar said: "She covered her face in her father-in-law's house." As Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: "Every bride who is modest in her father-in-law's house merits that kings and prophets descend from her." From where do we derive this? From Tamar. Prophets - as it is written: "The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz." Kings - from David. And Rabbi Levi said: "This matter is a tradition handed down to us from our ancestors: Amoz and Amatzyah were brothers."
"She finds." "She is found." What does he want with "she is found"? Rabbi Elazar said: After her signs were found, Samael came and distanced them, then Gabriel came and brought them close.

That is as it is written: "For the conductor, upon the silent dove, distant ones, a michtam of David." Rabbi Yochanan said: From the time its signs distanced themselves, it became like a mute dove. "A michtam of David": that David emerged from it, for he was humble and simple before everyone. Another explanation: "michtam" - that his strike was wondrous, as he was born circumcised. Another explanation: "michtam" - just as in his youth he humbled himself before one greater than him to learn Torah, so too in his greatness.

"And she sent to her mother-in-law, saying, 'To the man to whom these belong, I am pregnant.' And say to him from me! Rav Zutra bar Tobiah said in the name of Rav, and some say in the name of Rav Hana bar Bizna said in the name of Rabbi Shimon Chasida, and some say in the name of Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: It is better for a person to cast himself into a fiery furnace than to shame his fellow in public. From where do we derive this? From a palm tree."

"The pit, please." Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: With 'the pit,' he was straightforward to his father - with 'the pit,' they sold him. With 'the pit,' he was straightforward: 'The pit is your son's tunic.' They sold him with 'the pit': 'To whom does the pit belong?'"
"Na." There is no "na" except as a language of difficulty. She said to him: 'With difficulty from you, recognize the presence of your Creator, and do not hide your eyes from me.'

"And Judah recognized and said, 'She is more righteous than I.' This is as Rav Hanin bar Bizna said in the name of Rabbi Shimon Chasida: If Joseph sanctified the name of Heaven in secret, he merited and they added one letter from the name of the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is written: 'The testimony was in Joseph.'"

Judah, who sanctified the name of Heaven in public - he merited and was called entirely by the name of the Holy One, blessed be He. Once he acknowledged and said, "Righteousness is from me," a heavenly voice emerged and said: "You have saved Tamar and her two sons from the fire - by your merit, I save three of your sons from the fire." Who are they? Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah.
"Charity from me." From where did he know? A heavenly voice emerged and said: "From me they came out embarrassed."

"And she shall not continue to know." Shmuel the Elder said in the name of Rav Shmuel bar Ammi: Once she knew - she never ceased from it. It is written here: "And she shall not continue to know," and it is written there: "A loud voice and he did not add."

Talmudic text: Avshalom nitga'ah bis'aro v'chu. Tanu Rabanan: Avshalom bis'aro marad, shene'emar: "u'ch'Avshalom lo hayah ish yafeh v'chu. u'v'galcho et rosho v'hayah miketz yamim layamim asher yegale'ach ki kaveid alav v'gilcho v'shakal et se'ar rosho matayim sh'kalim b'even hammelech." Tanah: even she'anshei Teverya v'anshei Tzipori shoklim bah. English translation: Avshalom was proud of his hair, as it is stated: "Now in all Israel there was none to be so much praised as Avshalom for his beauty; from the sole of his foot even to the crown of his head there was no blemish in him." And when he shaved his head at the end of every year, for it was heavy on him, he would shave it; he weighed the hair of his head at two hundred shekels by the king's weight. It was taught: The stone that the men of Teverya and the men of Tzipori would weigh with.

Therefore, he was hanged by his hair, as it is stated: "And Absalom called before David's servants, and Absalom rode upon the mule, and the mule came under the thick branches of a great terebinth, and his head caught hold of the terebinth, and he was suspended between heaven and earth, and the mule that was under him passed by." Shikl Sapsera sought to depart. It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: At that moment, the netherworld split open beneath him.

The king was upset and went up to the upper chamber of the gate and wept, and thus he said as he went, "O my son Absalom, my son, my son Absalom! Would I had died instead of you, O Absalom, my son, my son!" And the king covered his face and cried out with a loud voice, "O my son Absalom, Absalom my son, my son!" Those Talmudic scholars said, "Why does he say 'my son' seven times? Because he saw him in seven compartments of Gehenna. And others say: his head was brought close to his body, and others say: he was brought to the world to come."

"And Avshalom took and set up for himself in his lifetime." What is meant by "took"? Reish Lakish said: that he took an evil acquisition for himself. "The pillar that is in the King's Valley, etc." Rabbi Chanina bar Papa said: with deep counsel of the eternal king.

sentences.text: אֶלָּא ״וַיַּקְרִיא״. מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִקְרִיא אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ לִשְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּפֶה כׇּל עוֹבֵר וָשָׁב. כֵּיצַד? לְאַחַר שֶׁאָכְלוּ וְשָׁתוּ, עָמְדוּ לְבָרְכוֹ. אָמַר לָהֶם: וְכִי מִשֶּׁלִּי אֲכַלְתֶּם? מִשֶּׁל אֱלֹהֵי עוֹלָם אֲכַלְתֶּם! הוֹדוּ וְשַׁבְּחוּ וּבָרְכוּ לְמִי שֶׁאָמַר וְהָיָה הָעוֹלָם.

sentences.text: הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״לִמְנַצֵּחַ עַל יוֹנַת אֵלֶם רְחוֹקִים לְדָוִד מִכְתָּם״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁנִּתְרַחֲקוּ סִימָנֶיהָ נַעֲשֵׂית כְּיוֹנָה אִילֶּמֶת. ״לְדָוִד מִכְתָּם״: שֶׁיָּצָא מִמֶּנָּה דָּוִד, שֶׁהָיָה מָךְ וְתָם לַכֹּל. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״מִכְתָּם״ — שֶׁהָיְתָה מַכָּתוֹ תַּמָּה, שֶׁנּוֹלַד כְּשֶׁהוּא מָהוּל. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״מִכְתָּם״ — כְּשֵׁם שֶׁבְּקַטְנוּתוֹ הִקְטִין עַצְמוֹ אֵצֶל מִי שֶׁגָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה, כָּךְ בִּגְדוּלָּתוֹ.

sentences.llm_translation: "The pit, please." Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: With 'the pit,' he was straightforward to his father - with 'the pit,' they sold him. With 'the pit,' he was straightforward: 'The pit is your son's tunic.' They sold him with 'the pit': 'To whom does the pit belong?'"

sentences.text: ״נָא״. אֵין ״נָא״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן בַּקָּשָׁה. אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: בְּבַקָּשָׁה מִמְּךָ, הַכֵּר פְּנֵי בּוֹרַאֲךָ וְאַל תַּעֲלִים עֵינֶיךָ מִמֶּנִּי.
sentences.human_translation: please [ na ].” na nothing other a language of request. She said to him: I request of you: Discern the image of your Creator and do not avert your eyes from me.
sentences.llm_translation: "Na." There is no "na" except as a language of difficulty. She said to him: 'With difficulty from you, recognize the presence of your Creator, and do not hide your eyes from me.'

sentences.text: ״וַיַּכֵּר יְהוּדָה וַיֹּאמֶר צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״. הַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַב חָנִין בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא: יוֹסֵף שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בַּסֵּתֶר — זָכָה וְהוֹסִיפוּ לוֹ אוֹת אַחַת מִשְּׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״עֵדוּת בִּיהוֹסֵף שָׂמוֹ״.
sentences.human_translation: “And Judah acknowledged them, and said: She is more righteous than I; This is as Rav Ḥanin bar Bizna says Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida says: Joseph, who sanctified the name of Heaven in private merited that one letter from the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, was added to his as it is written: “He appointed it in Joseph [ bihosef ] for a testimony in his name,
sentences.llm_translation: "And Judah recognized and said, 'She is more righteous than I.' This is as Rav Hanin bar Bizna said in the name of Rabbi Shimon Chasida: If Joseph sanctified the name of Heaven in secret, he merited and they added one letter from the name of the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is written: 'The testimony was in Joseph.'"

sentences.text: יְהוּדָה שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא — זָכָה וְנִקְרָא כּוּלּוֹ עַל שְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהוֹדָה וְאָמַר ״צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״, יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: אַתָּה הִצַּלְתָּ תָּמָר וּשְׁנֵי בָּנֶיהָ מִן הָאוּר — חַיֶּיךָ שֶׁאֲנִי מַצִּיל בִּזְכוּתְךָ שְׁלֹשָׁה מִבָּנֶיךָ מִן הָאוּר. מַאן נִינְהוּ — חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה.
sentences.human_translation: Judah, who sanctified the name of Heaven in public, merited that his entire is called by the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, When he confessed and said: “She is more righteous than I,” a Divine Voice went forth and said: You saved Tamar and her two children from the fire. your life, in your merit, I will save three of your children from the fire. who are they? Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah
sentences.llm_translation: Judah, who sanctified the name of Heaven in public - he merited and was called entirely by the name of the Holy One, blessed be He. Once he acknowledged and said, "Righteousness is from me," a heavenly voice emerged and said: "You have saved Tamar and her two sons from the fire - by your merit, I save three of your sons from the fire." Who are they? Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah.

sentences.text: ״צָדְקָה מִמֶּנִּי״. מְנָא יָדַע? יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: מִמֶּנִּי יָצְאוּ כְּבוּשִׁים.
sentences.human_translation: “She is more righteous than I [ mimmenni ].” From where did he know A Divine Voice went forth and said: From Me these hidden emerged,
sentences.llm_translation: "Charity from me." From where did he know? A heavenly voice emerged and said: "From me they came out embarrassed."

sentences.text: ״וְלֹא יָסַף עוֹד לְדַעְתָּה״. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל סָבָא חֲמוּהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי: כֵּיוָן שֶׁיְּדָעָהּ — שׁוּב לֹא פָּסַק מִמֶּנָּה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְלֹא יָסַף עוֹד לְדַעְתָּה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״קוֹל גָּדוֹל וְלֹא יָסָף״.
sentences.human_translation: “And he knew her [ leda’atah ] again no more [ velo yasaf ],” Shmuel the Elder, father-in-law of Rav Shmuel bar Ami, says in the name of Rav Shmuel bar Ami: once he knew her he did not desist from her again, it is written here: “ Velo yasaf od leda’atah ,” and it is written there with a great voice and it went on no more [ velo yasaf ]”
sentences.llm_translation: "And she shall not continue to know." Shmuel the Elder said in the name of Rav Shmuel bar Ammi: Once she knew - she never ceased from it. It is written here: "And she shall not continue to know," and it is written there: "A loud voice and he did not add."

sentences.text: אַבְשָׁלוֹם נִתְגָּאָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַבְשָׁלוֹם בִּשְׂעָרוֹ מָרַד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּכְאַבְשָׁלוֹם לֹא הָיָה אִישׁ יָפֶה וְגוֹ׳. וּבְגַלְּחוֹ אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ וְהָיָה מִקֵּץ יָמִים לַיָּמִים אֲשֶׁר יְגַלֵּחַ כִּי כָבֵד עָלָיו וְגִלְּחוֹ וְשָׁקַל אֶת שְׂעַר רֹאשׁוֹ מָאתַיִם שְׁקָלִים בְּאֶבֶן הַמֶּלֶךְ״. תָּנָא: אֶבֶן שֶׁאַנְשֵׁי טְבֶרְיָא וְאַנְשֵׁי צִיפּוֹרִי שׁוֹקְלִים בָּהּ.
sentences.human_translation: Absalom was proud of his hair, The Sages taught Absalom rebelled due to his hair, as it is stated: there was none as Absalom for his beauty; And when he shaved his head, as it was at every year’s end that he shaved it; because the hair was heavy on him, therefore he shaved it, and he weighed the hair of his head at two hundred shekels, by the king’s stone” taught: A stone with which the people of Tiberias and the people of Tzippori weigh
sentences.llm_translation: Talmudic text: Avshalom nitga'ah bis'aro v'chu. Tanu Rabanan: Avshalom bis'aro marad, shene'emar: "u'ch'Avshalom lo hayah ish yafeh v'chu. u'v'galcho et rosho v'hayah miketz yamim layamim asher yegale'ach ki kaveid alav v'gilcho v'shakal et se'ar rosho matayim sh'kalim b'even hammelech." Tanah: even she'anshei Teverya v'anshei Tzipori shoklim bah. English translation: Avshalom was proud of his hair, as it is stated: "Now in all Israel there was none to be so much praised as Avshalom for his beauty; from the sole of his foot even to the crown of his head there was no blemish in him." And when he shaved his head at the end of every year, for it was heavy on him, he would shave it; he weighed the hair of his head at two hundred shekels by the king's weight. It was taught: The stone that the men of Teverya and the men of Tzipori would weigh with.

sentences.text: לְפִיכָךְ נִתְלָה בִּשְׂעָרוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקְרָא אַבְשָׁלוֹם לִפְנֵי עַבְדֵי דָוִד וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם רֹכֵב עַל הַפֶּרֶד וַיָּבֹא הַפֶּרֶד תַּחַת שׂוֹבֶךְ הָאֵלָה הַגְּדוֹלָה וַיֶּחֱזַק רֹאשׁוֹ בָאֵלָה וַיֻּתַּן בֵּין הַשָּׁמַיִם וּבֵין הָאָרֶץ וְהַפֶּרֶד אֲשֶׁר תַּחְתָּיו עָבָר״. שְׁקַל סַפְסִירָא בְּעָא לְמִיפְסְקֵיהּ. תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִבְקַע שְׁאוֹל מִתַּחְתָּיו.
sentences.human_translation: therefore, he was hung by his hair, as it is stated “And Absalom chanced to meet the servants of David. And Absalom was riding upon his mule, and the mule went under the thick boughs of a great terebinth, and his head caught hold of the terebinth, and he was taken up between the heaven and the earth; and the mule that was under him went on” took a sword [ safseira ] and wanted to cut his hair The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: At that moment, the netherworld opened beneath him
sentences.llm_translation: Therefore, he was hanged by his hair, as it is stated: "And Absalom called before David's servants, and Absalom rode upon the mule, and the mule came under the thick branches of a great terebinth, and his head caught hold of the terebinth, and he was suspended between heaven and earth, and the mule that was under him passed by." Shikl Sapsera sought to depart. It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: At that moment, the netherworld split open beneath him.

sentences.text: ״וַיִּרְגַּז הַמֶּלֶךְ וַיַּעַל עַל עֲלִיַּית הַשַּׁעַר וַיֵּבְךְּ וְכֹה אָמַר בְּלֶכְתּוֹ בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם מִי יִתֵּן מוּתִי אֲנִי תַחְתֶּיךָ אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי. וְהַמֶּלֶךְ לָאַט אֶת פָּנָיו וַיִּזְעַק הַמֶּלֶךְ קוֹל גָּדוֹל בְּנִי אַבְשָׁלוֹם אַבְשָׁלוֹם בְּנִי בְנִי״. הָנֵי תְּמָנְיָא ״בְּנִי״ לְמָה? שִׁבְעָה דְּאַסְּקֵיהּ מִשִּׁבְעָה מְדוֹרֵי גֵיהִנָּם, וְאִידַּךְ, אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּקָרֵיב רֵישֵׁיהּ לְגַבֵּי גוּפֵיהּ, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּאַיְיתֵיהּ לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי.
sentences.human_translation: “And the king was much moved, and went up to the chamber over the gate, and wept; and as he went about he said: O my son Absalom, my son, my son Absalom! Would I had died in your place, O Absalom, my son, my son” “And the king covered his face, and the king cried with a loud voice: O my son Absalom, O Absalom, my son, my son” Why these eight “my son” Seven which he raised him up from the seven chambers of Gehenna. And the other, some say that brought head close to body, and some say that brought to the World-to-Come.
sentences.llm_translation: The king was upset and went up to the upper chamber of the gate and wept, and thus he said as he went, "O my son Absalom, my son, my son Absalom! Would I had died instead of you, O Absalom, my son, my son!" And the king covered his face and cried out with a loud voice, "O my son Absalom, Absalom my son, my son!" Those Talmudic scholars said, "Why does he say 'my son' seven times? Because he saw him in seven compartments of Gehenna. And others say: his head was brought close to his body, and others say: he was brought to the world to come."

sentences.text: ״וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם לָקַח וַיַּצֶּב לוֹ בְחַיָּיו״. מַאי ״לָקַח״? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: שֶׁלָּקַח מִקָּח רַע לְעַצְמוֹ. ״אֶת מַצֶּבֶת אֲשֶׁר בְּעֵמֶק הַמֶּלֶךְ וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא: בְּעֵצָה עֲמוּקָּה שֶׁל מַלְכּוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם,
sentences.human_translation: “Now Absalom in his lifetime had taken and reared up for himself What did take? Reish Lakish says: He engaged in a bad transaction for himself “The pillar, which is in the king’s valley [ be’emek hammelekh ].” Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa says: in the deep [ amukka ] counsel of the King [ melekh ] of the universe,
sentences.llm_translation: "And Avshalom took and set up for himself in his lifetime." What is meant by "took"? Reish Lakish said: that he took an evil acquisition for himself. "The pillar that is in the King's Valley, etc." Rabbi Chanina bar Papa said: with deep counsel of the eternal king.

text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִין.
וְתַנְיָא כְּבֵיצָה.
סַבְרוּהָ אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּעִיסָּה רִאשׁוֹנָה, וְחוּלִּין הַטְּבוּלִין לְחַלָּה לָא כְּחַלָּה דָּמוּ.
מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר: אֵין שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין,
וּמָר סָבַר: שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין.

אָמַר רַב מָרִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אֵין שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין, וְהָכָא בְּחוּלִּין הַטְּבוּלִין לְחַלָּה קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: כְּחַלָּה דָּמוּ, וּמָר סָבַר: לָא כְּחַלָּה דָּמוּ.

וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא חוּלִּין הַטְּבוּלִין לְחַלָּה לָא כְּחַלָּה דָּמוּ, וְאֵין שֵׁנִי עוֹשֶׂה שְׁלִישִׁי בְּחוּלִּין, וְהָכָא בְּמוּתָּר לִגְרוֹם טוּמְאָה לְחוּלִּין שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל קָמִיפַּלְגִי.
מָר סָבַר: מוּתָּר לִגְרוֹם טוּמְאָה לְחוּלִּין שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וּמָר סָבַר: אָסוּר לִגְרוֹם טוּמְאָה לְחוּלִּין שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְכוּ׳.
בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: תְּחוּמִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וּמָר סָבַר: דְּרַבָּנַן.

תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעָלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מִן הַיָּם, נָתְנוּ עֵינֵיהֶם לוֹמַר שִׁירָה. וְכֵיצַד אָמְרוּ שִׁירָה — כְּגָדוֹל הַמַּקְרֶא אֶת הַלֵּל, וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו רָאשֵׁי פְרָקִים. מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״, וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״, מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״כִּי גָאֹה גָּאָה״ וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״.

רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: כְּקָטָן הַמַּקְרֶא אֶת הַלֵּל, וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו כׇּל מָה שֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר. מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״ וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״אָשִׁירָה לַה׳״, מֹשֶׁה אָמַר ״כִּי גָאֹה גָּאָה״, וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״כִּי גָאֹה גָּאָה״.
